original: de dag gis sems skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sems skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind does not arise from these.

original: bdun gang zhe na rkyen med pa las kyang /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na rkyen med pa las kyang /
translated: What are the seven?

original: sems mi skye ba dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / ma thob pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / spangs pa dang / 'gags pa dang / skyes pa las kyang sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: sems mi skye ba dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / ma thob pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / spangs pa dang / 'gags pa dang / skyes pa las kyang sems mi skye'o //
translated: The mind does not arise from the absence of conditions, from the absence of mental attention, from non-acquisition, from incompatibility, from rejection, from cessation, or from birth.

original: ji ltar na rkyen med pa las sems mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rkyen med pa las sems mi skye zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise from the absence of conditions?

original: nang gi skye mched mig nyams par gyur pa dang ; phyi rol gyi skye mched gzugs mi snang bar gyur pa dang / rgyas par phyi rol gyi skye mched chos kyi bar du mi snang bar gyur na /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched mig nyams par gyur pa dang ; phyi rol gyi skye mched gzugs mi snang bar gyur pa dang / rgyas par phyi rol gyi skye mched chos kyi bar du mi snang bar gyur na /
translated: When the internal sense-spheres, such as the eye, are impaired, and the external sense-spheres, such as form, are not present, up to the external sense-spheres such as mental objects are not present,

original: re zhig de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the eye consciousness that arises from them, and up to the mental consciousness that arises from them, do not occur.

original: de ltar na rkyen med pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rkyen med pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind does not arise from the absence of conditions.

original: ji ltar na yid la byed pa med pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yid la byed pa med pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise due to the absence of attention?

original: nang gi skye mched mig nyams par ma gyur cing /🔽phyi rol gyi skye mched gzugs kyang snang la /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched mig nyams par ma gyur cing / phyi rol gyi skye mched gzugs kyang snang la /
translated: When the internal sense base of the eye is not impaired,🔽and the external sense base of form appears,

original: rgyas par phyi rol gyi skye mched chos kyi bar yang snang du zin kyang /
analyzed: rgyas par phyi rol gyi skye mched chos kyi bar yang snang du zin kyang /
translated: and the external sense base of phenomena appears in detail,

original: de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa nye bar mi gnas na /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa nye bar mi gnas na /
translated: but attention that arises from that does not occur,

original: re zhig de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the eye consciousness that arises from that up to the mental consciousness that arises from that do not occur.

original: de ltar na yid la byed pa med pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yid la byed pa med pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus the mind does not arise due to the absence of attention.

original: ji ltar na ma thob pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma thob pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise due to non-acquisition?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'dod pa'i khams la rags par yid la byed cing bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi bar yid la byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'dod pa'i khams la rags par yid la byed cing bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi bar yid la byed la /
translated: Here, someone regards the desire realm as coarse and the first concentration as peaceful.

original: des bsam gtan dang po mngon du bya ba'i phyir lam shin tu kun du ma bsten ma bsgoms lan mang du ma byas te /
analyzed: des bsam gtan dang po mngon du bya ba'i phyir lam shin tu kun du ma bsten ma bsgoms lan mang du ma byas te /
translated: Because he has not fully relied on, cultivated, and repeated the path for actualizing the first absorption,

original: de goms par ma byas pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po mi thob ste /
analyzed: de goms par ma byas pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po mi thob ste /
translated: he does not attain the first absorption because he has not become habituated to it.🔽Since he has not attained it, the mind possessing the first absorption does not arise.

original: de ma thob pas bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa'i sems ni mi skye ba de lta bu dang / 'di ltar 'di na la las bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: de ma thob pas bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa'i sems ni mi skye ba de lta bu dang / 'di ltar 'di na la las bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: Similarly, here some mentally attend to the coarseness of the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, the fourth absorption, the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam shes @184a * //🔽mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched la rags par yid la byed cing bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam shes @184a * // mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched la rags par yid la byed cing bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
translated: the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la zhi bar yid la byed pa yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la zhi bar yid la byed pa yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and the sphere of nothingness, and they mentally attend to the calmness of the second absorption and so on up to the sphere of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs thams cad la sdug bsngal du yid la byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs thams cad la sdug bsngal du yid la byed cing /
translated: In this case, someone regards all the perishing aggregates as suffering.🔽They regard the cessation of the perishing aggregates as nirvana, which is peace.

original: 'jig tshogs 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar yid la byed la des 'jig tshogs thams cad spang ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir lam shin tu kun du ma bsten ma bsgoms /🔽lan mang du ma byas te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar yid la byed la des 'jig tshogs thams cad spang ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir lam shin tu kun du ma bsten ma bsgoms / lan mang du ma byas te /
translated: But they do not practice, cultivate, or repeat the path in order to abandon all the perishing aggregates and actualize nirvana.

original: de shin tu goms par ma byas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mngon du mi byed de /
analyzed: de shin tu goms par ma byas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mngon du mi byed de /
translated: Because they do not practice it a lot, they do not actualize nirvana in any way at all.

original: de mngon du ma byas pas kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa thams cad las sems shin tu rnam par grol ba mi skye ste /
analyzed: de mngon du ma byas pas kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa thams cad las sems shin tu rnam par grol ba mi skye ste /
translated: Because they do not actualize it, their minds are not completely liberated from all the fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, secondary mental afflictions, and entanglements.

original: de ltar na ma thob pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ma thob pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the mind does not arise from what has not been obtained.

original: ji ltar na mi mthun pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi mthun pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise from what is incompatible?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la bde ba myong bar 'gyur pa'i reg pas reg nas bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba'i bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i🔽tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pas mi skye ba dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pas reg na sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la bde ba myong bar 'gyur pa'i reg pas reg nas bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba'i bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pas mi skye ba dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pas reg na sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: Thus, when one is touched by contact that is to be experienced as pleasure, the mental faculty concomitant with the feeling of pleasure that experiences that feeling of pleasure is not generated because it is incompatible with the feeling of pain and the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la /
translated: Similarly, when one is touched by contact that is to be experienced as pain or that is to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain, the mental faculty concomitant with the feeling of pain or the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is not generated because it is incompatible with the feeling of pleasure and the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa de mi mthun pas mi skye ba dang / 'di ltar 'di na la la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris nas /🔽'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la /🔽gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i @184b sems gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pas mi skye ba dang / zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris nas zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa de mi mthun pas mi skye ba dang / 'di ltar 'di na la la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris nas / 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la / gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i @184b sems gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pas mi skye ba dang / zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris nas zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la /
translated: The mind associated with the feeling of pleasure or pain does not arise from that which is incompatible.🔽For example, when someone is bound by the fetter of attachment,🔽the mind associated with the fetter of aversion does not arise from the mind that is manifest as associated with the fetter of attachment, because they are incompatible.

original: 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar gyi sems gang yin pa de mi mthun pas mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar gyi sems gang yin pa de mi mthun pas mi skye ste /
translated: When someone is bound by the fetter of aversion, the mind associated with the fetter of attachment does not arise from the mind that is manifest as associated with the fetter of aversion, because they are incompatible.

original: de ltar na mi mthun pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi mthun pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind does not arise from that which is incompatible.

original: ji ltar na spangs pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na spangs pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise due to abandonment?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shin tu bsgoms pas 'dod chags ma lus par zad pa myong ba dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ma lus par zad pa myong ba de la /🔽'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de spangs pas mi skye ba dang / de la zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i spangs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shin tu bsgoms pas 'dod chags ma lus par zad pa myong ba dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ma lus par zad pa myong ba de la / 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de spangs pas mi skye ba dang / de la zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i spangs pa dang /
translated: Thus, here, someone who has cultivated the eightfold noble path well experiences the complete exhaustion of desire, the complete exhaustion of hatred, and the complete exhaustion of ignorance.

original: yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de spangs pas mi skye ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de spangs pas mi skye ste /
translated: The abandonment and complete knowledge of a mind possessing desire is non-arising due to abandonment. The abandonment and complete knowledge of a mind possessing hatred, possessing ignorance, or possessing any of the mental afflictions is non-arising due to abandonment.

original: de ltar na spangs pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na spangs pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind does not arise due to abandonment.

original: ji ltar na 'gags pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gags pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise due to cessation?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'am /
translated: Thus, in this world, some sentient beings are born among the gods who are devoid of discernment or

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
translated: they enter meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment or

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de la /
translated: they enter meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.🔽In these cases, the mind does not arise because it has ceased temporarily.

original: de'i dus skabs der 'gags pas sems mi skye ba dang / 'di ltar 'di na la la phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de la gtan 'gags pas sems mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i dus skabs der 'gags pas sems mi skye ba dang / 'di ltar 'di na la la phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de la gtan 'gags pas sems mi skye ste /
translated: In this world, some sentient beings attain nirvana in the element of nirvana that is without the remainder of the aggregates. In these cases, the mind does not arise because it has ceased permanently.

original: de ltar na 'gags pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'gags pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind does not arise from that which has ceased.

original: ji ltar na skyes pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na skyes pa las sems mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not arise from that which has arisen?

original: sems skyes pa thams cad ni da ltar skyes pa'i skad cig gi 'og tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas na /
analyzed: sems skyes pa thams cad ni da ltar skyes pa'i skad cig gi 'og tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas na /
translated: All minds that have arisen are subject to destruction in the moment that they have arisen.

original: de ni da ltar skyes pa yin pa'i phyir mi skye la /
analyzed: de ni da ltar skyes pa yin pa'i phyir mi skye la /
translated: Therefore, the mind that has arisen does not arise again because it has already arisen.

original: 'gags pa yang skyes zin pa kho na yin pas de nam yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'gags pa yang skyes zin pa kho na yin pas de nam yang mi skye ste /
translated: And that which has ceased is only that which has already arisen. It never arises.

original: de ltar na skyes pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skyes pa las sems mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind does not arise from that which has arisen.

original: rgyu bdun po de dag gis ni sems mi skye bar rig par bya'o //🔽de las bzlog pa'i rgyu bdun po 'di lta @185a * //
analyzed: rgyu bdun po de dag gis ni sems mi skye bar rig par bya'o // de las bzlog pa'i rgyu bdun po 'di lta @185a * //
translated: It should be understood that the mind does not arise due to these seven causes.🔽It should be understood that the mind arises due to the reverse of these seven causes, namely:

original: ste ; rkyen yod pa dang / yid la byed pa yod pa dang / thob pa dang / mthun pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa dag gis ni skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ste ; rkyen yod pa dang / yid la byed pa yod pa dang / thob pa dang / mthun pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa dag gis ni skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: the presence of conditions, the presence of attention, attainment, conformity, non-abandonment, non-cessation, and non-arising.

original: sems yod pa dang sems med pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: sems yod pa dang sems med pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
translated: The definitive explanation of the stages with and without mind is complete.

original: sa 'di gnyis kyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: sa 'di gnyis kyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
translated: The remainder of the treatise on the definitive explanation of these two stages is no longer extant.

original: // / thos pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni gnas lnga po lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje che ba dang /🔽bla na med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skyabs kyi 'os nye bar brtags nas skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / thos pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni gnas lnga po lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje che ba dang / bla na med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skyabs kyi 'os nye bar brtags nas skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: The investigation of the stage that arises from hearing is the fifth stage.

original: de la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba ni du /
analyzed: de la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba ni du /
translated: One should go for refuge after investigating the suitability of refuge by means of the five topics: the purity of physical action, the purity of verbal action, the purity of mental action, great compassion for sentient beings, and the possession of the unsurpassed.🔽How many are to be gone for refuge?

original: rgyu gang gis ni de dag nyid la skyabs su 'gro /🔽ji tsam gyis na skyabs su song ba yin /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis ni de dag nyid la skyabs su 'gro / ji tsam gyis na skyabs su song ba yin /
translated: By what cause does one go for refuge in them?🔽By how much does one go for refuge?

original: skyabs su song bas ji ltar ni bsgrub par bya ;
analyzed: skyabs su song bas ji ltar ni bsgrub par bya ;
translated: How does one practice by going for refuge?

original: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni gang yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni gang yin zhe na / smras pa / skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba ni gsum ste /
translated: What are the benefits of going for refuge?

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: The three to be gone for refuge are the Buddha and so on.

original: rgyu bzhis na de dag nyid la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis na de dag nyid la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
translated: One should go for refuge in them alone for four reasons:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shin tu dul ba'i bdag nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad du gdul bya 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / thugs rje che ba dang / zang zing gi mchod pa thams cad kyis mnyes par bya ba ma yin gyi bsgrub pa'i mchod pas mnyes par bya bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shin tu dul ba'i bdag nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad du gdul bya 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / thugs rje che ba dang / zang zing gi mchod pa thams cad kyis mnyes par bya ba ma yin gyi bsgrub pa'i mchod pas mnyes par bya bas so //
translated: The Tathagata is of a very disciplined nature, skilled in the means of disciplining disciples in every way, of great compassion, and is to be pleased by the worship of practice, not by all the worship of material things.

original: de lta bus bstan pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gang yin pa de yang de lta bu kho nas skyabs su 'os pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bus bstan pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gang yin pa de yang de lta bu kho nas skyabs su 'os pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma which is taught by such a one, and the Sangha of his disciples, should be known as worthy of refuge in just the same way.

original: rgyu bzhis na skyabs su song ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis na skyabs su song ba yin te /
translated: One becomes a person who has gone for refuge through four causes:

original: yon tan shes pa dang / khyad par shes pa dang / khas blangs pa dang / gzhan mi smra bas so //
analyzed: yon tan shes pa dang / khyad par shes pa dang / khas blangs pa dang / gzhan mi smra bas so //
translated: knowing the virtues, knowing the distinctions, accepting, and not speaking of other refuges.

original: skyabs su song ba'i yang dag pa'i bsgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i yang dag pa'i bsgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The correct practice of one who has gone for refuge should be known as fourfold:

original: skyes bu dam pa legs par bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bya ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa legs par bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bya ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'o //
translated: Relying on holy persons, listening to the holy Dharma, proper attention, and practicing the Dharma in accordance with what one has heard.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa ni rnam par bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa ni rnam par bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Correct practice should be understood as fourfold:

original: dbang po mi rgod par bya ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blang bar bya @185b ba dang ; sems can la snying rje bar bya ba dang / dus dus su dkon mchog mchod pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po mi rgod par bya ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blang bar bya @185b ba dang ; sems can la snying rje bar bya ba dang / dus dus su dkon mchog mchod pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: not letting the senses run wild, taking up the bases of training, having compassion for sentient beings, and from time to time making offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i phan yon ni bzhi ste /
translated: The benefits of taking refuge are four:

original: bsod nams rgya chen po 'thob pa dang / dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po 'thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa dang / rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams rgya chen po 'thob pa dang / dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po 'thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa dang / rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: one gains great merit, one gains great joy and delight, one gains concentration, and one gains purification.

original: gzhan yang phan yon bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang phan yon bzhi ste /
translated: There are four further benefits:

original: srung ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / log par mos pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs pa 'thob pa dang / dam pa yang dag par song ba skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi nang du bgrang bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: srung ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / log par mos pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs pa 'thob pa dang / dam pa yang dag par song ba skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi nang du bgrang bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will be counted among the holy beings who have attained the highest state,

original: ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang / bstan pa la mngon par dad pa'i lha rnams kyi yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang / bstan pa la mngon par dad pa'i lha rnams kyi yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: they will be pleasing and delightful to the teachers, to those who practice pure conduct and to the gods who have faith in the teachings.

original: che ge mo zhig bdag cag skyabs su 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa'i skyabs su 'gro ba de dag dang ldan zhing lan mang du gnas pas na de ni bdag cag gi grogs su 'gyur bar 'ong ngo snyam nas yid
analyzed: che ge mo zhig bdag cag skyabs su 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa'i skyabs su 'gro ba de dag dang ldan zhing lan mang du gnas pas na de ni bdag cag gi grogs su 'gyur bar 'ong ngo snyam nas yid
translated: They will think, “So and so, who has gone for refuge and has been reborn here after dying from there, is endowed with the same refuge that we have and has often practiced it. He will be a friend to us.”

original: dga' zhing ched du brjod pa ched du rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' zhing ched du brjod pa ched du rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Thinking thus, they will be delighted and will exclaim.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams kyi khyad par ni rnam pa drug gis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams kyi khyad par ni rnam pa drug gis rig par bya ste /
translated: The distinction of the Jewels of Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha is to be understood in six ways:

original: mtshan nyid dang / phrin las dang / mos pa dang / sgrub pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / bsod nams 'phel bas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / phrin las dang / mos pa dang / sgrub pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / bsod nams 'phel bas so //
translated: by nature, by activity, by faith, by practice, by recollection, and by the increase of merit.

original: de la mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni rang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni rang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among them, the distinction by nature is that the Jewel of Buddha has the nature of self-enlightenment.

original: chos dkon mchog ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos dkon mchog ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Jewel of Dharma has the nature of the result of enlightenment.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog ni gzhan gyi man ngag gis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog ni gzhan gyi man ngag gis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Jewel of Saṅgha has the nature of correct practice through the instructions of others.

original: de la phrin las las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni lung legs par 'bogs pa'i phrin las can no //
analyzed: de la phrin las las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog ni lung legs par 'bogs pa'i phrin las can no //
translated: Among them, the distinction by activity is that the Jewel of Buddha has the activity of imparting the scriptures well.

original: chos dkon mchog ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba la dmigs pa'i phrin las can yin no //
analyzed: chos dkon mchog ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba la dmigs pa'i phrin las can yin no //
translated: The Jewel of the Dharma has the function of eliminating the afflictions and suffering.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog ni spro ba mngon par 'phel bar byed pa'i phrin las can yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog ni spro ba mngon par 'phel bar byed pa'i phrin las can yin no //
translated: The Jewel of the Community has the function of increasing enthusiasm.

original: de la mos pa las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la ni bsnyen bkur la gus pas zhen par bya'o //🔽chos dkon mchog la ni mngon du @186a * //
analyzed: de la mos pa las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la ni bsnyen bkur la gus pas zhen par bya'o // chos dkon mchog la ni mngon du @186a * //
translated: The difference in devotion is that one should be devoted to the Jewel of the Buddha with devotion to service.

original: bya ba la gus pas zhen par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba la gus pas zhen par bya'o //
translated: One should be devoted to the Jewel of the Dharma with devotion to realization.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la ni chos mthun pa'i dngos pos lhan cig 'grogs pa la gus pas zhen par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la ni chos mthun pa'i dngos pos lhan cig 'grogs pa la gus pas zhen par bya'o //
translated: One should be devoted to the Jewel of the Community with devotion to companionship through the concordance of Dharma.

original: de la sgrub pa las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la ni mchod pa dang rim gro nye bar sgrub pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la ni mchod pa dang rim gro nye bar sgrub pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The difference in practice is that one should practice with the Jewel of the Buddha by accomplishing worship and service.

original: chos dkon mchog la ni rnal 'byor gyi sbyor ba goms par bya bas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dkon mchog la ni rnal 'byor gyi sbyor ba goms par bya bas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should practice with the Jewel of the Dharma by cultivating the practice of yoga.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la ni chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod thun mong gis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la ni chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod thun mong gis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The Sangha Jewel is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Buddha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.

original: de la rjes su dran pa las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang rnam pa gzhan dag gis rjes su dran par bya la /🔽chos dkon mchog kyang rnam pa gzhan dag gis rjes su dran par bya /
analyzed: de la rjes su dran pa las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang rnam pa gzhan dag gis rjes su dran par bya la / chos dkon mchog kyang rnam pa gzhan dag gis rjes su dran par bya /
translated: The distinction of the Jewel of the Dharma is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Sangha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Buddha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Dharma is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Sangha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Buddha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang rnam pa gzhan dag gis rjes su dran par bya ba ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang rnam pa gzhan dag gis rjes su dran par bya ba ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The distinction of the Jewel of the Dharma is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Sangha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bya'o //🔽de la bsod nams 'phel ba las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la ni sems can gcig gi dbang du byas pa'i bsod nams mchog 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bya'o // de la bsod nams 'phel ba las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la ni sems can gcig gi dbang du byas pa'i bsod nams mchog 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction of the Jewel of the Buddha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Dharma is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Sangha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Buddha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.

original: chos dkon mchog la ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa'i bsod nams mchog 'phel bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog la ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa'i bsod nams mchog 'phel bar 'gyur ro /
translated: The distinction of the Jewel of the Dharma is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Sangha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Buddha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Dharma is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.🔽The distinction of the Jewel of the Sangha is to be accomplished by the common enjoyment of the Dharma and material things.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la ni sems can mang po'i dbang du byas pa'i bsod nams mchog 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la ni sems can mang po'i dbang du byas pa'i bsod nams mchog 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The jewel of the Saṅgha is the increase of the supreme merit of many sentient beings.

original: bram ze'i chos las dge sbyong gi chos rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: bram ze'i chos las dge sbyong gi chos rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The Dharma of the ascetics is superior to the Dharma of the brahmins in five ways.

original: chos rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five ways?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: thos pa'i chos dang / tshul khrims kyi chos dang / yongs su gzung ba'i chos dang ; longs spyod kyi chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos kyis so //
analyzed: thos pa'i chos dang / tshul khrims kyi chos dang / yongs su gzung ba'i chos dang ; longs spyod kyi chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos kyis so //
translated: the Dharma of learning, the Dharma of morality, the Dharma of possession, the Dharma of enjoyment, and the Dharma of realization.

original: de la bram ze rnams kyis thos pa'i chos ni don ngan pa dang / gzhan dag la bstan par mi 'os pa dang / tshig dang yi ge gsang pa yin pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bram ze rnams kyis thos pa'i chos ni don ngan pa dang / gzhan dag la bstan par mi 'os pa dang / tshig dang yi ge gsang pa yin pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma of learning of the brahmins is bad because it has a bad meaning, it is not suitable to be taught to others, and its words and letters are secret.

original: dge sbyong gis thos pa'i chos ni de las bzlog pa yin pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis thos pa'i chos ni de las bzlog pa yin pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma of learning of the ascetics should be known as good because it is the opposite of that.

original: de la bram ze rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi chos ni gang la ji ltar 'tshe ba gang rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bram ze rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi chos ni gang la ji ltar 'tshe ba gang rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma of the Brahmins is bad because it permits any harm whatsoever.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul khrims kyi chos ni de las bzlog pa yin pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul khrims kyi chos ni de las bzlog pa yin pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma of the ascetics is good because it is the opposite of that.

original: de la bram ze rnams kyis yongs @186b su bzung ba'i chos ni bar du gcod pa zhing gi dngos po dang khang khyim gyi dngos po dang / tshong khang gi dngos po la sogs pa yongs su zin pa'i phyir dang / bu dang chung ma dang bran mo la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bram ze rnams kyis yongs @186b su bzung ba'i chos ni bar du gcod pa zhing gi dngos po dang khang khyim gyi dngos po dang / tshong khang gi dngos po la sogs pa yongs su zin pa'i phyir dang / bu dang chung ma dang bran mo la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma of the Brahmins is bad because it is the cause of the non-abandonment of the world, since it is the cause of the possession of fields, houses, shops, etc., and of the possession of wives, children, servants, etc.

original: dge sbyong rnams kyis yongs su bzung pa'i chos ni sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba'i chos ma gtogs ba gzhan med pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams kyis yongs su bzung pa'i chos ni sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba'i chos ma gtogs ba gzhan med pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma of the ascetics is good because it is the cause of the abandonment of the world, since it is the cause of the non-possession of all that.

original: de la bram ze rnams kyi longs spyod kyi chos ni bar du gcod pa spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / rgyal mtshan la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir dang / bro gar mkhan dang / zlos gar mkhan dang /🔽bzhad gad mkhan dang / 'jo sgeg mkhan la sogs pa la lta bas yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir dang / 'khrig pa'i chos kyi longs spyod pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bram ze rnams kyi longs spyod kyi chos ni bar du gcod pa spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / rgyal mtshan la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir dang / bro gar mkhan dang / zlos gar mkhan dang / bzhad gad mkhan dang / 'jo sgeg mkhan la sogs pa la lta bas yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir dang / 'khrig pa'i chos kyi longs spyod pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
translated: The brahmins' enjoyment of the Dharma is bad because it is for the enjoyment of the Dharma of enjoyment, such as incense, garlands, ointments, victory banners and so on, and for the enjoyment of the Dharma of entertainment, such as watching dancers, actors,🔽comedians, and those who entertain through flirtation and so on, and for the enjoyment of the Dharma of sexual intercourse.

original: dge sbyong gi longs spyod kyi chos ni kha na ma thob med pa thos pa dang ; bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas longs spyod pa'i phyir bzang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi longs spyod kyi chos ni kha na ma thob med pa thos pa dang ; bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas longs spyod pa'i phyir bzang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the Dharma by the virtuous is good because it is for the enjoyment of the Dharma of enjoyment, such as the absence of evil, and for the enjoyment of the Dharma of entertainment, such as the knowledge arisen from hearing, contemplation and meditation.

original: de la bram ze rnams kyis rtogs pa'i chos ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten mtha' yin pa dang / yang phyir bzlog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bram ze rnams kyis rtogs pa'i chos ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten mtha' yin pa dang / yang phyir bzlog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ngan pa yin no //
translated: The brahmins’ doctrine of the realization of Brahman is inferior because it is the world of Brahman, which is a limit, because it is subject to reversal, because it is defiled, and because it is associated with suffering.

original: dge sbyong gis rtogs pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa mtha' yin pa dang / yang phyir mi ldog pa dang / gcig tu dri ma med pa dang / gcig tu bde ba yin pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis rtogs pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa mtha' yin pa dang / yang phyir mi ldog pa dang / gcig tu dri ma med pa dang / gcig tu bde ba yin pas bzang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The doctrine of the realization of the śramaṇas is known as superior because it is nirvāṇa, which is a limit, because it is not subject to reversal, because it is absolutely stainless, and because it is absolutely blissful.

original: 'dod pa tshol ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa tshol ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The pursuit of desire is of five types:

original: yongs su bzung ba tshol ba dang / longs spyod tshol ba dang / rtsed mo dang dga' ba tshol ba dang / kun shes pa nyams pa tshol ba dang / grags pa dang sgra tshol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba tshol ba dang / longs spyod tshol ba dang / rtsed mo dang dga' ba tshol ba dang / kun shes pa nyams pa tshol ba dang / grags pa dang sgra tshol ba'o //
translated: the pursuit of possessions, the pursuit of enjoyments, the pursuit of play and pleasure, the pursuit of the degeneration of understanding, and the pursuit of fame and reputation.

original: sred pa tshol ba yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sred pa tshol ba yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The pursuit of craving is of five types:

original: chos nyid kyis tshol ba dang / smon pas tshol ba dang / kun du rmongs pas tshol ba dang ; skyo bas tshol ba dang / so sor brtags pas tshol ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis tshol ba dang / smon pas tshol ba dang / kun du rmongs pas tshol ba dang ; skyo bas tshol ba dang / so sor brtags pas tshol ba'o //
translated: the search for reality, the search for aspiration, the search for confusion, the search for weariness, and the search for discernment.

original: tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The search for pure conduct is also fivefold:

original: btsal ba tsam tshol ba dang / de 'thob par 'gyur ba tshol ba dang / 'phral du 'thob pa tshol ba dang / de'i 'og tu 'thob pa tshol ba dang / so sor brtags te @187a * //🔽phyis 'thob pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: btsal ba tsam tshol ba dang / de 'thob par 'gyur ba tshol ba dang / 'phral du 'thob pa tshol ba dang / de'i 'og tu 'thob pa tshol ba dang / so sor brtags te @187a * // phyis 'thob pa tshol ba'o //
translated: the search for mere searching, the search for the attainment of that, the search for immediate attainment, the search for attainment after that, and the search for attainment after analysis.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang brdar btags pa tshol ba dang / don dam pa tshol ba dang / de yongs su brtags pa tshol ba dang / 'khrugs pa med pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang bcas pa tshol ba dang / de'i thabs med pa tshol ba dang thabs dang bcas pa yongs su brtags nas tshol ba'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang brdar btags pa tshol ba dang / don dam pa tshol ba dang / de yongs su brtags pa tshol ba dang / 'khrugs pa med pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang bcas pa tshol ba dang / de'i thabs med pa tshol ba dang thabs dang bcas pa yongs su brtags nas tshol ba'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: Another classification is the search for conventional designations, the search for the ultimate, the search for the investigation of those, the search for the unconfused, the search for the confused, the search for the absence of its means, and the search for the investigation of that with means.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir rig pa'i gnas lnga bstan pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir rig pa'i gnas lnga bstan pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: The five sciences are taught in the Abhidharmasamuccaya.

original: nang gi rig pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad dang bstan bcos thams cad dang gzhung lugs thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rig pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad dang bstan bcos thams cad dang gzhung lugs thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang gtso bo yin no //
translated: Among all the sciences, all the treatises, and all the scriptural systems, the inner science is the best and the most important.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par dag pa'i gzhis rnam par dag pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gzhis rnam par dag pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the basis for purification, and it is the meaning of purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don thams cad bsdus pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis don de tshar mi chod pas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / don de nyid la 'jug sla bas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don thams cad bsdus pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis don de tshar mi chod pas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / don de nyid la 'jug sla bas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it includes all the meanings of affliction and purification, because that meaning is purified since it cannot be refuted by any opponent, because it is purified since it is easy to enter that meaning,

original: zhugs pa rnams kyi sgrub pa chud mi za bas rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhugs pa rnams kyi sgrub pa chud mi za bas rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and because it is purified since the practice of those who have entered it is not wasted.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' de yang mdor bsdu na tshul drug gis khong du chud par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' de yang mdor bsdu na tshul drug gis khong du chud par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the word of the Buddha should be understood in brief through six methods.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang 'thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang 'thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: They are: the method of the meaning of reality, the method of attainment, the method of explanation, the method of the avoidance of the two extremes, the method of the inconceivable, and the method of the intention.

original: de la tshul snga ma gsum ni phyi ma gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshul snga ma gsum ni phyi ma gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The first three methods should be understood through the latter three.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: They are: the method of the meaning of reality should be understood through the method of the avoidance of the two extremes;

original: 'thob pa'i tshul ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i tshul ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: the method of attainment should be understood through the method of the inconceivable;

original: bshad pa'i tshul ni dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshul ni dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and the method of explanation should be understood through the method of the intention.

original: de la de kho na'i don nyid tshul yin pas /
analyzed: de la de kho na'i don nyid tshul yin pas /
translated: Here, the meaning of reality is the method,

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul de dgongs pa nyid tshul yin pas dgongs pa'i tshul gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul de dgongs pa nyid tshul yin pas dgongs pa'i tshul gyi bar du'o //
translated: Since the mode of that reality is the very purport, it is the mode of purport.

original: tshul gyi don ni de dang de la ma nor ba nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gyi don ni de dang de la ma nor ba nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of mode is that which is nonerroneous, as it is, and unperverted, in regard to this and that.

original: de la de kho na'i don ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /🔽'jig rten gyi grags pa dang / rigs @187b pa'i grags pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / rnam par bzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de la de kho na'i don ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste / 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang / rigs @187b pa'i grags pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / rnam par bzhag pa dang /
translated: In brief, the meaning of reality should be understood as sixfold:

original: rnam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: the mundane, the philosophical, the domain of the wisdom that is purified of the obscurations of the passions, the domain of the wisdom that is purified of the knowable obscurations, and the established and the unestablished.

original: de la de kho na rnam pa bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de kho na rnam pa bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification of the four realities is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as previously taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i de kho na gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i de kho na gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of the established?

original: smras pa / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: He replied: “The four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal du rnam par gzhag pa dang / lam gyi bar du lam du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal du rnam par gzhag pa dang / lam gyi bar du lam du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Suffering is established as suffering, and the path is established as the path.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar na de ni kun rdzob rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar na de ni kun rdzob rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is established by three types of conventional truth:

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob dang / rigs pa'i kun rdzob dang / rtogs pa'i kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob dang / rigs pa'i kun rdzob dang / rtogs pa'i kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: conventional truth of the world, conventional truth of reasoning, and conventional truth of realization.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis ni khang khyim dang / bum pa dang / dmag dang / nags tshal dang / grangs la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bdag dang sems can la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pas rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis ni khang khyim dang / bum pa dang / dmag dang / nags tshal dang / grangs la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bdag dang sems can la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pas rnam par 'jog go //
translated: In that regard, it is established by the conventional truth of the world through the establishment of houses, pots, armies, forests, numbers, and so on, and through the establishment of self, sentient beings, and so on.

original: rigs pa'i kun rdzob kyis ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pas rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: rigs pa'i kun rdzob kyis ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pas rnam par 'jog go //
translated: It is established by the conventional truth of reasoning through the establishment of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

original: rtogs pa'i kun rdzob kyis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhi dang / de dag gi gnas rnam par gzhag pa rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i kun rdzob kyis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhi dang / de dag gi gnas rnam par gzhag pa rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The conventional of realization establishes the four fruits of stream-entry, etc., and the states of the candidate for stream-entry, etc.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: These fruits and states are established in four ways.

original: ji skad bstan pa rnam pa gsum dang / don dam pa'i kun rdzob kyis don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa rnam pa gsum dang / don dam pa'i kun rdzob kyis don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The three as they have been taught, and the ultimate truth are established by the ultimate conventional.

original: de'i don ni so so rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin gyi de shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa nyid la brten te rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de'i don ni so so rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin gyi de shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa nyid la brten te rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The meaning of the ultimate is not established as an object of knowledge, because it is the domain of individual intuitive wisdom. It is established in accordance with the arising of that knowledge.

original: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i de kho na gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i de kho na gang zhe na /
translated: What is reality that is not established?

original: smras pa / chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the suchness of all things.

original: 'thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is attainment?

original: 'thob pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Attainment is fourfold:

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa 'thob pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa 'thob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'thob pa dang / theg pa chen po 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa 'thob pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa 'thob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'thob pa dang / theg pa chen po 'thob pa'o //
translated: and the attainment of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa 'thob @188a * //
analyzed: de la sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa 'thob @188a * //
translated: The attainment of the maturation of sentient beings’ karma

original: pa ni ; las dge ba dag mi dge bar mngon par 'du byed pas /
analyzed: pa ni ; las dge ba dag mi dge bar mngon par 'du byed pas /
translated: is the attainment of the maturation of sentient beings’ karma through the maturation of their virtuous and non-virtuous karma.

original: las bdag gir bya ba nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba nyid la brten nas /
translated: Based on the fact that karma is one’s own,

original: rgyu des 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar sems can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa dang / rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba gang yin pa'o ;🔽/ de la nyan thos kyi theg pa 'thob pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rgyu des 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar sems can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa dang / rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba gang yin pa'o ; / de la nyan thos kyi theg pa 'thob pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: through that cause, the maturation of sentient beings is actualized in the five transmigrations of cyclic existence, and the individual experience of that maturation.

original: dge sbyong gi rgyan gyi bar la brten nas rnam pa lnga 'theb pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi rgyan gyi bar la brten nas rnam pa lnga 'theb pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the Śrāvaka Vehicle is the attainment of the five aspects based on going for refuge and so on up to the ornaments of a monk.

original: sa 'thob pa dang / shes pa 'thob pa dang / dad pa 'thob pa dang / 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / yon tan 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'thob pa dang / shes pa 'thob pa dang / dad pa 'thob pa dang / 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / yon tan 'thob pa'o //
translated: 1. the attainment of the stages, 2. the attainment of knowledge, 3. the attainment of faith, 4. the attainment of the fruits, and 5. the attainment of the qualities.

original: de la sa 'thob pa ni sa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sa 'thob pa ni sa gsum ste /
translated: The attainment of the stages refers to the three stages:

original: mthong ba'i sa dang / bsgom pa'i sa dang / mthar thug pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa dang / bsgom pa'i sa dang / mthar thug pa'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of seeing, the stage of cultivation, and the ultimate stage.

original: de la shes pa 'thob pa ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa 'thob pa ni /
translated: The attainment of knowledge refers to

original: shes pa dgu ste /🔽'di lta ste /🔽chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang ; lam shes pa dang / de dag gi rjes las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa dgu ste / 'di lta ste / chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang ; lam shes pa dang / de dag gi rjes las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa dang /
translated: the nine knowledges:

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: 1. the knowledge of the teaching, 2. the knowledge of the subsequent, 3. the knowledge of suffering, 4. the knowledge of the origin of suffering, 5. the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, 6. the knowledge of the path, 7. the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequently to those, 8. the knowledge of destruction, and 9. the knowledge of non-production.

original: de la dad pa 'thob pa ni shes nas dad pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: de la dad pa 'thob pa ni shes nas dad pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: The attainment of faith refers to the four kinds of faith that arise from understanding.

original: de la 'bras bu thob pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu thob pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi po dag go //
translated: The attainment of the fruits refers to the four fruits of the religious life.

original: de la yon tan 'thob pa ni tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon gnas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /🔽mngon par shes pa 'thob ste /🔽de dag thams cad kyi rnam par dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa dag thob pa'i thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / thar pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de la yon tan 'thob pa ni tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon gnas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa 'thob ste / de dag thams cad kyi rnam par dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o // nyan thos kyi theg pa dag thob pa'i thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / thar pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin no //
translated: The qualities obtained are immeasurable, the liberations, the spheres of mastery, the spheres of totality, the unhindered knowledges, the discriminations, the superknowledges, the applications of mindfulness, etc.🔽The causes for obtaining the Śrāvaka Vehicle are the roots of virtue of the mundane path and the supramundane path.

original: de la rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'thob pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'thob pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The causes for obtaining the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle are the roots of virtue of the mundane path and the supramundane path.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob pa sngon du btang ba dang / rtogs pa sngon du btang ba dang / sngon du ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob pa sngon du btang ba dang / rtogs pa sngon du btang ba dang / sngon du ma btang ba'o //
translated: The first two are the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: de la 'thob pa dang po gnyis kyis ni rang rgyal ba rnams su 'gyur ro //🔽tha mas ni bse ru lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'thob pa dang po gnyis kyis ni rang rgyal ba rnams su 'gyur ro // tha mas ni bse ru lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The last is the rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: de la theg @188b pa chen po 'thob pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de la theg @188b pa chen po 'thob pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The Mahayana is eightfold:

original: sems bskyed pa 'thob pa dang / snying rje 'thob pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po 'thob pa dang / sa 'thob pa dang / dpag tu med pa lnga la de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'thob pa dang / snying rje 'thob pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po 'thob pa dang / sa 'thob pa dang / dpag tu med pa lnga la de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: the attainment of the generation of the resolve, the attainment of compassion, the attainment of the perfections, the attainment of the means of gathering disciples, the attainment of the spiritual levels, the attainment of the realization of thusness in the five incalculable aeons,

original: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'thob pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa 'thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'thob pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa 'thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: the attainment of the inconceivable powers, and the attainment of the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Their analysis is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva stages should be understood as previously indicated.

original: de la bshad pa ni mdor bsdu na gnas gsum gyis bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni mdor bsdu na gnas gsum gyis bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The explanation is summarized in three topics:

original: sde snod bsdu ba dang / ma mo bsdu ba dang / de gnyi ga bsdu bas so //
analyzed: sde snod bsdu ba dang / ma mo bsdu ba dang / de gnyi ga bsdu bas so //
translated: the summary of the scriptures, the summary of the metrical verses, and the summary of both.

original: de la sde snod bsdu ba ni nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / theg pa chen po'i sde snod do //
analyzed: de la sde snod bsdu ba ni nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / theg pa chen po'i sde snod do //
translated: The summary of the scriptures is the scriptural collection of the disciples and the scriptural collection of the universal vehicle.

original: de la ma mo bsdu ba ni sa bcu bdun dang / bsdu ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la ma mo bsdu ba ni sa bcu bdun dang / bsdu ba bzhi'o //
translated: The summary of the metrical verses is the seventeen stages and the four summaries.

original: de la de gnyi ga bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de la de gnyi ga bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary of both is as follows:

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, it is tenfold:

original: bden pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa bshad pa dang / spang ba bshad pa dang / mngon du bya ba bshad pa dang / bsgom pa bshad pa dang / de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba bshad pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa bshad pa dang / spang ba bshad pa dang / mngon du bya ba bshad pa dang / bsgom pa bshad pa dang / de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba bshad pa dang /
translated: the explanation of the characteristics of the truths, the explanation of thorough knowledge, the explanation of abandonment, the explanation of realization, the explanation of cultivation, the explanation of the classification of those very things, the explanation of the aids to penetration, the explanation of the path of vision, the explanation of the path of development, and the explanation of the culmination of the practice.

original: de dag nyid kyi gnas dang gnas pa'i 'brel pa bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi gnas dang gnas pa'i 'brel pa bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: the explanation of the relationship between the basis and what is based on it, the explanation of the factors that are obstacles to complete understanding, etc., the explanation of the factors that are favorable to complete understanding, etc., the explanation of the disadvantages and benefits of complete understanding, etc.,

original: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang phan yon bshad pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang phan yon bshad pa ste /
translated: and the explanation of the disadvantages and benefits of complete understanding, etc.

original: de ltar na de ni sde snod bsdu ba dang / ma mo bsdu ba thams cad sdud par byed pas ma mo bsdus pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bcu gnyis yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni sde snod bsdu ba dang / ma mo bsdu ba thams cad sdud par byed pas ma mo bsdus pa zhes bya'o // yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bcu gnyis yod do //
translated: Thus, it is called the summary of the summary of the summary because it summarizes all the summaries of the summary.🔽Moreover, in brief, there are twelve kinds of explanations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: dngos po bshad pa dang / ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa dang / rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / drang ba'i don bshad pa dang / nges pa'i don bshad pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po bshad pa dang / ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa dang / rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / drang ba'i don bshad pa dang / nges pa'i don bshad pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa dang /
translated: The explanation of the entities, the explanation of the synonyms, the explanation of our own system of investigation, the explanation of the other system of investigation, the explanation of the interpretable meaning, the explanation of the definitive meaning, the explanation of the conventional truth,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa dang / gsang ba bshad pa dang / rnam par phye ba bshad pa dang / lan gdab pa'i dngos po bshad @189a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa dang / gsang ba bshad pa dang / rnam par phye ba bshad pa dang / lan gdab pa'i dngos po bshad @189a * //
translated: the explanation of the ultimate truth, the explanation of the secret, the explanation of the distinctions, the explanation of the things to be answered,

original: pa dang / lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa'o //
translated: and the explanation of the things not to be answered.

original: de la dngos po bshad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams so sor bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos po bshad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams so sor bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the entities is the individual explanations of the phenomena of form and so forth, and of eye and so forth.

original: de la ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the synonyms is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dbang po dang bden pa'i ming dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i ming dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dbang po dang bden pa'i ming dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i ming dang /
translated: The names of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, the possible and the impossible, the faculties, the truths, the close placements of mindfulness, and so on,

original: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa la sogs pa'i ming gis ming gi rnam grangs dpag tu med pa dag rgya cher bshad pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de la rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba la brten nas /
analyzed: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa la sogs pa'i ming gis ming gi rnam grangs dpag tu med pa dag rgya cher bshad pa gang yin pa'o // de la rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba la brten nas /
translated: the names of the physical and the nonphysical, the demonstrable and the indemonstrable, the impeded and the unimpeded, and so on, are explained in the sūtras by the Bhagavat Buddhas using countless synonyms.

original: mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa bshad pa dang yang dag par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa bshad pa dang yang dag par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The explanation of our own system is the explanation and correct explanation of the sūtras, the scriptural basket of the discourses, the scriptural basket of melodious praises, the scriptural basket of prophecies, and so on, based on the Compendium of Explanations.

original: de la gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun la brten nas phas kyi rgol ba tshar bcad pa dang / rang gi smra ba'i gzhung gzugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun la brten nas phas kyi rgol ba tshar bcad pa dang / rang gi smra ba'i gzhung gzugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the examination of other systems is the refutation of opponents based on the seven kinds of logical reasons and the establishment of one’s own doctrine.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of logical reasons are as follows:

original: smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal ce ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba chad pas bcad pa dang / smra ba las 'byung ba dang / smra ba gces spras la dgos pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal ce ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba chad pas bcad pa dang / smra ba las 'byung ba dang / smra ba gces spras la dgos pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: the statement, the opponent in a debate, the subject of a debate, the ornament of a statement, the punishment for a false statement, the outcome of a statement, and the necessity of cherishing a statement.

original: de la drang ba'i don bshad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa gang dag bshad la /
analyzed: de la drang ba'i don bshad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa gang dag bshad la /
translated: The explanation of the interpretable meaning is the teaching of the scriptures of the Bhagavat, such as the Sutras, the Ge- yas, and the Nidanas,

original: don rnam par ma phye ba drang bar bya dgos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don rnam par ma phye ba drang bar bya dgos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: which must be interpreted because their meaning has not been made explicit.

original: de la nges pa'i don bshad pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nges pa'i don bshad pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the ultimate should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the conventional truth is as follows:

original: tshig gi lam gyis brjod pa gang ci yang rung ste de thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi lam gyis brjod pa gang ci yang rung ste de thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is expressed by verbal expressions is all conventional truth.

original: ming dang 'du shes dang brjod pa'i dbang du bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ming dang 'du shes dang brjod pa'i dbang du bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the domain of names, concepts, and expressions.

original: mtshan ma dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa gang ci yang rung ba de yang kun rdzob kyi @189b bden pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa gang ci yang rung ba de yang kun rdzob kyi @189b bden pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is a sign, a name, or a concept is also conventional truth.

original: de la don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the ultimate truth is as follows: It is the explanation of the four noble truths, suchness, the perfect end, and the dharma-element.

original: de la gsang ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gsang ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the secret is as follows:

original: phal cher ni nyan thos kyi sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: phal cher ni nyan thos kyi sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is for the most part the explanation of the Sūtra Piṭaka.

original: / de la rnam par phye ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / de la rnam par phye ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the distinction is as follows:

original: phal cher ni theg pa chen po'i sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher ni theg pa chen po'i sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and most of the rest is the explanation of the Mahayana Canon.

original: de la lan gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lan gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the subject matter to be answered is as follows:

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi po dag bshad pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi po dag bshad pa ste /
translated: It is the explanation of the four summaries of the Dharma,

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: that all conditioned things are impermanent,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: up to that nirvana is peace, and whatever is similar to that.

original: de la lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the subject matter not to be answered is as follows:🔽If asked, is the world permanent?🔽one should not answer, but should not answer by saying,

original: 'jig rten rtag gam zhes dris na de ni bdag gis lan mi gdab bo zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du dris na /
