analyzed: 'jig rten rtag gam zhes dris na de ni bdag gis lan mi gdab bo zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du dris na /
translated: or if asked, does the Tathagata exist after death or not exist after death, or both exist after death and not exist after death, or neither exist after death nor not exist after death?

original: de ni bdag gis lan mi gdab bo zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis lan mi gdab bo zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: one should not answer, but should not answer by saying,

original: de la lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the things to which one should not reply is to be understood through four causes.

original: med pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is a question to which one should not reply because it does not exist.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ci bdag phung po rnams las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin nam rtag gam mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci bdag phung po rnams las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin nam rtag gam mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Is the self different from the aggregates, or not different, or permanent, or impermanent?”

original: don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a question to which one should not reply because it is meaningless.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: shing sha pa'i lo ma'i dpe'i mdo las /
analyzed: shing sha pa'i lo ma'i dpe'i mdo las /
translated: as in the Sutra of the Parable of the Log:

original: ngas ni chos 'di snyed cig mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud kyang ma bstan te //
analyzed: ngas ni chos 'di snyed cig mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud kyang ma bstan te //
translated: “I have understood and realized this Dharma, but I have not taught it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos de dag ni don dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos de dag ni don dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because those dharmas are not meaningful.”

original: zab pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: zab pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a question to which one should not reply because it is profound.🔽For example,

original: 'di lta ste bdag yod dam zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bdag yod dam zhes 'dri na /
translated: if one asks, “Does the self exist?”

original: phung po rnams la bdag tu 'dzin par gyur tam phung po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa yod par 'dzin na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang / bdag med dam zhes 'dri na skyes bu'i tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa 'dzin par gyur na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang /🔽de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa @190a * //
analyzed: phung po rnams la bdag tu 'dzin par gyur tam phung po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa yod par 'dzin na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang / bdag med dam zhes 'dri na skyes bu'i tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa 'dzin par gyur na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa @190a * //
translated: If one were to ask, “Is there no self?” and grasp that as deprecating the convention of a person, it would be improper to respond.

original: shi phan chad yod dam zhes bya ba nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri na zab pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shi phan chad yod dam zhes bya ba nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri na zab pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, if one were to ask, “Does the Tathāgata exist after death?” up to “Does he neither exist nor not exist after death?” it would be improper to respond because it is profound.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa la lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa la lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There is also no response to the presentation of the characteristics of thatness.

original: chos gang dag gi de bzhin nyid de ci chos de dag las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na lan mi 'debs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag gi de bzhin nyid de ci chos de dag las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na lan mi 'debs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, if one were to ask, “Is thatness of any phenomenon other than those phenomena or not other?” it would be improper to respond.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid de de ni gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin par rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid de de ni gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin par rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristic is not different from that, and it is not non-different.

original: gzhan yang lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the subject that is not to be answered should be understood through four reasons:

original: mu stegs can rnams kyi bshad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyi bshad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained by the tīrthikas, because it is not proper, because it has a meaning, and because it is only a basis for debate.

original: don dang mi ldan pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaningless should be understood through two reasons:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bsam pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba bsam pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bsam pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba bsam pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of cause and effect, and because it is devoid of defilement and purification.

original: mtha' gnyis rnam par spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis rnam par spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the avoidance of the two extremes?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: This is to be seen in brief as six aspects.🔽The extreme of superimposition on what does not exist and the extreme of denial with respect to what does exist are to be abandoned.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang ; yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / rtag par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / chad par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang ; yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / rtag par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / chad par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang /
translated: The extreme of grasping at permanence and the extreme of grasping at annihilation are to be abandoned.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / bdag nyid ngal bar sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / bdag nyid ngal bar sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang pa'o ;
translated: The extreme of application to the pleasures of desire and the extreme of application to self-mortification are to be abandoned.

original: / de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni sngar de dang de dag tu bstan pa kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni sngar de dang de dag tu bstan pa kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Their divisions are to be understood just as they have been explained in the above chapters.

original: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the inconceivable?

original: mdor bsdu na bsam gyis mi khyab pa drug ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bsam gyis mi khyab pa drug ste /
translated: In brief, the inconceivable is sixfold.

original: bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul lo //
analyzed: bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul lo //
translated: the thought of self, the thought of sentient beings, the thought of the world, the thought of the maturation of sentient beings’ karma, the thought of the meditative object of contemplatives, and the thought of the object of the Buddhas.

original: de la bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa ni lta ba la brten na ni @190b bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa ni lta ba la brten na ni @190b bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yin no //
translated: The thought of self, the thought of sentient beings, and the thought of the world are inconceivable if they are based on views.

original: lta ba la ma brten na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lta ba la ma brten na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yin no //
translated: If they are not based on views, they are conceivable.

original: de la bdag la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la bdag la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The thought of self is as follows: In this world, someone, based on the view of the transitory aggregates, thinks:🔽“Did I exist in the past or not?🔽And so on, in detail, up to the three times.

original: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dus gsum rnams su yang de bzhin pa dang / de bzhin du bdag ni gzugs can yin te /
analyzed: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dus gsum rnams su yang de bzhin pa dang / de bzhin du bdag ni gzugs can yin te /
translated: And so on, in detail, up to “I am formless.”

original: de phan tshun 'du shes can nam /
analyzed: de phan tshun 'du shes can nam /
translated: They would be mutually conceptual or🔽nonconceptual,🔽or they would be neither conceptual nor nonconceptual.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'am /🔽'du shes yod pa yang ma yin /🔽'du shes med pa yang ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / gzugs can ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs can ma yin pa de yang de bzhin te /🔽rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'am / 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin / 'du shes med pa yang ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / gzugs can ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs can ma yin pa de yang de bzhin te / rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Just as it is for those with form, so it is for those without form.🔽This is elaborated in the Net of Brahma Sutra,

original: tshangs pa'i dra ba'i mdo las /🔽ji skad du rtag par smra ba rnams dang / de bzhin du chad par smra ba rnams dang / tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das par smra ba rnams dang / sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dra ba'i mdo las / ji skad du rtag par smra ba rnams dang / de bzhin du chad par smra ba rnams dang / tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das par smra ba rnams dang / sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa rnams dang /
translated: which states:🔽Those who propound permanence, those who propound annihilation, those who propound nirvana in this life, those who speculate about the past, those who speculate about the future,

original: ci rigs par sbyar bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par sbyar bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: those who speculate about the present, those who speculate about the self, those who speculate about sentient beings, those who speculate about life, those who speculate about the nourished, those who speculate about the world, those who speculate about the cosmos, those who speculate about the high and the low, those who speculate about the high, the low, and the even, those who speculate about the past, the future, and the present, those who speculate about the three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about the three times and the non-three times, those who speculate about

original: de bzhin du srog de lus de yin no snyam pa dang / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan yin no snyam pa dang / 'di nyid zad pa yin no snyam pa dang / gnyis su med do snyam pa dang / gzhan ma yin no snyam pa dang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du srog de lus de yin no snyam pa dang / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan yin no snyam pa dang / 'di nyid zad pa yin no snyam pa dang / gnyis su med do snyam pa dang / gzhan ma yin no snyam pa dang ;
translated: Likewise, it is the thought that life is the body, that life is one thing and the body another, that this is exhausted, that it is not dual, that it is not other,

original: bdag gi bdag ni ma tshang ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag ni ma tshang ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: and that the self of the self is not incomplete.

original: de la sems can la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la sems can la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: With regard to the thought of sentient beings, it is the thought that arises in this way:

original: sems can ga las byung /
analyzed: sems can ga las byung /
translated: “Where do sentient beings come from?

original: sems can gyi byed pa po su yin /
analyzed: sems can gyi byed pa po su yin /
translated: Who is the creator of sentient beings?

original: sems can gang gi bar du 'gro /
analyzed: sems can gang gi bar du 'gro /
translated: To what end do sentient beings go?

original: sems can gang du 'gag par 'gyur snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gang du 'gag par 'gyur snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Where do sentient beings cease?”

original: de la 'jig rten la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: With regard to the thought of the world, it is the thought that arises in this way:

original: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bya'o //
translated: “The world is eternal,” and so on.

original: chos nyid las brtsams nas kyang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: chos nyid las brtsams nas kyang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Also, with regard to reality, he thinks,

original: bdag gi chos nyid dang / sems can gyi chos nyid dang / 'jig rten gyi chos nyid 'di ci las de ltar byung snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: bdag gi chos nyid dang / sems can gyi chos nyid dang / 'jig rten gyi chos nyid 'di ci las de ltar byung snyam du sems shing /
translated: How is it that the reality of myself, the reality of sentient beings, and the reality of the world have come to be like this?

original: chos kyi rigs pa kho nas mi 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rigs pa kho nas mi 'jug pa yin te /
translated: He does not engage in this reflection by means of the principles of the Dharma alone.

original: de'i phyir de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la sems pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la sems @191a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la sems pa zhes bya'o // de la sems @191a * //
translated: Therefore, this is called the reflection on the inconceivable.

original: can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa ni rnam pa bzhis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa ni rnam pa bzhis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: The reflection on the maturation of sentient beings is inconceivable in four ways:

original: gnas dang dngos po dang / rgyu dang rnam par smin pa las so //
analyzed: gnas dang dngos po dang / rgyu dang rnam par smin pa las so //
translated: in terms of place, substance, cause, and maturation.

original: de la bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul ni rnam pa gsum gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul ni rnam pa gsum gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: The object of reflection of the contemplatives is inconceivable in three ways:

original: de bzhin nyid zad pa'i don dang / dbang bsgyur ba dang / zag pa zad pa'i dbyings yang dag par 'grub pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid zad pa'i don dang / dbang bsgyur ba dang / zag pa zad pa'i dbyings yang dag par 'grub pas so //
translated: in terms of the meaning of the extinction of reality, mastery, and the attainment of the realm of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ni rnam pa lngas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ni rnam pa lngas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: The buddhas' buddha intuition is inconceivable in five ways.

original: ji skad bstan pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / gzhan gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / gzhan gnyis kyis te /
translated: It is inconceivable in the three ways already mentioned and in two other ways:

original: sgrib pa med pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mdzad pas so //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mdzad pas so //
translated: it is inconceivable in terms of the absence of obscurations and in terms of the performance of the aims of beings.

original: de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intention?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: In brief, it is of sixteen kinds.

original: yang dag par ston pa'i dgongs pa dang / 'dun pa bzlog pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad pa'i dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par ston pa'i dgongs pa dang / 'dun pa bzlog pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad pa'i dgongs pa dang /
translated: The intention to reveal, the intention to turn away attachment, the intention to engage in correct taking up, the intention to encourage, the intention to delight, the intention to liberate, the intention to settle, the intention to resolve doubts, the intention to reveal the ultimate, the intention to reveal the interpretable meaning, the intention to reveal the definitive meaning, the intention to reveal the condensed meaning, the intention to reveal the implied meaning, the intention to reveal the therapeutic, the intention to reveal the antidote, and the intention to reveal the abandonment.

original: gzud pa'i dgongs pa dang / the tshom gcad pa'i dgongs pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / don gzhan dang 'brel pa'i dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: gzud pa'i dgongs pa dang / the tshom gcad pa'i dgongs pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / don gzhan dang 'brel pa'i dgongs pa dang /
translated: the intention to introduce, the intention to resolve doubts, the intention to ripen, the intention to bring about concentration, the intention to bring about liberation, the intention to relate to another meaning,

original: rtogs par byed pa rnams la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa'i dgongs pa dang / smra ba po la nyan pa rnams ri mo cher bskyed par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / chos kyi tshul 'jug par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa rnams la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa'i dgongs pa dang / smra ba po la nyan pa rnams ri mo cher bskyed par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / chos kyi tshul 'jug par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang /
translated: the intention to generate irreproachable joy and supreme joy in those who understand, the intention to generate great respect in the listeners for the teacher, the intention to engage in the way of the Dharma,

original: dge ba mang bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba mang bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: the intention to increase virtue, and the intention to overcome all signs.

original: de la ji ltar na mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the way of reality by means of the method of abandoning the two extremes?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas lam gyi bden pa'i bar du rnam par gzhag pa la ni mdor bsdu na sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa bzhis sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas lam gyi bden pa'i bar du rnam par gzhag pa la ni mdor bsdu na sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa bzhis sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' yin te /
translated: The extremes of superimposition are fourfold in the establishment of the truths, from the truth of suffering up to the truth of the path.

original: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / rtag par sgro 'dogs pa dang / gtsang bar sgro 'dogs pa dang / bde bar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / rtag par sgro 'dogs pa dang / gtsang bar sgro 'dogs pa dang / bde bar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: They are superimposition of self, superimposition of permanence, superimposition of purity, and superimposition of pleasure.

original: de dag ni phyin ci log bzhi yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni phyin ci log bzhi yin te /
translated: These are the four errors.

original: de dag gi gnyen @191b por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / shes pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen @191b por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / shes pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness and the four knowledges are taught as their antidotes.

original: rgyu gang gis na bdag tu lta ba dang bdag tu sgro 'dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na bdag tu lta ba dang bdag tu sgro 'dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what cause does the view of self and the superimposition of self arise?

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar rgyas par sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar rgyas par sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as extensively taught above in the stage with investigation and analysis.

original: 'di ltar der ji ltar bdag mi rigs pa de ltar rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar der ji ltar bdag mi rigs pa de ltar rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught there in detail how the self is illogical.

original: yang mdor bsdu na bdag ni phung po rnams las skye ba dang mtshan nyid dang las las kyang don gzhan du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed rnams ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gnas pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang mdor bsdu na bdag ni phung po rnams las skye ba dang mtshan nyid dang las las kyang don gzhan du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed rnams ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gnas pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in brief, it should be understood that there is no self because a self is not perceived as being different from the aggregates in terms of substance, characteristic, or activity, and because the aggregates are not perceived as being of the same essential nature as a self.

original: rtag pa nyid kyang ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyang ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fact that a self is not permanent should be understood as it was explained previously.

original: mi sdug pa nyid rnam pa drug kyang nyan thos kyi sar rgya cher bstan zin to //
analyzed: mi sdug pa nyid rnam pa drug kyang nyan thos kyi sar rgya cher bstan zin to //
translated: The six aspects of the unpleasant nature of the body have already been explained in detail in the Sravakabhumi.

original: sdug bsngal nyid rnam pa gsum yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid rnam pa gsum yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The three aspects of the suffering nature of the body are as follows:

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar bstan zin to //
translated: The aspects of the body that are associated with conceptualization and discernment have already been explained in the Sravakabhumi.

original: de la skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' ni bden pa bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa de dag nyid la mtshan nyid des med pa nyid du 'dzin pa dang / med pa nyid du yongs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' ni bden pa bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa de dag nyid la mtshan nyid des med pa nyid du 'dzin pa dang / med pa nyid du yongs su ston pa'o //
translated: The extreme of denial is the belief that the truths, which are established by the characteristics of the truths, do not exist by that nature, and the teaching that they do not exist by that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar gang bden pa de dag la skur pa 'debs pa des ni tshad ma gsum po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la yang skur pa btab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang bden pa de dag la skur pa 'debs pa des ni tshad ma gsum po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la yang skur pa btab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those who deprecate the truths also deprecate the three valid cognitions: direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: de lta bas na de ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the extreme of deprecation.

original: gang mtha' gnyis la skur pa mi 'debs pa de ni bden pa de dag la mos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ; rim gyis rnam par dag pa thob par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mtha' gnyis la skur pa mi 'debs pa de ni bden pa de dag la mos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ; rim gyis rnam par dag pa thob par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not deprecate the two extremes will have faith in the truths, will understand them, and will gradually attain purity.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of suffering?

original: smras pa / skye ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of disease, the suffering of death, the suffering of association with what is disliked, the suffering of separation from what is loved, the suffering of not obtaining what is desired, in brief, the five aggregates of attachment are suffering, as has been taught in detail.

original: mdor bsdu na skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: mdor bsdu na skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: In brief, the defiled state of birth, as it has been taught, is called the truth of suffering.

original: / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of origination?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa thams cad ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa thams cad ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin no //
translated: It is all the defilements of passion and action as they have been explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor ni sred pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor ni sred pa yin par bstan te /
translated: The Lord has taught craving to be the most important of these.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu rnams @192a * //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu rnams @192a * //
translated: The principal causes

original: ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as before.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of cessation?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su gtugs nas spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su gtugs nas spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the complete forsaking of all the defilements.

original: spangs pa de yang rnam pa brgyad kyis te /
analyzed: spangs pa de yang rnam pa brgyad kyis te /
translated: This forsaking is of eight kinds:

original: snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: it should be understood as before.

original: de la sred pa zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba des ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la sred pa zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba des ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the expressions “the exhaustion of craving” and “the forsaking of passion” indicate the realm of nirvana without the remainder of aggregates.

original: 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba des ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba des ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su bstan to //
translated: The words cessation and nirvana indicate the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the path?

original: smras ba / tshogs kyi lam gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i lam gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras ba / tshogs kyi lam gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i lam gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, and the path of purification.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yongs su gzung ba las brtsams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yongs su gzung ba las brtsams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One taught the eightfold noble path primarily from the perspective of the fruits of the spiritual life.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam ni rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam ni rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The path of accumulation should be understood as having thirteen aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: They are the same as those taught in the Sravakabhumi.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni gtsor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni gtsor 'di lta ste /
translated: The path of preparation is primarily as follows:

original: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin no //
translated: The path of application is the factors of enlightenment such as the applications of mindfulness in the stage of heat, peak, patience, and supreme mundane qualities.

original: rnam pa dag pa'i lam ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa kho na'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dag pa'i lam ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa kho na'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin no //
translated: The pure path is the factors of enlightenment included in the paths of seeing, cultivation, and culmination.

original: mthar thug par gyur pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i lam gang yin pa de yang lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par gyur pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i lam gang yin pa de yang lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: The path of accomplishing the perfected qualities is also counted as the truth of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: The bodhisattvas' path of application should be understood as being included in the six perfections.

original: / rnam par dag pa'i lam ni gtso bor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: / rnam par dag pa'i lam ni gtso bor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The pure path is primarily included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad kyang bsgom pa'i grangs su mi 'gro ba ni med do //🔽de la mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes gang gsungs pa de @192b la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad kyang bsgom pa'i grangs su mi 'gro ba ni med do // de la mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes gang gsungs pa de @192b la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is nothing that is not included in the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment.🔽In brief, the five appropriative aggregates are suffering.

original: yid kyis rnam par gtan la dbab par phung po la mkhas pa las brtsams te bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis rnam par gtan la dbab par phung po la mkhas pa las brtsams te bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of the five appropriative aggregates should be understood as taught in the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, beginning with the expertise in the aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The truth of suffering and the truth of origination are also summarized in three aspects:

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa'i bye brag gis ni mtha' yas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa'i bye brag gis ni mtha' yas pa yin no //
translated: They are limitless due to the distinctions of the limitless world systems in the ten directions.

original: de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The truths of cessation and of the path should be understood in the same way as antidotes.

original: bden pa de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa'i go rims bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽bden pa de dag las brtsams /🔽bden pa de dag la brten /🔽bden pa de dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: bden pa de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa'i go rims bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o // bden pa de dag las brtsams / bden pa de dag la brten / bden pa de dag la gnas nas /
translated: The order in which the truths are established should be understood as above.

original: gang zag bcu gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag bcu gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The thirteen persons are established on the basis of the truths.

original: gang zag bcu gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag bcu gsum gang zhe na /
translated: The thirteen persons are:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i slob pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i slob pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i slob pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i slob pa dang /
translated: the ordinary person in the realm of desire, the ordinary person in the realm of form, the ordinary person in the formless realm, the person in training in the realm of desire, the person in training in the realm of form,

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i slob pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi slob pa dang ; gzugs na spyod pa'i mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mi slob pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i slob pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi slob pa dang ; gzugs na spyod pa'i mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mi slob pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas dang /
translated: the learner in the formless realm, the nonlearner in the desire realm, the nonlearner in the form realm, the nonlearner in the formless realm, the pratyekabuddha in the desire realm,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o ;
translated: the bodhisattva in the desire realm, the bodhisattva in the form realm, and the inconceivable tathagata.

original: / gang zag de dag gi mngon par 'du byed pa yang rig par bya /
analyzed: / gang zag de dag gi mngon par 'du byed pa yang rig par bya /
translated: The formation of these persons should be understood.

original: sgrib pa dang / sems dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / dbang po dang / khams dang / mos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / skye pa dang / bag chags dang / tshogs kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang / sems dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / dbang po dang / khams dang / mos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / skye pa dang / bag chags dang / tshogs kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: The obscurations, the mind, the afflictions, karma, the faculties, the realms, interest, aspiration, latent propensities, birth, habitual tendencies, and the accumulations should be understood.

original: de la mngon par 'du byed pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mngon par 'du byed pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: Formation is of twelve kinds.

original: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / de spel ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / de spel ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang /
translated: the performance of virtue, the performance of non-virtue, the performance of the indeterminate, the performance of going forth, the performance of its increase,

original: de bsrung ba mngon @193a * //
analyzed: de bsrung ba mngon @193a * //
translated: the performance of its protection,

original: par 'du byed pa dang / skye ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / thar pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang / dbang po sbyor ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang ;
analyzed: par 'du byed pa dang / skye ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / thar pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang / dbang po sbyor ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang ;
translated: the performance of birth, the performance of freedom from passion, the performance of liberation, the performance of the application of the faculties, the performance of the accomplishment of manifest action,

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: and the performance of the benefit of others.

original: de la sgrib pa yang rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa yang rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve obscurations to these.

original: las kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of karma is as follows:

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i las byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i las byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because one commits the five heinous actions.

original: bag chags kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of habitual tendencies is as follows:

original: sngon nyes par byas pa'i las la goms pa'i bag chags nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon nyes par byas pa'i las la goms pa'i bag chags nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is due to the habitual tendencies of former misdeeds.

original: bag med pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bag med pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of heedlessness is as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa 'byor pa chen po la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa 'byor pa chen po la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those who are heedless, who are endowed with and enjoy sense pleasures, and who abide in great prosperity.

original: chod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of interruption is as follows:

original: sgrib pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung bas sems bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung bas sems bsgribs pa'o //
translated: It is the obscuration of the mind by any of the five obscurations.

original: le lo'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: le lo'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of laziness is as follows:

original: le lo'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas sems kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: le lo'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas sems kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: It is the envelopment of the mind by the secondary defilement of laziness.

original: bar chad kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bar chad kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of obstacles is as follows:

original: bar chad rnam pa bcu gcig las gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad rnam pa bcu gcig las gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the presence of any of the eleven obstacles.

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of birth is as follows:

original: mi khom par skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi khom par skye ba'o //
translated: It is birth in an unfavorable state.

original: mi skye ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of non-birth is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the non-appearance of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: mos pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of interest is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yod kyang log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yod kyang log par lta ba'o //
translated: Even when a Buddha appears, one has wrong views.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of afflictions is as follows.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba rnams kyi sems gang las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba rnams kyi sems gang las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The mind of those who are liberated by wisdom is liberated from what?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of meditative absorption is as follows.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba rnams kyi sems gang las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba rnams kyi sems gang las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The mind of those who are liberated from both aspects is liberated from what?

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of objects of knowledge is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs gang las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs gang las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The mind of the Tathagatas is liberated from what?

original: de la sems ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'o //
translated: In brief, the mind is of two kinds: obscured and unobscured.

original: nyon mongs pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, afflictions are of two kinds:

original: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal lo //
translated: entanglements and latent tendencies.

original: las kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: las kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, karma is of two kinds:

original: sems pa dang bsam pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang bsam pa'o //
translated: intention and the intended.

original: dbang po yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dbang po yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The faculties are also, in brief, of two types:

original: rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma @193b yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma @193b yin pa'o //
translated: those that are compatible with purification and those that are not compatible with purification.

original: dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du khams dang mos pa dang bsam pa dang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du khams dang mos pa dang bsam pa dang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The elements, inclinations, and intentions should be understood in the same way as the faculties.

original: de dag gi bye brag ni /
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag ni /
translated: The differences among them are as follows:

original: dbang po ni 'bras bur gyur pa yin la /🔽khams ni rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po ni 'bras bur gyur pa yin la / khams ni rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The faculties are the results.🔽The elements are the causes.

original: mos pa ni rgyur gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: mos pa ni rgyur gyur pa yin la /
translated: The inclinations are the causes.

original: bsam pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The intentions are the results.

original: bag la nyal yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Latent tendencies are also, in brief, of two types:

original: yang dag par gzhom par bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhom par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gzhom par bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhom par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that are to be overcome and those that are not to be overcome.

original: skye ba yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Birth is also, in brief, of two types:

original: mi khom par skye ba dang / khom par skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi khom par skye ba dang / khom par skye ba'o //
translated: birth in an unfavorable state and birth in a favorable state.

original: bag chags kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The latent impressions should also be understood as twofold:

original: de ma thag tu skye ba'i bag chags dang / sngon skyes pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de ma thag tu skye ba'i bag chags dang / sngon skyes pa'i bag chags so //
translated: those that arise immediately and those that arise previously.

original: tshogs ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The accumulations should be understood as threefold:

original: log pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / ma nges pa'i tshogs so /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / ma nges pa'i tshogs so /
translated: the accumulation of those who are destined for error, the accumulation of those who are destined for the authentic, and the accumulation of those who are not destined.

original: de la log pa nyid du nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la log pa nyid du nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who are destined for error are of two kinds:

original: rang bzhin gyis log pa nyid du nges pa dang / sbyor bas log pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis log pa nyid du nges pa dang / sbyor bas log pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: those who are naturally destined for error and those who are destined for error through application.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / sbyor bas yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / sbyor bas yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: Those who are destined for the authentic are of two kinds: those who are naturally destined for the authentic and those who are destined for the authentic through application.

original: ma nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: ma nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Those who are not destined are of two kinds:

original: rang bzhin gyis ma nges pa dang / sbyor bas ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma nges pa dang / sbyor bas ma nges pa'o //
translated: those who are naturally not destined and those who are not destined through application.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gsum po de dag gis gang zag bcu gsum po dag ci rigs par rgya cher rig par bya'o //🔽gang dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa de dag thams cad mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gsum po de dag gis gang zag bcu gsum po dag ci rigs par rgya cher rig par bya'o // gang dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa de dag thams cad mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa yin la /
translated: These thirteen types of formation should be understood as applying to the thirteen types of person.🔽Do all those who form wholesome actions not form unwholesome actions?

original: gang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa de dag thams cad kyang dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa de dag thams cad kyang dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do all those who do not form unwholesome actions form wholesome actions?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin la /
translated: There are those who form wholesome actions

original: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa mi ldan pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa mi ldan pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: but do not form unwholesome actions.

original: las dkar gnag rnam par smin pa dkar gnag can mngon par 'du byed pa'i dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las dkar gnag rnam par smin pa dkar gnag can mngon par 'du byed pa'i dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This refers to those who form wholesome actions that are white and black with white and black karmic maturation.

original: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa yin la /
translated: There are those who do not form unwholesome actions🔽but do form wholesome actions.

original: dge ba ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: The unwholesome is the performance of the indeterminate.

original: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed @194a * //🔽pa dang yang mi ldan la /
analyzed: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed @194a * // pa dang yang mi ldan la /
translated: The wholesome is the performance of the wholesome.

original: dge ba yang yin pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba yang yin pa ni /
translated: The wholesome is not the performance of the unwholesome.

original: dkar ba rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang / las zad par bya ba'i phyir mi dkar ba rnam par smin pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dkar ba rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang / las zad par bya ba'i phyir mi dkar ba rnam par smin pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wholesome is the performance of the action that is not white, but has a white maturation, in order to exhaust the action.

original: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba ma yin la dge ba ma yin pa ni gnag pa rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba ma yin la dge ba ma yin pa ni gnag pa rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The unwholesome is not the performance of the wholesome, but the performance of the action that is black, and has a black maturation.

original: mi dge ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa mngon par 'du byed pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa mngon par 'du byed pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The performance of the unwholesome and the performance of the indeterminate should be understood in the same way, according to the circumstances.

original: gang las kyi sgrib pa dang ldan pa de bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: gang las kyi sgrib pa dang ldan pa de bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang yang ldan la /
translated: The one who is endowed with the obscuration of action is also endowed with the obscuration of the residues.

original: gang bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang ldan pa de las kyi sgrib pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang ldan pa de las kyi sgrib pa dang yang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who possesses the obscuration that is the instinct also one who possesses the obscuration that is karma?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: las kyi sgrib pa dang ldan la bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa dang ldan la bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: One possesses the obscuration that is karma but not the obscuration that is the instinct.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la las ni tshe 'di la mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas shing bsags la ;
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la las ni tshe 'di la mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas shing bsags la ;
translated: For example, someone here commits and accumulates the five heinous actions in this life,

original: de tshe rabs snga ma la de'i tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa'i las sdig pa can gyi mi dge ba gang yin pa de lta bu ma byas ma bsags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de tshe rabs snga ma la de'i tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa'i las sdig pa can gyi mi dge ba gang yin pa de lta bu ma byas ma bsags pa lta bu'o //
translated: but does not commit and accumulate the nonvirtuous karma that is a heinous action, which is an obstacle to the ārya path in this life, in a previous life.

original: bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang ldan pa las kyi sgrib pa dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang ldan pa las kyi sgrib pa dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: One possesses the obscuration that is the instinct but not the obscuration that is karma.

original: de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: This is the opposite of the first possibility.

original: gnyi ga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: One possesses both.

original: gang gis tshe 'di la yang mtshams med pa lnga'i las dag byas shing bsags la /
analyzed: gang gis tshe 'di la yang mtshams med pa lnga'i las dag byas shing bsags la /
translated: One who commits and accumulates the five heinous actions in this life.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la de'i tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa'i las sdig pa can mi dge ba gang yin pa de lta bu byas shing bsags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la de'i tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa'i las sdig pa can mi dge ba gang yin pa de lta bu byas shing bsags pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the case of someone who has done and accumulated evil deeds that obstruct the noble path in this life, and who has done and accumulated similar evil deeds in previous lives.

original: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a person who is not endowed with either.

original: de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the above.

original: de la rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth that is not established?

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
translated: It is the suchness of phenomena, the nature of the perfected, the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the object of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: de la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' gang zhe na /
translated: What is the extreme of superimposition?

original: smras pa / chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: smras pa / chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is said that the nature of phenomena can be summarized as three kinds:

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the imagined nature, the dependent nature, and the perfected nature.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni tha snyad las byung ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni tha snyad las byung ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: The imagined nature is whatever is conventionally arisen,

original: kun brtags @194b shing ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags @194b shing ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely the establishment of names and signs by imagination.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /🔽gzhan gyi stobs kyis byung ba'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa ste / gzhan gyi stobs kyis byung ba'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: The dependent nature is whatever is dependently arisen,🔽because it is a thing that arises by the power of another,

original: rang gi stobs kyis byung ba'i dngos po yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi stobs kyis byung ba'i dngos po yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not a thing that arises by its own power.

original: de la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: The perfected nature is just as it was explained before.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni sgro btags pa'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni sgro btags pa'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the imagination of what is unreal should be understood as the extreme of superimposition with regard to the imagined nature in the dependent nature and the perfected nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i bdag nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i bdag nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, its reality is not suitable as its own nature.

original: ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar ni 'di lta ste /
translated: How it is not suitable is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / de rnam par gtan la dbab pa las rgya cher bstan cing ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / de rnam par gtan la dbab pa las rgya cher bstan cing ston to //
translated: It is taught extensively in the Bodhisattva Levels and in its commentary.

original: yang mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis mi rung ste /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, in brief, it is not suitable for three reasons:

original: ming dang brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming dang brjod pa med par de'i blo mi skye ba dang / ming dang brjod pa ni don la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming dang brjod pa med par de'i blo mi skye ba dang / ming dang brjod pa ni don la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the establishment of many different kinds of names and expressions, the nonarising of the cognition of that without names and expressions, and the engagement of names and expressions in objects.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa la med do zhes rang gi mtshan nyid la skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa la med do zhes rang gi mtshan nyid la skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The extreme of denial is the denial of the reality of the dependent nature and the fully present nature, which is the denial of their own characteristics.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis rnam par spang pa'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis rnam par spang pa'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the meaning of reality by the method of avoiding the two extremes.

original: gzhan yang 'thob pa'i tshul dang bshad pa'i tshul gnyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang dgongs pa'i tshul gnyis kyis ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'thob pa'i tshul dang bshad pa'i tshul gnyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang dgongs pa'i tshul gnyis kyis ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the two methods of attainment and explanation should be understood by the two methods of the inconceivable and the intentional.

original: 'dir don gzhan dang 'brel pa'i dgongs pa zhes gang gsungs pa don gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir don gzhan dang 'brel pa'i dgongs pa zhes gang gsungs pa don gang zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the intention that is related to another meaning?

original: smras pa / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi don ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi don ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: It is said: The meaning of the collections of names, collections of phrases, and collections of letters is related to another meaning.

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang sgra ji bzhin spangs nas don gyi khyad par gzhan nyid ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa'i dgongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang sgra ji bzhin spangs nas don gyi khyad par gzhan nyid ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa'i dgongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Although it is not literal, still, having abandoned the literal, another specific meaning is called the intention related to another meaning.

original: de la mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud na thob par bya ba'i don 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud na thob par bya ba'i don 'thob bo //
translated: When one has understood the meaning of reality by the method of avoiding the two extremes, one obtains the goal to be obtained.

original: thob par bya ba'i don thob na de las gzhan pa'i 'thob pa'i tshul yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par 'gyur ro //🔽bshad pa'i @195a * //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don thob na de las gzhan pa'i 'thob pa'i tshul yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par 'gyur ro // bshad pa'i @195a * //
translated: When one has obtained the goal to be obtained, one also understands the method of obtaining the other inconceivable things.

original: tshul thams cad ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul thams cad ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: All the methods of explanation are understood by the method of the transcendent awareness of the transcendent lords, the buddhas.

original: de yang ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par ro //
translated: And that is done in whatever way is appropriate.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa ni rnam par lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa ni rnam par lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The entry into the faultless state of understanding the meaning of reality should be understood as fivefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang shas cher bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang shas cher bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: entering the faultless state without being free from attachment, entering the faultless state with a great deal of freedom from attachment, entering the faultless state with freedom from attachment, entering the faultless state of a pratyekabuddha,🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'o//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'o//
translated: 1) entering the faultless state without being free from passion, 2) entering the faultless state with a predominance of passion, 3) entering the faultless state free from passion, 4) entering the faultless state of the pratyekabuddhas, and 5) entering the faultless state of the bodhisattvas.

original: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of negative reflex action?

original: mdor bsdu na las su mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na las su mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: In brief, it is the characteristic of unserviceability.

original: las su mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: las su mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: This characteristic of unserviceability should be understood as having five aspects:

original: lci ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / sra ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sgyid lug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dbang bsgyur ba med pas mi bzod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lci ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / sra ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sgyid lug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dbang bsgyur ba med pas mi bzod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of heaviness, the characteristic of rigidity, the characteristic of obscuration, the characteristic of depression, and the characteristic of non-endurance due to lack of mastery.

original: mtshan nyid de dag yod na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang mthun par gnas shing /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag yod na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang mthun par gnas shing /
translated: If these characteristics exist, then one will remain in harmony with the collection of afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mi mthun par gnas pas na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mi mthun par gnas pas na /
translated: And since one will remain in a state that is not in harmony with the factors of purification,

original: de'i phyir las su mi rung ba zhes bya'o ;🔽/ gang gi tshe rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa bden pa nyid du gsungs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir las su mi rung ba zhes bya'o ; / gang gi tshe rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa bden pa nyid du gsungs pa de'i tshe /
translated: this is why it is called “unserviceability.”

original: ci'i phyir rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
translated: When the four truths that are presented are taught to be real, then why are the four truths that are not presented also taught?

original: smras pa / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa med na rnam par grol ba gnyis po /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa med na rnam par grol ba gnyis po /
translated: It is said: If the four truths that are not presented did not exist, then the two types of liberation—

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba mi rung ste /
translated: liberation from the bondage of signs and liberation from the bondage of negative propensities—would be impossible.

original: 'di ltar gang la la rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa dag la spyod pa de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la la rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa dag la spyod pa de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma la spyod pa yin te /
translated: Because all those who engage with the four truths that are presented engage with signs.

original: mtshan ma la spyod na mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su mi 'grol la mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su ma grol na gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang yongs su mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: mtshan ma la spyod na mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su mi 'grol la mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su ma grol na gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang yongs su mi 'grol lo //
translated: If one practices with signs, one is not liberated from the bondage of signs. If one is not liberated from the bondage of signs, one is not liberated from the bondage of negative conditioning.

original: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la spyod pa ni mtshan ma la spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la spyod pa ni mtshan ma la spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: One who practices with the non-established truth does not practice with signs.

original: mtshan ma la mi spyod na mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su 'grol la /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mi spyod na mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su 'grol la /
translated: If one does not practice with signs, one is liberated from the bondage of signs.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las @195b yongs su grol na gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang yongs su 'grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las @195b yongs su grol na gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang yongs su 'grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one is liberated from the bondage of signs, one is also liberated from the bondage of negative conditioning.

original: gal te rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa kho nas 'ching ba las rnam par 'grol zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa kho nas 'ching ba las rnam par 'grol zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If one is liberated from bondage and becomes pure only through the non-established truth,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
translated: why is the established truth taught?

original: smras pa / tshogs kyi lam dang sbyor ba'i lam rnam par dag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / tshogs kyi lam dang sbyor ba'i lam rnam par dag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Response: Because it purifies the path of accumulation and the path of preparation.

original: gal te mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sems kyi spyod pa kho nas 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las 'grol zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sems kyi spyod pa kho nas 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las 'grol zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na smras pa /
translated: If one is liberated from the two types of bondage and becomes purified only through the practice of a mind that possesses signs, what is wrong with that?

original: gang la la shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te /
analyzed: gang la la shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te /
translated: Response: If it is reasonable that all those who, with a mind of meditative equipoise, rely on the fourth meditative concentration and

original: bden pa la dmigs pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la 'jug pa de dag thams cad 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las 'grol zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: bden pa la dmigs pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la 'jug pa de dag thams cad 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las 'grol zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
