translated: engage in the virtuous qualities that are conducive to penetrative insight by observing the four truths are liberated from the two types of bondage and become purified,

original: rnam par dag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par dag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not reasonable that they do not become purified.

original: de'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gnyis kyi bye brag kyang med par 'gyur pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gnyis kyi bye brag kyang med par 'gyur pa'i rigs na /
translated: It is also not reasonable that there would be no distinction between the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i bye brag yod pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i bye brag yod pas /
translated: because there is a difference between the one with signs and the one without signs.

original: de'i phyir yang mi rung ngo //🔽dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mi rung ngo // dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Therefore, it is also not tenable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The increase of the great elements of the sense faculties is fivefold:

original: zas kyis rgyas pa dang / gnyid log pas rgyas pa dang / ya nga ba spangs pas rgyas pa dang / tshangs par spyod pas rgyas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zas kyis rgyas pa dang / gnyid log pas rgyas pa dang / ya nga ba spangs pas rgyas pa dang / tshangs par spyod pas rgyas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: increase through food, increase through sleep, increase through abandoning fear, increase through celibacy, and increase through meditative concentration.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rgyas pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rgyas pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, these are two types of increase:

original: nye bar ston pas rgyas pa dang / gnod pa med pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar ston pas rgyas pa dang / gnod pa med pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: increase through demonstration and increase through non-harm.

original: de la dang pos ni nye bar ston pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni nye bar ston pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first is increase through demonstration.

original: bzhis ni gnod pa med pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhis ni gnod pa med pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: The other four are increase through non-harm.

original: de la nye bar ston pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar ston pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Among them, demonstration is fourfold:

original: zhu bas nye bar ston pa dang / dga' bas nye bar ston pa dang / re bas nye bar ston pa dang / len pa'am 'dzin pas nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhu bas nye bar ston pa dang / dga' bas nye bar ston pa dang / re bas nye bar ston pa dang / len pa'am 'dzin pas nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: 4. teaching by means of the acceptance or retention.

original: 'du byed ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: 1. There are five kinds of formative influence:

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed dang / las kyi 'du byed dang / tshe'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed dang / las kyi 'du byed dang / tshe'i 'du byed do //
translated: formative influence of the body, formative influence of speech, formative influence of thought, formative influence of action and formative influence of life.

original: bag yod pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: 2. There are five kinds of heedfulness:🔽heedfulness in regard to the side of the householder,

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i @196a * //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i @196a * //
translated: heedfulness in regard to the side of the homeless ascetic,🔽heedfulness in regard to the relinquishment of the unwholesome,🔽heedfulness in regard to the accumulation of the wholesome and

original: phyogs la brten pa dang / mi dge ba spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba bsdu ba'i phyir dang / bsgom pa rtag tu bya ba'i phyir bag yod pa'o //🔽de la khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: phyogs la brten pa dang / mi dge ba spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba bsdu ba'i phyir dang / bsgom pa rtag tu bya ba'i phyir bag yod pa'o // de la khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: heedfulness in regard to the constant practice of meditation.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Therein, heedfulness in regard to the side of the householder is fivefold, as before.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa ni rnam pa bcu ste ;
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa ni rnam pa bcu ste ;
translated: Heedfulness in regard to the side of the homeless ascetic is tenfold:

original: de yang nyan thos kyi sa rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i 'dul ba dang ldan pa las rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos kyi sa rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i 'dul ba dang ldan pa las rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the Vinaya Scripture, in the chapter on the Sthavira.

original: mi dge ba spang ba'i phyir bag yod pa ni yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba spang ba'i phyir bag yod pa ni yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: Carefulness in abandoning the unwholesome should be understood through the first two right efforts.

original: dge ba bsdu ba'i phyir bag yod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba gzhan gnyis kyis blta bar bya'o //🔽bsgom pa rtag tu bya ba'i phyir bag yod pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba bsdu ba'i phyir bag yod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba gzhan gnyis kyis blta bar bya'o // bsgom pa rtag tu bya ba'i phyir bag yod pa ni /
translated: Carefulness in acquiring the wholesome and in increasing it should be understood through the other two right efforts.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed de sbyor ba rnams kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed de sbyor ba rnams kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Carefulness in the constant practice of meditation should be understood as the constant practice and the respectful practice of the applications of mindfulness.

original: ming ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ming ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The name is fivefold:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: mindfulness of the body, mindfulness of feeling, mindfulness of thought, mindfulness of the factors, and mindfulness of things.

original: gzugs kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The object is fivefold:

original: 'byung ba rnams dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa yang med pa'o //
translated: the elements, the derivative of the elements, the visible form that is resistant, the invisible form that is resistant, and the invisible form that is non-resistant.

original: ma rig pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Ignorance is also of five types:

original: don la kun du rmongs pa dang / lta ba la kun du rmongs pa dang / bag med pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / de kho na'i don la kun du rmongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal la kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: don la kun du rmongs pa dang / lta ba la kun du rmongs pa dang / bag med pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / de kho na'i don la kun du rmongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal la kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: ignorance with regard to the object, ignorance with regard to views, ignorance with regard to heedlessness, ignorance with regard to the object as it really is, and ignorance with regard to overweening conceit.

original: srid pa'i sred pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Craving for existence is also of five types:

original: chos nyid kyis sred pa dang / smon pas sred pa dang / kun du rmongs pas sred pa dang / yid skyo bas sred pa 'byung ba la sred pa dang / so sor brtags te sred pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis sred pa dang / smon pas sred pa dang / kun du rmongs pas sred pa dang / yid skyo bas sred pa 'byung ba la sred pa dang / so sor brtags te sred pa'o //
translated: craving for the intrinsic nature, craving for aspiration, craving for delusion, craving for the arising of mental dissatisfaction, and craving for investigation.

original: ngo tsha ba med pa dang / khrel med pa ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba med pa dang / khrel med pa ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Shamelessness and lack of abashment are to be understood as being established in five ways:

original: nyon mongs pa can kun du spyod pa la mi 'dzem pa dang / de bzhin du dge ba kun du mi spyod pa dang / chos yang dag par blangs ba gtong ba dang / dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / bya ba nan tan mi byed pa la mi 'dzem pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can kun du spyod pa la mi 'dzem pa dang / de bzhin du dge ba kun du mi spyod pa dang / chos yang dag par blangs ba gtong ba dang / dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / bya ba nan tan mi byed pa la mi 'dzem pas so //
translated: It is also shamelessness that does not avoid engaging in the afflicted conduct of body, speech, and mind, that does not avoid not engaging in virtuous conduct, that does not avoid abandoning the Dharma that has been taken up, that does not avoid relying on bad persons, and that does not avoid not being diligent in what should be done.

original: de las bzlog pa rnam pa lngas ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnam pa lngas ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Shame and embarrassment should be understood as being established in the opposite of these five ways.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag @196b par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag @196b par rig par bya ste /
translated: Disrespect should be understood as being established in five ways:

original: mi sgrub pa dang / log par sgrub pa dang / mi bzod pa dang / mi 'dzem pa dang / mi sdom pas so //
analyzed: mi sgrub pa dang / log par sgrub pa dang / mi bzod pa dang / mi 'dzem pa dang / mi sdom pas so //
translated: it is disrespect that does not accomplish, that wrongly accomplishes, that is impatient, that is not ashamed, and that is not restrained.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: Evil companions should be understood as being established in five ways:

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / log par lta ba can dang / le lo can dang / log par zhugs pa dang / dman pas so //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / log par lta ba can dang / le lo can dang / log par zhugs pa dang / dman pas so //
translated: they are shameless, have wrong views, are lazy, wrongly engage in what they do, and are inferior.

original: de las bzlog pa rnam pa lngas ni bka' blo bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnam pa lngas ni bka' blo bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these five is the ease of the word of the master.

original: zhi gnas kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rig par bya ste /🔽'jig rten pa'i nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / de bzhin du gzugs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhis bsdus pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhis bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pas bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rig par bya ste / 'jig rten pa'i nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / de bzhin du gzugs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhis bsdus pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhis bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pas bsdus pa dang /
translated: The establishment of serenity is also to be understood through five topics.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Serenity is included in the mundane access to the first meditative concentration, and likewise, it is included in the actual first meditative concentration, and likewise, it is included in the actual meditative concentrations of the formless realm, and it is included in the attentions of the mundane and supramundane śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and it is included in the attention of the supramundane bodhisattvas.

original: lhag mthong gi rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rig par bya ste /
translated: The establishment of insight is also to be understood through five topics.

original: ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: the mode of being of things as they are, the mode of being of things as they seem to be, that which arises from signs, that which arises from investigation, and that which arises from discernment.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The defilement of sense-desire is also to be understood as being established in five modes:

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dngos po las byung ba'i bag la nyal dang / dge ba dang mi mthun pa dang / nyes par spyod pa dang mthun pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can gyi nyon mongs pa las 'dod pa'i zag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dngos po las byung ba'i bag la nyal dang / dge ba dang mi mthun pa dang / nyes par spyod pa dang mthun pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can gyi nyon mongs pa las 'dod pa'i zag par rig par bya'o //
translated: the latent tendency that arises from the realm of the unquiet mind, that which is adverse to the wholesome, that which is adverse to good conduct, the excessive attachment to sense-desires and the defilement that has the suffering of change for its fruit.

original: srid pa'i zag pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The defilement of existence is also to be understood as being established in five modes:

original: khams ngan par skye bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / khams par mar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / khams bzang por skye bar 'gyur ba dang / mi 'dod bzhin du srid par skye bar 'gyur pa dang / 'dod bzhin du srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khams ngan par skye bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / khams par mar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / khams bzang por skye bar 'gyur ba dang / mi 'dod bzhin du srid par skye bar 'gyur pa dang / 'dod bzhin du srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The afflictions that cause one to be born in a bad realm, the afflictions that cause one to be born in a middling realm, the afflictions that cause one to be born in a good realm, the afflictions that cause one to be born in existence unwillingly, and the afflictions that cause one to be born in existence willingly.

original: thar pa log par 'dod pa rnams kyi ma rig pa'i zag pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag @197a * //🔽par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: thar pa log par 'dod pa rnams kyi ma rig pa'i zag pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag @197a * // par rig par bya ste /
translated: The contaminants of ignorance of those who wrongly believe in liberation should also be understood in brief as being of five types.

original: 'du shes can du smra ba rnams kyi 'du shes su smra ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / 'du shes med par smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin par smra ba rnams dang /
analyzed: 'du shes can du smra ba rnams kyi 'du shes su smra ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / 'du shes med par smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin par smra ba rnams dang /
translated: The ignorance of those who believe in consciousness that engages through the door of belief in consciousness, the ignorance of those who believe in non-consciousness, the ignorance of those who believe in neither consciousness nor non-consciousness, the ignorance of those who believe in annihilation, and the ignorance of those who believe in permanence.

original: chad par smra ba rnams dang / tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das par smra ba rnams kyi sgo nas 'jug pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa /
analyzed: chad par smra ba rnams dang / tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das par smra ba rnams kyi sgo nas 'jug pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa'o / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa /
translated: It is the ignorance that engages through the view of annihilation and the view that in this life nirvana is attained.

original: chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i tshul yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i tshul yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The method of the classification of phenomena should be understood in brief as fivefold:

original: 'di lta ste rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: 1) sign, 2) nature, 3) activity, 4) attributes, and 5) cause and effect.

original: de la rtags ni lus dang rgyu ba dang / gnas pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtags ni lus dang rgyu ba dang / gnas pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the sign should be understood from the body, movement, and abiding.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid las rig par bya'o //
translated: The nature should be understood from the specific characteristic and the general characteristic.

original: las ni rang gi bya ba byed pa dang / yang dag pa dang / log par bsgrub pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las ni rang gi bya ba byed pa dang / yang dag pa dang / log par bsgrub pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: Activity should be understood from the performance of one’s own function and the accomplishment of the right and wrong paths.

original: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: Attributes should be understood from the afflictions, purification, and the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni thag nye ba dang / rgyang ring ba dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni thag nye ba dang / rgyang ring ba dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause and effect are to be understood as being near or distant, and as being desirable or undesirable.

original: bstan bcos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three treatises:

original: thos pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos dang / rtsod pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos dang / sgrub pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: thos pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos dang / rtsod pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos dang / sgrub pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: the treatise of those who are devoted to listening, the treatise of those who are devoted to disputation, and the treatise of those who are devoted to practice.

original: de la thos pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la thos pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the treatise of those who are devoted to listening is as follows:

original: bram ze'i gsang tshig rnams so //
analyzed: bram ze'i gsang tshig rnams so //
translated: the secret words of the Brahmins.

original: rtsod pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise of those who are devoted to disputation is as follows:

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos so //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos so //
translated: the treatise on logic of those outside this teaching.

original: de la sgrub pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa lhur len pa'i bstan bcos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the treatise of those who are devoted to practice is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka'o //
translated: the words of the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three treatises:

original: don med pa'i bstan bcos dang / don log pa'i bstan bcos dang / don dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: don med pa'i bstan bcos dang / don log pa'i bstan bcos dang / don dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: the treatise of no meaning, the treatise of wrong meaning, and the treatise of right meaning.

original: de dag kyang snga ma rnams dang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang snga ma rnams dang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as corresponding to the previous three.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos gsum ste /
translated: There are three other treatises:

original: ngan g-yo'i bstan bcos dang / snying po med pa'i bstan bcos dang / sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: ngan g-yo'i bstan bcos dang / snying po med pa'i bstan bcos dang / sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba'i bstan bcos so //
translated: the treatise of deceit, the treatise of no essence, and the treatise of definite emergence from suffering.

original: de dag @197b kyang snga ma rnams dang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag @197b kyang snga ma rnams dang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as corresponding to the previous three.

original: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar 'dod pa'i phyag bya bar 'os pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar 'dod pa'i phyag bya bar 'os pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two persons worthy of homage who wish to compose a treatise:

original: de dag la phyag 'tshal nas bstan bcos brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la phyag 'tshal nas bstan bcos brtsam par bya ste /
translated: having paid homage to them, one should compose a treatise.

original: chos la gus pa la brten nas dang po bstan bcos mdzad pa'i ston pa dang / don la gus pa la brten nas de'i don ston pa slob dpon rnams so //
analyzed: chos la gus pa la brten nas dang po bstan bcos mdzad pa'i ston pa dang / don la gus pa la brten nas de'i don ston pa slob dpon rnams so //
translated: Based on respect for the Dharma, the teacher who composes the treatise, and based on respect for the meaning, the masters who teach its meaning.

original: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar 'dod pas rgyu rnam pa drug gis bstan bcos nye bar sbyar bar 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar 'dod pas rgyu rnam pa drug gis bstan bcos nye bar sbyar bar 'os pa yin te /
translated: One who wishes to compose a treatise should compose it for six reasons:

original: chos kyi don mang du byas par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / sems can rnams la mos pa sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir de dag kha cig 'dis 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / don nyams pa dang rab tu nyams pa rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi don mang du byas par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / sems can rnams la mos pa sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir de dag kha cig 'dis 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / don nyams pa dang rab tu nyams pa rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa dang /
translated: I will perform much benefit for the teaching, I will cause some of them to enter this teaching because sentient beings have various interests, I will distinguish between the loss and complete loss of meaning,

original: don 'thor ba rnams bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa dang / don zab mo rnams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa dang / tshig 'bru mdzes pas mdzes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: don 'thor ba rnams bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa dang / don zab mo rnams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa dang / tshig 'bru mdzes pas mdzes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam pa'o //
translated: I will collect scattered meanings, I will clarify profound meanings, I will generate beauty with beautiful words.

original: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar 'dod pas bdag nyid yon tan bzhi dang sbyar nas bstan bcos nye bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar 'dod pas bdag nyid yon tan bzhi dang sbyar nas bstan bcos nye bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: One who wishes to compose a treatise should compose a treatise having applied oneself to four qualities.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams la nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje che ba dang / chos mthun pa pa rnams la byams pa dang / bdag nyid mi sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams la nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje che ba dang / chos mthun pa pa rnams la byams pa dang / bdag nyid mi sgrogs pa'o //
translated: He is not proud of his former teachers, he has great compassion for sentient beings, he is loving to those who are in accord with the Dharma, and he does not advertise himself.

original: ji ltar na nga rgyal mi byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nga rgyal mi byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he not proud of his former teachers?

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang bstan bcos nye bar sbyor ba byas na bdag gis kyang ci'i phyir mi bya snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang bstan bcos nye bar sbyor ba byas na bdag gis kyang ci'i phyir mi bya snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar mi byed kyi /
translated: He does not compose treatises with the thought, “Since former teachers composed treatises, why shouldn’t I?”

original: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems rnam par spangs nas bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems rnam par spangs nas bstan bcos nye bar sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Rather, he composes treatises after he has completely abandoned the afflicted thought of being puffed up with pride.

original: ji ltar na sems can rnams la snying rje ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can rnams la snying rje ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is he compassionate toward sentient beings?

original: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor ba med na sems can gyi ris mang po dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos nye bar sbyor ba med na sems can gyi ris mang po dag 'di lta ste /
translated: If he did not compose treatises, many sentient beings would be deprived of the opportunity to

original: dge ba'i chos rnams las nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar mthong ba dang / yang gzhan dag skye ba dang rga ba zhes rgya cher 'byung bas nyen pa de dag gis kyang bstan bcos sbyar ba 'di la legs par bshad pa'i tshig gcig gi don kun shes shing de lta de ltar bsgrub par gyur na yang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams las nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar mthong ba dang / yang gzhan dag skye ba dang rga ba zhes rgya cher 'byung bas nyen pa de dag gis kyang bstan bcos sbyar ba 'di la legs par bshad pa'i tshig gcig gi don kun shes shing de lta de ltar bsgrub par gyur na yang /
translated: Even if those who are afflicted by these afflictions understand the meaning of a single word of this treatise that is being composed and practice accordingly,

original: de ni de dag @198a * //
analyzed: de ni de dag @198a * //
translated: that will be for their🔽long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness.

original: gi yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam pa de lta bu kho na'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gi yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam pa de lta bu kho na'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: With this alone in mind, I compose this treatise.

original: ji ltar na chos mthun pa dag la byams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos mthun pa dag la byams pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he has loving kindness for those who are similar to him?

original: bstan bcos sbyar ba med na chos mthun pa pa gzhan gyi don byed 'dod pa rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos sbyar ba med na chos mthun pa pa gzhan gyi don byed 'dod pa rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who desire to benefit others who are similar to them in having composed treatises do not do so without a treatise.

original: gzhan gyi don byas pas nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams par yang dag par rjes su mthong bas de dag la byams pa kho na'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byas pas nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams par yang dag par rjes su mthong bas de dag la byams pa kho na'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He composes treatises out of love for those who have fallen away and degenerated through their failure to benefit others.

original: ji ltar na bdag nyid mi sgrogs pa yin zhe na /🔽bdag la gzhan dag mkhas pa dang / gsal ba dang yid gzhungs pa dang / bstan bcos rnams byed pa dang / don rnams rab tu brjod pa yin par yid ches par gyur na dad pa skye zhing dad pa'i dbang gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag nyid mi sgrogs pa yin zhe na / bdag la gzhan dag mkhas pa dang / gsal ba dang yid gzhungs pa dang / bstan bcos rnams byed pa dang / don rnams rab tu brjod pa yin par yid ches par gyur na dad pa skye zhing dad pa'i dbang gis 'di lta ste /
translated: How does he not advertise himself?

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dag 'byung bar 'gyur na ci ma rung snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis bstan bcos sbyor bar mi byed kyi /🔽zang zing med pa'i sems kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dag 'byung bar 'gyur na ci ma rung snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis bstan bcos sbyor bar mi byed kyi / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: He does not compose treatises with the thought, “If others believe that I am learned, clear-minded, intelligent, a composer of treatises, and an expounder of the meaning of the teachings, then faith will arise in them and, because of their faith, they will give me gifts and honors.”

original: bdag dang gzhan dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir bstan bcos sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir bstan bcos sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Rather, he composes treatises with a disinterested mind, thinking, “I will compose this treatise in order to generate roots of virtue in myself and in others.”

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'grel pa ni mdo sde'i rgyan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'grel pa ni mdo sde'i rgyan zhes bya ste /
translated: The Ornament of the Sutras is so called because it is a commentary on the meaning of the sutras spoken by the Tathagata.🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The Ornament of the Sutras is the correct commentary on the meaning of the sutras taught by the Tathagata.🔽For example, a closed lotus does not delight like an open lotus.

original: dper na pad ma kham bye ba ni ji ltar kha bye ba ni ji ltar kha bye ba de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'di lta ste dper na gser brdungs su ma byas pa ni ji ltar brdungs su byas pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa dang /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na pad ma kham bye ba ni ji ltar kha bye ba ni ji ltar kha bye ba de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'di lta ste dper na gser brdungs su ma byas pa ni ji ltar brdungs su byas pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, unworked gold does not delight like worked gold.

original: dper na kha zas ma myangs pa ni ji ltar myangs pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na kha zas ma myangs pa ni ji ltar myangs pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, food that has not been tasted does not delight like food that has been tasted.

original: dper na kun dga' ba'i 'phrin yig ma bklags pa ni ji ltar bklags pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / 'di lta ste dper na longs spyod 'du ba ma thob pa dag ni ji ltar thob cing bdag gir byas pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na kun dga' ba'i 'phrin yig ma bklags pa ni ji ltar bklags pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / 'di lta ste dper na longs spyod 'du ba ma thob pa dag ni ji ltar thob cing bdag gir byas pa de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: And it is not as delightful to obtain and possess wealth as it is to acquire it when one has not obtained it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi don rnam par ma phye ba yang ji ltar rnam par phye ba de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi don rnam par ma phye ba yang ji ltar rnam par phye ba de ltar dga' bar byed pa ma yin pas /
translated: In the same way, it is not as delightful to analyze the meaning of the scriptures of the Tathagata as it is to understand them.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde'i rgyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde'i rgyan zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Ornament of the Scriptures.

original: rtogs pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: Understanding is of seven kinds:

original: yi ge rtogs pa dang / yi ge'i don @198b rtogs pa dang / 'dzin pa rtogs pa dang / 'dzin pa'i don rtogs pa dang / 'ching ba rtogs pa dang / grol ba rtogs pa dang / chos nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge rtogs pa dang / yi ge'i don @198b rtogs pa dang / 'dzin pa rtogs pa dang / 'dzin pa'i don rtogs pa dang / 'ching ba rtogs pa dang / grol ba rtogs pa dang / chos nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: understanding of the letters, understanding of the meaning of the letters, understanding of retention, understanding of the meaning of retention, understanding of bondage, understanding of liberation, and understanding of reality.

original: de la yi ge rtogs pa ni brtag pa las so //
analyzed: de la yi ge rtogs pa ni brtag pa las so //
translated: Among these, understanding of the letters is from the investigation.

original: yi ge'i don rtogs pa ni mi brtag pa las so //🔽de la 'dzin pa rtogs pa ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: yi ge'i don rtogs pa ni mi brtag pa las so // de la 'dzin pa rtogs pa ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: The realization of the meaning of the letters is from the non-imagination.

original: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the realization of the apprehender is the realization of the truth of the consciousnesses along with the faculties, or the realization of the truth that is not so posited.

original: 'dzin pa rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i don rtogs pa yang de bzhin no //🔽de la 'ching ba rtogs pa ni mtshan ma'i 'ching ba'am /
analyzed: 'dzin pa rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i don rtogs pa yang de bzhin no // de la 'ching ba rtogs pa ni mtshan ma'i 'ching ba'am /
translated: Just as there is the realization of the apprehender, so there is the realization of the meaning of the apprehender.

original: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the realization of bondage is the realization of the bondage of signs or the bondage of negative tendencies.

original: grol ba rtogs pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: grol ba rtogs pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The realization of liberation should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: de la chos nyid rtogs pa ni chos gnas pa'i phyir 'di ltar chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyid rtogs pa ni chos gnas pa'i phyir 'di ltar chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na ste /
translated: Therein, the realization of reality is the realization that this reality is just stable because the dharmas are stable,

original: dbang phyug las kyang ma yin rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag la sogs pa las kyang ma yin par rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug las kyang ma yin rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag la sogs pa las kyang ma yin par rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and it is not from Īśvara, nor from intrinsic nature, nor from the distinctions of person, etc.

original: thos pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: thos pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The excellence of learning should be understood as tenfold.

original: legs par ston pas bshad pa dang / tshig dang yi ge gsal bar bshad pa dang / ji snyed pa yod pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i don bshad pa dang / sbyor ba thabs bla ba bshad pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byin pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: legs par ston pas bshad pa dang / tshig dang yi ge gsal bar bshad pa dang / ji snyed pa yod pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i don bshad pa dang / sbyor ba thabs bla ba bshad pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byin pa bshad pa ste /
translated: It is explained by a good teacher, it is explained with clear words and syllables, it explains the meaning of what exists in its entirety and as it is, it explains the skillful means of practice, and it explains the means of deliverance from all suffering.

original: lnga po de dag dang / gzhan yang lnga ste /
analyzed: lnga po de dag dang / gzhan yang lnga ste /
translated: These are the five. There are another five:

original: klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa med pas nyan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas nyan pa dang / legs par nyan pa dang / rab tu nyan pa dang / ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs la brten pa'i don legs par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa med pas nyan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas nyan pa dang / legs par nyan pa dang / rab tu nyan pa dang / ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs la brten pa'i don legs par rtogs pas so //
translated: listening without the intention to find fault, listening with the intention of attaining nirvana, listening well, listening well, and understanding the meaning based on the collection of names, phrases and letters.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ste /
translated: This is the ascertainment of the stage arising from learning.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
translated: The remainder of the treatise on ascertainment is not evident.

original: // / bsam pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni ;🔽bsam pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: // / bsam pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni ; bsam pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Determination of the Stages of the Bodhisattva🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: dngos po bsam pa dang / yod pa dang med pa bsam pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu bsam pa dang / theg pa bsam pa'o //🔽de la dngos po bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽dngos po drug las brtsams nas phung po'i dngos po nas dbang po'i @199a * //
analyzed: dngos po bsam pa dang / yod pa dang med pa bsam pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu bsam pa dang / theg pa bsam pa'o // de la dngos po bsam pa ni 'di lta ste / dngos po drug las brtsams nas phung po'i dngos po nas dbang po'i @199a * //
translated: The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: dngos po'i bar dag go //🔽de la yod pa dang med pa bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i bar dag go // de la yod pa dang med pa bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin no //🔽de la rgyu dang 'bras bu bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin no // de la rgyu dang 'bras bu bsam pa ni 'di lta ste / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar bstan pa bzhin no //🔽de la theg pa bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar bstan pa bzhin no // de la theg pa bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams so //🔽yang bsam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams so //🔽yang bsam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the first part of the Yogacarabhumi.🔽The stages of the bodhisattva are taught in

original: nyes par bsam pa sems pa dang / legs par bsam pa sems pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par bsam pa sems pa dang / legs par bsam pa sems pa'o //
translated: thinking wrongly and thinking rightly.

original: de la nyes par bsam pa sems pa ni 'di lta ste sa'i dngos gzhir nag po'i phyogs kyis 'di ltar 'di na la la bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa yongs su ma spangs par sems par bye dpa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nyes par bsam pa sems pa ni 'di lta ste sa'i dngos gzhir nag po'i phyogs kyis 'di ltar 'di na la la bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa yongs su ma spangs par sems par bye dpa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Among them, thinking wrongly is as follows: In the Abhidharma it is taught: “Here, someone thinks without having completely abandoned the dark side, such as the inconceivable, etc.”

original: de las bzlog pa ni legs par bsam pa sems pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni legs par bsam pa sems pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the opposite of that is thinking rightly.

original: nyes par bsam pa dang / legs par bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ;
analyzed: nyes par bsam pa dang / legs par bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ;
translated: As it is with thinking wrongly and thinking rightly,

original: chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'dul ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dul ba dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / 'phags pa dang / mi dge ba dang / dge ba dang /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'dul ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dul ba dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / 'phags pa dang / mi dge ba dang / dge ba dang /
translated: so it is with possessing what is contrary to the Dharma, possessing what is in accordance with the Dharma, possessing what is contrary to the Vinaya, possessing what is in accordance with the Vinaya, being non-noble, being noble, being unwholesome, being wholesome,

original: bsten par mi bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba dang / ma legs pa dang / legs pa dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang ; don dang mi ldan pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa dang /
analyzed: bsten par mi bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba dang / ma legs pa dang / legs pa dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang ; don dang mi ldan pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa dang /
translated: what should not be relied upon and what should be relied upon, what is bad and what is good, what is dark and what is bright, what is not meaningful and what is meaningful, what is low and what is excellent,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang de bzhin no //🔽de la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ni yod pa yang yod par /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang de bzhin no // de la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ni yod pa yang yod par /
translated: what is reprehensible and what is irreproachable, and what is to be abandoned and what is not to be abandoned.

original: med pa yang med par shes so zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: med pa yang med par shes so zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: In this regard, the Blessed One declared, “Here, a noble disciple knows what exists as it actually exists and what does not exist as it actually does not exist.”

original: 'dir yod pa ni gang yin med pa ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yod pa ni gang yin med pa ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: In this regard, what exists and what does not exist?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis yod pa ni yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis yod pa ni yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood that what exists exists in two ways.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: skyes pa byung ba da ltar yod pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin par rig par bya ba dang / rdzas dang dngos po dang don las yongs su grub pa gang yin pa de yang yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa byung ba da ltar yod pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin par rig par bya ba dang / rdzas dang dngos po dang don las yongs su grub pa gang yin pa de yang yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is substantially real, actually real, and ultimately real is also to be known as existent.

original: mdor na rdzas su yod par rig par bya ba ni gang /
analyzed: mdor na rdzas su yod par rig par bya ba ni gang /
translated: In brief, what is to be known as substantially real?

original: btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is to be known as nominally real?

original: gang ci yang rung ste de las gzhan pa @199b dag la mi ltos shing de las gzhan pa dag la mi brten par rang gi mtshan nyid 'dogs par byed pa de ni mdor na rdzas su yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ste de las gzhan pa @199b dag la mi ltos shing de las gzhan pa dag la mi brten par rang gi mtshan nyid 'dogs par byed pa de ni mdor na rdzas su yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is designated as its own characteristic without depending on anything else and without relying on anything else is, in brief, to be known as substantially real.

original: gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever is designated as its own characteristic

original: de las gzhan pa dag la ltos shing de las gzhan pa dag la brten nas rang gi mtshan nyid 'dogs par byed pa de ni mdor na btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la ltos shing de las gzhan pa dag la brten nas rang gi mtshan nyid 'dogs par byed pa de ni mdor na btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: in dependence on something else and in reliance on something else is, in brief, to be known as nominally real.

original: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not substantially real.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ming can gyi dngos po la brten zhing ltos te /🔽gnas nas bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ming can gyi dngos po la brten zhing ltos te / gnas nas bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: In dependence upon and in reliance upon the entity that is the basis of the name “form” and so on,

original: sems can zhes bya bar rgya cher nye bar 'dogs par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: sems can zhes bya bar rgya cher nye bar 'dogs par byed pa'o ;
translated: the designation “self” or “sentient being” is made.

original: / de la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ming can gyi dngos po ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: / de la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ming can gyi dngos po ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
translated: The entity that is the basis of the name “form” and so on is substantially existent.

original: sems can dang srog dang skye ba po rdzas su med pa ni btags pa'i yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dang srog dang skye ba po rdzas su med pa ni btags pa'i yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The self, sentient being, and life force, which are not substantially existent, are said to be imputedly existent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ming can gyi dngos po las bdag la sogs pa nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ming can gyi dngos po las bdag la sogs pa nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the self and so on are imputed in dependence upon the entity that is the basis of the name “form” and so on,🔽the aggregates and so on are imputed in dependence upon the entity that is the basis of the name “form” and so on.🔽Food, drink,🔽vehicles,🔽clothing,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi dngos po kho na la phung po la sogs pa nye bar 'dogs pa dang / gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dag la bza' ba dang btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi dngos po kho na la phung po la sogs pa nye bar 'dogs pa dang / gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dag la bza' ba dang btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang /
translated: ornaments,

original: khang khyim dang / dmag dang / nags tshal la sogs pa nye bar 'dogs pa dang / 'dus byas kyi ming can gyi dngos po la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sa bon dang / rnam par rig byed dang /
analyzed: khang khyim dang / dmag dang / nags tshal la sogs pa nye bar 'dogs pa dang / 'dus byas kyi ming can gyi dngos po la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sa bon dang / rnam par rig byed dang /
translated: It is the designation of houses, armies, forests and so on, the arising, aging, enduring and impermanence of conditioned things, seeds, indicative and nonindicative form,

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / thob pa dang / 'thob pa ma yin pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams dang so so'i skye bo nyid dang /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / thob pa dang / 'thob pa ma yin pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams dang so so'i skye bo nyid dang /
translated: obtainment and nonobtainment, the faculty of life force, homogeneity, the collection of names, the collection of words and the collection of letters, the state of an ordinary being,

original: tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa dang / 'jug pa dang so sor nges pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / dus dang yul dang grangs nye bar 'dogs pa dang / gzugs kyi 'dug pa med pa tsam la gnas te ltos shing brten nas nam mkha' zhes nye bar 'dogs te nam mkha' 'dus ma byas zhes gdags pa dang /🔽de'i mjug thogs su ming gi 'jug pa tsam la gnas te ltos shing brten nas /🔽'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog @200a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa dang / 'jug pa dang so sor nges pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / dus dang yul dang grangs nye bar 'dogs pa dang / gzugs kyi 'dug pa med pa tsam la gnas te ltos shing brten nas nam mkha' zhes nye bar 'dogs te nam mkha' 'dus ma byas zhes gdags pa dang / de'i mjug thogs su ming gi 'jug pa tsam la gnas te ltos shing brten nas / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog @200a * //
translated: The designation of space is made in dependence on the mere absence of contact with form, and the designation of space as unconditioned is made in dependence on the mere absence of the arrangement of form.

original: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar 'dogs shing gdags par byed pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar 'dogs shing gdags par byed pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, the designation of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation is made in dependence on the mere engagement of names.

original: 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa las brtsams te /
translated: The reasonings that prove

original: gang gis bdag rdzas su med do zhes khong du chud par bya ba 'di la rigs pa brjod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bdag rdzas su med do zhes khong du chud par bya ba 'di la rigs pa brjod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the reasonings that prove that the self does not substantially exist?

original: 'di ltar mi dmigs shing mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dmigs shing mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not perceived and does not appear.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
translated: How is it not perceived?

original: phung po las ma gtogs pa nang ngam phyi rol lam gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phung po las ma gtogs pa nang ngam phyi rol lam gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not perceived apart from the aggregates, either internally, externally, or in both.

original: ji ltar mi snang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi snang zhe na /
translated: How does it not appear?

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rdzas su yod pa dag rang rang gi las la snang ba de ltar bdag ni rang gi las la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rdzas su yod pa dag rang rang gi las la snang ba de ltar bdag ni rang gi las la mi snang ngo //
translated: The sense-spheres of the eye, etc., which are substantially real, appear in their own actions, but the self does not appear in its own action.

original: de ltar na bdag ni rang gi mtshan nyid las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rang gi las la mi snang ba'i phyir rdzas su med pa kho nar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag ni rang gi mtshan nyid las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rang gi las la mi snang ba'i phyir rdzas su med pa kho nar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, because the self is not perceived in its own characteristic and does not appear in its own action, it should be understood that it is not substantially real.

original: gal te de ltar bdag mi dmigs shing mi snang ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bdag mi dmigs shing mi snang ba yin na /
translated: If the self is not perceived and does not appear in this way,

original: ci'i phyir gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu dag gis dmigs shing mthong ste /🔽des na rdzas su yod do zhes 'dod par byed ston par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu dag gis dmigs shing mthong ste / des na rdzas su yod do zhes 'dod par byed ston par byed /
translated: why do the wandering non-Buddhist philosophers perceive and see it?

original: 'dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'dogs par byed ce na /
translated: Why do they assert, teach, and impute that it exists substantially?

original: smras pa / mi dmigs shing mi mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dmigs shing mi mthong mod kyi /
translated: Objection: I do not observe or see it.

original: 'on kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la brten nas log par rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la brten nas log par rtog par byed cing /
translated: Nevertheless, I imagine it in dependence on the view of the transitory collection and the pride thinking “I am.”

original: log par yongs su brtags nas kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pas 'dod par byed ston par byed zlog par byed par zad do //
analyzed: log par yongs su brtags nas kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pas 'dod par byed ston par byed zlog par byed par zad do //
translated: Having imagined it incorrectly, I desire it, teach it, and defend it through improper mental activity.

original: de la ji ltar na bdag med pa'i phyir dang / yod pa ma yin pa kho na'i phyir dmigs shing mi snang bar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bdag med pa'i phyir dang / yod pa ma yin pa kho na'i phyir dmigs shing mi snang bar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: In this regard, how should one understand that it is not observed because it does not exist and because it does not exist at all?

original: bdag yod na ring du pha rol du song yang rung rnam pa bzhis rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag yod na ring du pha rol du song yang rung rnam pa bzhis rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: If the self exists, then even if it goes far away, it would be imagined in four ways:

original: phung po tsam mam /🔽phung po rnams las gzhan te phung po rnams la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: phung po tsam mam / phung po rnams las gzhan te phung po rnams la gnas pa'am /
translated: as the mere aggregates,🔽as different from the aggregates, as residing in the aggregates,

original: phung po tsam yang ma yin phung po rnams las gzhan te /
analyzed: phung po tsam yang ma yin phung po rnams las gzhan te /
translated: or as not the mere aggregates and different from the aggregates,🔽and as permanent or impermanent.

original: phung po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang phung po rnams las gzhan pa phung po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang phung po rnams las gzhan pa phung po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la gnas pa'am /
translated: It does not exist in the aggregates, nor does it exist apart from the aggregates.🔽It is not the aggregates, nor is it other than the aggregates.🔽It is not possessed of the aggregates, nor do the aggregates exist in it.🔽It is not non-existent, nor is it characterized by non-existence.

original: phung po tsam yang ma yin phung po rnams las gzhan te phung po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin phung po rnams las gzhan pa phung po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la @200b gnas pa ma yin mod kyi 'on
analyzed: phung po tsam yang ma yin phung po rnams las gzhan te phung po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin phung po rnams las gzhan pa phung po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la @200b gnas pa ma yin mod kyi 'on
translated: It is not the same as the aggregates, nor is it different from the aggregates.🔽It is not permanent, nor is it impermanent.🔽It is not subject to destruction, nor is it not subject to destruction.🔽It is not produced, nor does it cease.🔽It is not diminished, nor does it increase.🔽It is not defiled, nor is it purified.🔽It is not born from anywhere, nor does it go anywhere.

original: kyang phung po med pa phung po'i chos thams cad dang mi ldan pa zhig yin grang ste bdag yod pa nyid las brtsams nas rtog par 'gyur ba ni rnam pa bzhi po de dag las gong na yang med la de las lhag pa yang med de /
analyzed: kyang phung po med pa phung po'i chos thams cad dang mi ldan pa zhig yin grang ste bdag yod pa nyid las brtsams nas rtog par 'gyur ba ni rnam pa bzhi po de dag las gong na yang med la de las lhag pa yang med de /
translated: It is not past, nor future, nor present.🔽It is not a knower, nor is it a seer, nor is it a hearer, nor is it a thinker, nor is it a cognizer.🔽It is not a doer, nor is it a maker.🔽It is not a seer, nor is it a hearer, nor is it a thinker, nor is it a cognizer.🔽It is not a knower, nor is it a knowable.🔽It is not a perceiver, nor is it a perception.🔽It is not a consciousness, nor is it a mental factor.🔽It is not a form, nor is it a feeling, nor is it a discrimination, nor is it a formation, nor is it a consciousness.🔽It is not an eye, nor is it an ear, nor is it a nose, nor is it a tongue, nor is it a body.

original: bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad kyis mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad kyis mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not a form, nor is it a sound, nor is it a smell, nor is it a taste, nor is it a tangible object.🔽It is not an eye element, nor is it an eye consciousness element.🔽It is not a form element, nor is it an eye consciousness element.🔽It is not an ear element, nor is it a sound element, nor is it an ear consciousness element.🔽It is not an ear element, nor is it a sound element, nor is it an ear consciousness element.🔽It is not a nose element, nor is it a smell element, nor is it a nose consciousness element.🔽It is not a nose element, nor is it a smell element, nor is it a nose consciousness element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is not

original: gal te bdag phung po tsam zhig yin na ni phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po tsam zhig yin na ni phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: If the self were just the aggregates, it would not be different from the aggregates.

original: bdag phung po rnams la gdags pa tsam du zad par de ltar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: bdag phung po rnams la gdags pa tsam du zad par de ltar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: It would be logical that the self would be just the imputation of the aggregates,

original: 'di ltar phung po rnams ni mi rtag pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te de'i phyir de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po rnams ni mi rtag pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te de'i phyir de mi 'thad do //
translated: but the aggregates are impermanent and do not possess the characteristics of the self. Therefore that is untenable.

original: gal te bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /🔽de yang mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa zhig yin na ni / de yang mi rtag pa'am /
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,

original: rtag pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: rtag pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: it would be either impermanent or permanent.🔽If it were impermanent,

original: gal te mi rtag na ni skad cig re re la bdag gzhan skye zhing gzhan 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag na ni skad cig re re la bdag gzhan skye zhing gzhan 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: then at every moment the self would be born and cease to be.

original: 'dir gzhan 'chi zhing der gzhan skye ba dang / gzhan byed cing gzhan gyis myong ba de ltar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan 'chi zhing der gzhan skye ba dang / gzhan byed cing gzhan gyis myong ba de ltar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: It would be logical that here one self would die and another would be born, one would perform actions and another would experience the results.

original: phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag skye ba'am 'gag las gzhan pa'i bdag skye ba'am 'gag pa ni nang ngam phyi rol lam gnyi ga med par yang ci yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag skye ba'am 'gag las gzhan pa'i bdag skye ba'am 'gag pa ni nang ngam phyi rol lam gnyi ga med par yang ci yang mi dmigs te /
translated: A self that is different from the aggregates, that is born or ceases apart from the aggregates, is not perceived either internally or externally or in both.

original: de'i phyir de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, that is not tenable.

original: gal te rtag na gi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtag na gi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: If it is permanent, then this is the characteristic of the permanent:

original: 'gyur ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is unchanging.

original: bdag de 'gyur ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag de 'gyur ba med pa yin na /
translated: If that self is unchanging,

original: rgyu gnyis kyis 'gyur ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis 'gyur ba mi rung ste /
translated: it is not reasonable that it change in two ways:

original: phyi ma la yang mi rung ba dang / tshe 'di nyid la yang mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang mi rung ba dang / tshe 'di nyid la yang mi rung ba'o //
translated: it is not reasonable in the future and it is not reasonable in this life.

original: bdag 'gyur ba med pa yin na phyi ma la yang skye bar mi 'gyur rga bar mi 'gyur 'chi bar mi 'gyur gnod par mi 'gyur bas /🔽res 'ga' lhar skye ba dang / res 'ga' mi dang / res 'ga' dud 'gro /
analyzed: bdag 'gyur ba med pa yin na phyi ma la yang skye bar mi 'gyur rga bar mi 'gyur 'chi bar mi 'gyur gnod par mi 'gyur bas / res 'ga' lhar skye ba dang / res 'ga' mi dang / res 'ga' dud 'gro /
translated: If the self is unchanging, then it would not be born in the future, it would not age, it would not die, and it would not be harmed.🔽It would not be reasonable that sometimes it is born as a god, sometimes as a human, sometimes as an animal,

original: res 'ga' yi dags dang / res 'ga' sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' yi dags dang / res 'ga' sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba yang mi rung ngo //
translated: sometimes as a hungry ghost, and sometimes as a hell being.

original: 'gyur ba med pa yin na tshe 'di la yang yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag gis bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa yin na tshe 'di la yang yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag gis bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: If it were unchanging, then in this life, it would not be happy or unhappy due to desirable and undesirable objects.

original: sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur chags par yang mi 'gyur sdang bar yang mi 'gyur rmongs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur chags par yang mi 'gyur sdang bar yang mi 'gyur rmongs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be attached or averse or confused.

original: mdor na bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dag dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba dag gis kyang 'gyur bar mi @201a * //
analyzed: mdor na bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dag dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba dag gis kyang 'gyur bar mi @201a * //
translated: In brief, it would not be changed by any happiness or suffering or affliction or secondary affliction.

original: byed do // de de ltar 'gyur ba med cing tshe phyi ma dang / tshe 'di la bde bas phan 'dogs pa med na /
analyzed: byed do // de de ltar 'gyur ba med cing tshe phyi ma dang / tshe 'di la bde bas phan 'dogs pa med na /
translated: If it were like that, unchanging and not helped by happiness in this life or the next,

original: de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pas kyang nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pas kyang nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then it would not be afflicted by the afflictions that are related to it.

original: gzhi des chos dang chos ma yin pa spyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des chos dang chos ma yin pa spyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And on that basis, it would not engage in Dharma or non-Dharma.

original: de sdug bsngal bas gnod pa med na yang /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal bas gnod pa med na yang /
translated: If it were not harmed by suffering,

original: de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pas kyang nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pas kyang nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: And he is not afflicted by the afflictions associated with that.

original: gzhi des chos dang chos ma yin pa spyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des chos dang chos ma yin pa spyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And on that basis, he does not engage in Dharma or non-Dharma.

original: de ltar tshe 'di la chos dang chos ma yin pa dang mi ldan pa de /
analyzed: de ltar tshe 'di la chos dang chos ma yin pa dang mi ldan pa de /
translated: Thus, in this life, he is not endowed with Dharma or non-Dharma.

original: phyi ma la yang gang la brten nas de rtag bzhin du de'i so so'i bdag gi lus mi rtag pa 'gyur ba las gyur pa phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i 'dod pa dang mi
analyzed: phyi ma la yang gang la brten nas de rtag bzhin du de'i so so'i bdag gi lus mi rtag pa 'gyur ba las gyur pa phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i 'dod pa dang mi
translated: In the next life, he does not desire or not desire a body that is based on that, which is always changing due to the impermanence of his individual body, and which changes due to birth, aging, sickness, death, etc. in the next life.

original: 'dod pa'i lus kyang rgyu med pa las 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lus kyang rgyu med pa las 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that body is not established without a cause.

original: de lta bas na bdag 'di so so'i bdag dang lus las skye ba yang med la rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang nye bar nyon mongs pa yod bzhin du gtan grol pa kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag 'di so so'i bdag dang lus las skye ba yang med la rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang nye bar nyon mongs pa yod bzhin du gtan grol pa kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang
translated: Therefore, this self is not born from an individual self or body, and while there is aging, sickness, death, pleasure, pain, and affliction, it is only completely liberated. Therefore,

original: de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de mi 'thad do //
translated: That is untenable.

original: gal te gang dag la bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa phung po las bdag gzhan du gyur pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la bdag gnas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang dag la bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa phung po las bdag gzhan du gyur pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la bdag gnas so zhe na /
translated: If you say, “I exist in those phenomena that are different from the aggregates,”

original: des na phung po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi dmigs na de dag la bdag gnas par lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na phung po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi dmigs na de dag la bdag gnas par lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: then since those phenomena that are different from the aggregates are not observed to exist by their own characteristics, how could you exist in them?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na la la zhig 'di skad ces mo gsham gyi bu'i mgo la nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bcings ba bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba de dang 'dra bar 'di yang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig 'di skad ces mo gsham gyi bu'i mgo la nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bcings ba bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba de dang 'dra bar 'di yang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: it is just like someone saying, “I see the garland of sky flowers tied in the topknot of the son of a barren woman.”

original: de'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore that is untenable.

original: gal te bdag thams cad kyi thams cad du phung po thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir phung po med pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag thams cad kyi thams cad du phung po thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir phung po med pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If you say, “The self is without aggregates because it is not associated with any aggregates at all,”

original: da phung po med pa yin pas gzugs can yang ma yin /
analyzed: da phung po med pa yin pas gzugs can yang ma yin /
translated: then since it is without aggregates, it is not physical.

original: lus dang mi ldan bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: lus dang mi ldan bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag dang yang mi ldan /
translated: It is not associated with pleasure and pain, since it is not embodied.

original: ming mang po rnam pa sna tshogs dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: ming mang po rnam pa sna tshogs dang yang mi ldan /
translated: It is not associated with many different names.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa dang yang mi ldan /
translated: It is not associated with virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral intentions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par rtog pa @201b dag dang yang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par rtog pa @201b dag dang yang mi ldan pas /
translated: It is not associated with mental concepts, since it does not enjoy objects such as form.

original: de ltar na bdag ni lus med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / ming med pa dang / sems pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag ni lus med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / ming med pa dang / sems pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the self would be devoid of body, devoid of feeling, devoid of name, devoid of intention, and devoid of mental concepts.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas bdag ni tshegs chung ngus grol ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas bdag ni tshegs chung ngus grol ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Since it would be nonafflictive, the self would be liberated with little difficulty.

original: de'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, that is also untenable.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag rtag pa rnam pa thams cad kyis brtags na mi 'thad pa de'i phyir bdag ni phung po rnams la btags pa tsam du zad kyi rdzas su med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag rtag pa rnam pa thams cad kyis brtags na mi 'thad pa de'i phyir bdag ni phung po rnams la btags pa tsam du zad kyi rdzas su med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since a permanent self is untenable when examined in all ways, therefore you should understand that the self is merely an imputation on the aggregates and does not substantially exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag ni med la phung po tsam ni yod na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag ni med la phung po tsam ni yod na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the self does not exist but the mere aggregates exist, the nature of affliction and purification is tenable.

original: 'di lta ste nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched byung zhing skyes pa yod na tshe 'di la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba lus la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched byung zhing skyes pa yod na tshe 'di la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba lus la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, if the internal and external sense bases arise and are produced, in this life feeling that arises from contact with ignorance occurs and it benefits or harms the body.

original: de'i rkyen gyis phrad pa dang / 'bral bar sred pa dang / de dang 'brel pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis phrad pa dang / 'bral bar sred pa dang / de dang 'brel pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Due to that condition, craving for meeting and separation and the afflictions and branch afflictions associated with that arise.

original: de'i don du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'jug pa yang snang la de ltar nyon mongs pa dang las grub na phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa yang 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i don du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'jug pa yang snang la de ltar nyon mongs pa dang las grub na phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa yang 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
