translated: For that purpose, the engagement of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma also appears. If afflictions and karma are thus established, the phenomena of suffering also arise, such as birth, aging, and so on in the next life.

original: de ltar na re zhig phung po rnams mi rtag cing bdag med kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig phung po rnams mi rtag cing bdag med kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the aggregates are impermanent and devoid of self, but they are still thoroughly afflicted.

original: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba dang / bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas ma rig pa 'gag cing rig pa skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba dang / bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas ma rig pa 'gag cing rig pa skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Since it arises from the cause of the speech of another and from the cause of one’s own proper mental attention, ignorance ceases and knowledge arises.

original: rmongs pa med pa tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal las so sor rtogs pa de'i tshor ba rnams la sred pa dang / de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de yang spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal las so sor rtogs pa de'i tshor ba rnams la sred pa dang / de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de yang spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since one is not confused, one realizes that all feelings are suffering, and craving for feelings and the afflictions associated with that are also abandoned.

original: gzhi des kyang 'byung ba 'phel bar byed pa'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba yang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang 'byung ba 'phel bar byed pa'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba yang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And on that basis, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that increases the elements would not occur.

original: de ltar las dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir yang 'byung ba skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bcas te 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar las dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir yang 'byung ba skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bcas te 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And thus, because karma and afflictions would be eliminated, the arising of the elements and so on would not occur, along with the suffering that is associated with them.

original: de ltar na bdag med cing phung po tsam yod na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin rung bar @202a * //🔽'gyur ro // de la sems can du gdags pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med cing phung po tsam yod na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin rung bar @202a * // 'gyur ro // de la sems can du gdags pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, if there is no self and there are only aggregates, the nature of affliction and purification is tenable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, the designation of sentient beings is as follows.

original: sems can rkang med dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / rkang mngas rnams dang / sems can gzugs can rnams dang / sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / sems can 'du shes can rnams dang / sems can 'du shes med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can rkang med dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / rkang mngas rnams dang / sems can gzugs can rnams dang / sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / sems can 'du shes can rnams dang / sems can 'du shes med pa rnams dang /
translated: Sentient beings are those without legs, those with two legs, those with four legs, those with many legs, sentient beings with form, sentient beings without form, sentient beings with perception, sentient beings without perception,

original: sems can 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin pa'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin pa'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Those sentient beings who are born in a place of rebirth that is neither with nor without ideation.

original: de la sems can du gdags pa rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyi rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems can du gdags pa rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyi rigs par bya ste /
translated: All of these nine designations of sentient beings are to be understood in brief as being of three kinds:

original: 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / lus g-yo ba'i rab tu dbye bas ni rkang med rnams nas rkang mngas kyi bar dag gi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / lus g-yo ba'i rab tu dbye bas ni rkang med rnams nas rkang mngas kyi bar dag gi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: by the distinction of going and coming, and by the distinction of bodily movement, the designations of those without feet up to those with many feet are to be understood.

original: lus kyi rab tu dbye bas ni sems can gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi gdags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rab tu dbye bas ni sems can gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi gdags par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the distinction of body, the designations of sentient beings with form and without form are to be understood.

original: sems kyi rab tu dbye bas ni sems can 'du shes can dang / 'du shes med pa dang 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin pa'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams kyi gdags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rab tu dbye bas ni sems can 'du shes can dang / 'du shes med pa dang 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin pa'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams kyi gdags par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the distinction of mind, the designations of sentient beings born in a place of rebirth that is with ideation, without ideation, and neither with nor without ideation are to be understood.

original: rab tu byung ba gcer bu pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gcer bu pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There are naked ascetics called “those gone forth” who say this:

original: de nang gi chos srog dang ldan par bgrang ba rnams kyi skye ba dang mthun pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su mthong nas /
analyzed: de nang gi chos srog dang ldan par bgrang ba rnams kyi skye ba dang mthun pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su mthong nas /
translated: “We see that the inner dharmas, which are counted as having life, are born in accordance with trees and so on.

original: 'di skad ces shing ljon pa rnams la yang srog yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di skad ces shing ljon pa rnams la yang srog yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, trees and so on have life.”

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To them it should be said:

original: ci shing ljon pa rnams kyi skye ba gang yin pa de srog gi rgyu las byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci shing ljon pa rnams kyi skye ba gang yin pa de srog gi rgyu las byung ba yin nam /
translated: “Is the birth of trees and so on caused by the life faculty?

original: 'on te de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that it is caused by another cause of birth?

original: gal te srog gi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na de dag gi srog nyid ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te srog gi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na de dag gi srog nyid ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is caused by the life faculty, then it is not tenable that they are never born, because their life faculty would never cease.”

original: gal te de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na srog nyid med par rang gi rgyus skye ba yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na srog nyid med par rang gi rgyus skye ba yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If it arises from a cause of arising that is different from that, then it is not tenable that life itself arises from its own cause, since it is without life.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, the following should be stated:

original: ci srog med pa'i dngos po rnams kyi mi skye ba rgyu dang bcas par brjod dam /
analyzed: ci srog med pa'i dngos po rnams kyi mi skye ba rgyu dang bcas par brjod dam /
translated: Is it said that the nonarising of things that are without life is due to a cause?

original: 'on te rgyu med par brjod par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med par brjod par 'dod /
translated: Or is it said to be without a cause?

original: gal te rgyu dang bcas par brjod du ni rgyur brjod pa mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang bcas par brjod du ni rgyur brjod pa mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is said to be due to a cause, it is not tenable that the cause is not observed.

original: gal te @202b rgyu med par brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te @202b rgyu med par brjod na ni /
translated: If it is said to be without a cause,

original: rgyu med par brjod pas de lta bu yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu med par brjod pas de lta bu yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable that it is so because it is said to be without a cause.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, the following should be stated:🔽Are trees and life-force the same?

original: ci shing ljon pa rnams dang srog rnams gcig tu mthun pa yin nam /🔽'on te gcig tu mthun pa ma yin par 'dod /
analyzed: ci shing ljon pa rnams dang srog rnams gcig tu mthun pa yin nam /🔽'on te gcig tu mthun pa ma yin par 'dod /
translated: Or are they not the same?

original: gal te gcig tu mthun pa yin na ni des na shing ljon pa rnams ni sa'i 'og tu nub pa dang sa'i steng du skye ba dang / rang gi lus kyis mi g-yo ba dang / brjod na yang mi brjod pa dang / legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las la 'jug par yang mi snang ba dang /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu mthun pa yin na ni des na shing ljon pa rnams ni sa'i 'og tu nub pa dang sa'i steng du skye ba dang / rang gi lus kyis mi g-yo ba dang / brjod na yang mi brjod pa dang / legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las la 'jug par yang mi snang ba dang /
translated: If they are the same, then trees would not appear to sink into the ground and grow above the ground, to be unmoved by their own bodies, to be unmoved by speech, to engage in good and bad actions,

original: yal ga dang yal ga gyes pa dag bcad na yang de las gzhan pa dag tu skye bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yal ga dang yal ga gyes pa dag bcad na yang de las gzhan pa dag tu skye bas mi rung ngo //
translated: and to grow from branches and twigs that have been cut.

original: gal te gcig tu mthun pa ma yin na ni des na mthun na ni srog yod la mi mthun na ni srog med par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //🔽de ltar na skye ba'i rgyu de las gzhan pa yod pa'am med pa dang / srog med pa rnams kyi mi skye ba'i rgyur brjod pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu mthun pa ma yin na ni des na mthun na ni srog yod la mi mthun na ni srog med par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo // de ltar na skye ba'i rgyu de las gzhan pa yod pa'am med pa dang / srog med pa rnams kyi mi skye ba'i rgyur brjod pa yod pa'am /
translated: If they are not the same, then it would be untenable that when they are the same, there is life, and when they are not the same, there is no life.

original: med pa dang / gcig tu mthun pa'am mi mthun pas kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med pa dang / gcig tu mthun pa'am mi mthun pas kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is untenable that the cause of arising is other than that, or that it exists or does not exist, or that the cause of nonarising of those that are without life exists or does not exist, or that it is the same or not the same.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya de lta de ltar so sor gyur pa dag la bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa so so ba la brten pa ni 'dus pa gcig pa'i ming du btags pa gang yin pa de dag btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya de lta de ltar so sor gyur pa dag la bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa so so ba la brten pa ni 'dus pa gcig pa'i ming du btags pa gang yin pa de dag btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that form, smell, taste, and tactility, which are individually distinct, are designated by the name of a single collection in the case of food and drink, vehicles, clothing, ornaments, and so on, which are individually distinct?🔽It should be understood that they exist as designations.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi ming ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ming 'dus pa la lar ni 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi ming ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ming 'dus pa la lar ni 'byung la /
translated: In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used,

original: la lar ni ldog ste /🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i ming 'dus pa gang la bza' ba'i ming 'byung ba de la btung ba'i ming ldog la /
analyzed: la lar ni ldog ste / gzugs la sogs pa'i ming 'dus pa gang la bza' ba'i ming 'byung ba de la btung ba'i ming ldog la /
translated: and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.

original: gang la la btung ba'i ming 'byung ba de la gos kyi ming ldog pa dang / lhag ma dag la yang brdar btags pa'i ming de dag gi 'jug pa dang ldog pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la la btung ba'i ming 'byung ba de la gos kyi ming ldog pa dang / lhag ma dag la yang brdar btags pa'i ming de dag gi 'jug pa dang ldog pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.🔽In some cases, the name of a collection of form and so on is used, and in some cases, the name of a collection is not used.

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dag gi ming ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa'i ming gi dngos po thams cad la khyad par med par 'byung bas /
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dag gi ming ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa'i ming gi dngos po thams cad la khyad par med par 'byung bas /
translated: The names of form, smell, taste, and tactility occur without distinction in all things that are named, such as food, drink, clothing, ornaments, etc.

original: de'i phyir bza' ba dang btung ba dang bzhon pa dang gos dang rgyan la sogs pa ni btags pa'i yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' ba dang btung ba dang bzhon pa dang gos dang rgyan la sogs pa ni btags pa'i yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, food, drink, vehicles, clothing, ornaments, etc., are nominally existent.

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag ni rdzas su yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽btags pa'i yod pa'i chos rnams la @203a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag ni rdzas su yod pa yin par rig par bya'o // btags pa'i yod pa'i chos rnams la @203a * //
translated: But form, smell, taste, and tactility should be understood as substantially existent.

original: brten pa'i ming rnam pa du ma mang po sna tshogs de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brten pa'i ming rnam pa du ma mang po sna tshogs de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The many, various kinds of names that are based on nominally existent things should be understood in brief as being of two kinds:

original: 'dus pa gcig la brten pa dang / 'dus pa du ma la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa gcig la brten pa dang / 'dus pa du ma la brten pa'o //
translated: those based on a single collection and those based on many collections.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa so so ba la brten pa ni 'dus pa gcig la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa so so ba la brten pa ni 'dus pa gcig la brten pa yin no //
translated: The first is based on a single collection, such as food, drink, a vehicle, clothing, ornaments, etc.

original: ri mo'i las dang 'jim pa'i las dang / khang khyim dang gzhal med khang dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa la brten pa ni 'dus pa du ma la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: ri mo'i las dang 'jim pa'i las dang / khang khyim dang gzhal med khang dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa la brten pa ni 'dus pa du ma la brten pa yin no //
translated: The second is based on many collections, such as a painting, a statue, a house, a chariot, an army, a forest, etc.

original: de la chos gzugs can rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos gzugs can rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the material dharmas?

original: mdor bsdu na skye mched gzugs can bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na skye mched gzugs can bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs te /
translated: In brief, they are the ten material sense spheres and the form that is included in the sense sphere of mental objects.

original: gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin pas de la de nyid nye bar gdags pa byas nas chos gzugs can rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin pas de la de nyid nye bar gdags pa byas nas chos gzugs can rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called material because they possess the characteristics of form.

original: chos gzugs can de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos gzugs can de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of material dharmas is established by way of five categories.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dngos po dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / khams dang / las kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / khams dang / las kyis so //
translated: by way of substance, by way of own-character, by way of general character, by way of element, and by way of action.

original: de la gzugs kyi dngos po ni mdor bsdu na gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi dngos po ni mdor bsdu na gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: As for the substance of form, in brief, whatever form there is,

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba de yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba de yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: all of it is the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.

original: de las gong na yang med la de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las gong na yang med la de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: This should be understood as it is, for there is nothing higher than this and nothing greater than this.

original: gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The own-character of form is threefold:

original: dang ba dang dang ba'i gzung ba dang / yid kyi gzung ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba dang dang ba'i gzung ba dang / yid kyi gzung ba'o //
translated: clear form, clear form as object, and mental form.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa mig la sogs pa'i skye mched du gtogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten gyi gzugs dang ba rnam pa lnga ni gzugs dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa mig la sogs pa'i skye mched du gtogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten gyi gzugs dang ba rnam pa lnga ni gzugs dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The five kinds of clear form are the clear form that is the basis of the five consciousnesses, the form included in the eye and so forth, and derived from the four great elements.

original: mtshungs pa'i gzugs dang ba lnga po dag gi yul gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag ni dang bas gzung ba'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i gzugs dang ba lnga po dag gi yul gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag ni dang bas gzung ba'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The five pure material elements, which are similar to the five objects, form, etc., are called the apprehended form.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa rnams dang yul mtshungs pa'i phyir mtshungs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa rnams dang yul mtshungs pa'i phyir mtshungs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the pure material elements that are associated with consciousness are called similar, because they are similar to the consciousnesses and their objects.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bral ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni rim gyis rang gi rgyun dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bral ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni rim gyis rang gi rgyun dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are not associated with consciousness are called similar, because they are similar to those that are associated with consciousness, since they are gradually transformed into a stream that is similar to them.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs @203b brnyan gyi gzugs ni yid kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs @203b brnyan gyi gzugs ni yid kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The form that is the object of concentration is called the form that is the object of mind.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The general characteristics of form should be understood as threefold:

original: gzugs thams cad ni yul mnan te gnas pa dang / yul las rtag tu rung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dang po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad ni yul mnan te gnas pa dang / yul las rtag tu rung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dang po yin no //
translated: All form is susceptible to being obstructed and is always susceptible to being the object of the sense-fields. This is the first general characteristic.

original: dang ba'i gzugs dang dang ba'i gzung ba'i gzugs 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ba'i gzugs dang dang ba'i gzung ba'i gzugs 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis pa yin no //
translated: All form is susceptible to increase and decrease, whether it is clear or whether it is grasped as clear. This is the second general characteristic.

original: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa bong ba dang dbyug pa dang mtshon cha dang grang ba dang dro ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa dang sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings dang rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul gyi 'dus te reg pa'i reg pa dag gis
analyzed: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa bong ba dang dbyug pa dang mtshon cha dang grang ba dang dro ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa dang sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings dang rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul gyi 'dus te reg pa'i reg pa dag gis
translated: All form is susceptible to contact, whether it is contact with the hand, a clod, a stick, a knife, cold, heat, hunger, thirst, gadflies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, or serpents.

original: reg par byar rung ba de dag thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg par byar rung ba de dag thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the third general characteristic.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i gzugs la sred pa dang las kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i gzugs la sred pa dang las kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The form that is created by the craving and karma of the stage of meditative equipoise is to be known as the form of the form realm.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i gzugs la sred pa dang las kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i gzugs la sred pa dang las kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The form that is created by the craving and karma of the stage of nonequipoise is called the form of the desire realm.

original: khams las gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis po de dag yin te /
analyzed: khams las gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis po de dag yin te /
translated: In brief, the classification of form by realm is twofold.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams la ni gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form in the formless realm.

original: de la gzugs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'di lta ste /
translated: The general characteristics of form are as follows.

original: lag pa dang bong ba la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg par byar rung ba gang yin pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid de ni thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa dang bong ba la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg par byar rung ba gang yin pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid de ni thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is suitable to be contacted by contact with the hand, a clod, and so on is the general characteristic. It is not omnipresent.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni thams cad du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni thams cad du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Except for the gods of the realm of desire, all beings in the other realms of desire are subject to the eight worldly conditions.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni lag pa dang dbyug pa dang mtshon cha'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg na gnod par ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni lag pa dang dbyug pa dang mtshon cha'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg na gnod par ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The bodies of the gods of the realm of desire are injured by the contact of hands, sticks, and weapons.

original: grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not injured by the contact of cold, heat, hunger, thirst, etc.

original: de dag gi bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa yo byad thams cad ni 'dun pa bskyed pa tsam gyis legs par 'grub par 'gyur pas /🔽de'i phyir de dag la bkres pa dang @204a * //
analyzed: de dag gi bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa yo byad thams cad ni 'dun pa bskyed pa tsam gyis legs par 'grub par 'gyur pas / de'i phyir de dag la bkres pa dang @204a * //
translated: All their necessities, food, drink, etc., are produced by the mere wish for them.

original: skom pa dag 'byung yang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skom pa dag 'byung yang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though hunger and thirst do occur among them, they are not injurious.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs ni lag pa dang dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis kyang reg na yang gnod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs ni lag pa dang dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis kyang reg na yang gnod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The form of the form realm is not harmed by contact with hands, sticks, or weapons.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also not harmed by any other contact.

original: lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs can ni gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs can ni gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: Virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral form that is bodily action and verbal action is called form.

original: de ltar na de ni las las gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni las las gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the classification of form should be understood as being established from action.

original: chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga po de dag nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga po de dag nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification of non-form dharmas should be understood as being established by the five aspects that are the opposite of that.

original: gzugs 'dus pa ni gzugs 'dus pa rnam par gzhag pa las mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa ni gzugs 'dus pa rnam par gzhag pa las mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The form aggregate is summarized in two ways in the presentation of the collection of form.

original: ma 'dres pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / ma 'dres pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / ma 'dres pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: derived from the great elements that are not mixed, and derived from the great elements that are mixed.

original: de la ma 'dres pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa ni gang la 'byung ba chen po gcig kho na dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ma 'dres pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa ni gang la 'byung ba chen po gcig kho na dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, that which is derived from the great elements that are not mixed is that in which only one great element is observed.

original: ma 'dres pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba las gyur ba ni gang las 'byung ba chen po gnyis sam de bas lhag pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba las gyur ba ni gang las 'byung ba chen po gnyis sam de bas lhag pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: That which is derived from the great elements that are mixed is that in which two or more great elements are observed.

original: de la ma 'dres pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dus pa la ni rdul phra rab ma gtogs par 'byung ba rnams 'dres shing dbyer med pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ma 'dres pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dus pa la ni rdul phra rab ma gtogs par 'byung ba rnams 'dres shing dbyer med pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, in the aggregate of form that is derived from the great elements that are not mixed, the great elements are mixed and inseparable, except for the atom.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi phyogs gcig dbyer med pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi phyogs gcig dbyer med pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the great elements do not have an inseparable part.

original: ma 'dres pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dus pa la ni rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / phyogs gcig dbyer med pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dus pa la ni rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / phyogs gcig dbyer med pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: But the form derived from the great elements that is not discrete is to be understood as being inseparable from the other great elements, just as derived form is from the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the great elements are not themselves derived form.

original: gcig la gcig brten cing 'jug pa nyid ma yin pa dang / yul tha dad pa gnon pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten cing 'jug pa nyid ma yin pa dang / yul tha dad pa gnon pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not mutually dependent, and because they have the power to occupy the same place.

original: de las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams ni phyogs gcig dbyer med pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams ni phyogs gcig dbyer med pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The great elements and the form derived from them are to be understood as being inseparable from one part.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na nor bu 'od sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / dkar po dang ldan pa za ma tog tu bcug @204b pa rnams kyi 'od sna tshogs dag dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na nor bu 'od sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / dkar po dang ldan pa za ma tog tu bcug @204b pa rnams kyi 'od sna tshogs dag dang 'dra'o //
translated: the various colors of a jewel placed in a box are like the great elements.

original: de la 'dres shing dbyer med pa dang 'dra bar dpe'i don yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dres shing dbyer med pa dang 'dra bar dpe'i don yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the example should be understood as before, in terms of being mixed and inseparable.

original: yang til dang sran chung dang / mon sran gre'u la sogs pa dang / phye ma zhib mo rnams dang / sbrang rtsi dang bu ram la sogs pa bsres pas bsdus pa'i 'dus pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs gcig dbyer med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang til dang sran chung dang / mon sran gre'u la sogs pa dang / phye ma zhib mo rnams dang / sbrang rtsi dang bu ram la sogs pa bsres pas bsdus pa'i 'dus pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs gcig dbyer med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, any collection that is a mixture of sesame seeds, lentils, beans, etc., fine powders, honey, molasses, etc., should be seen as not being an inseparable part.

original: 'dres pa'i dngos pos dbyer med pa yang ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i dngos pos dbyer med pa yang ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as not being inseparable due to the nature of being mixed.

original: 'on kyang 'dus pa de ni sbyor bas dbyer med pa yin pa dang / mang po 'dus pa las byung ba yin pas 'dus pa gcig gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dus pa de ni sbyor bas dbyer med pa yin pa dang / mang po 'dus pa las byung ba yin pas 'dus pa gcig gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: However, that collection is not the characteristic of a single collection, because it is inseparable due to combination and because it arises from a collection of many.

original: de las gzhan pa ni 'dus pa gcig gi mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni 'dus pa gcig gi mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The other should be seen as the characteristic of a single collection.

original: phyogs gcig dbyer med pa la brten pa ni 'dres pa'i dngos po dbyer med par yang yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gcig dbyer med pa la brten pa ni 'dres pa'i dngos po dbyer med par yang yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: That which is based on an inseparable part should be seen as also being inseparable due to the nature of being mixed.

original: gzhan du na de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable.

original: de la chos bstan du yod pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos bstan du yod pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of those phenomena that are demonstrable is also established by five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / rnam par rig byed dang / mig gi yul dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pas so //
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / rnam par rig byed dang / mig gi yul dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pas so //
translated: color, shape, informative form, the object of the eye, and the object of eye consciousness.

original: chos bstan du med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos bstan du med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification of those phenomena that are not demonstrable should be understood as being established by the five aspects that are the opposite of those.

original: de la chos thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of those phenomena that are obstructed is also established by five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: yul mnan te gnas pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i gzugs 'dus pa 'gro ba'i go skabs la sgrib pa dang / lag pa dang bong ba dang dbyug pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis gzugs su rung ba dang / dang ba'i gzugs thams cad kyi gzung ba yin pa dang /
analyzed: yul mnan te gnas pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i gzugs 'dus pa 'gro ba'i go skabs la sgrib pa dang / lag pa dang bong ba dang dbyug pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis gzugs su rung ba dang / dang ba'i gzugs thams cad kyi gzung ba yin pa dang /
translated: It is the basis of the obstruction of the opportunity for the movement of other forms that are not in the process of being pressed down. It is the basis of the suitability of form that is the contact of the hand, the foot, the stick, etc. It is the object of all forms that are clear.

original: dang ba'i gzugs la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa yin pas so //🔽chos thogs pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang ba'i gzugs la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa yin pas so // chos thogs pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the object of all consciousnesses that are based on clear forms.🔽The classification of unobscured form should be understood as the opposite of the above five aspects.

original: de la chos bstan du med la thogs pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos bstan du med la thogs pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of unobscured form should be understood as the opposite of the above five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rgyu dang / yul @205a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang / yul @205a * //
translated: The cause, the object,

original: gnon pa dang / snang ba dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / dmigs pas so //
analyzed: gnon pa dang / snang ba dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / dmigs pas so //
translated: the pressing down, the clarity, and the absence of change.

original: de la mthu dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i gzugs la mos pa ni bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs skye ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mthu dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i gzugs la mos pa ni bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs skye ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The form that is the cause for the arising of the form that is not demonstrable but has an obstruction is the form that is associated with the concentration that possesses the power.

original: de skyes na yul na gnas par snang bas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de skyes na yul na gnas par snang bas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: When it arises, it appears as if it were located in a place. Therefore, it is called form.

original: de skye mched gzugs can bcu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de skye mched gzugs can bcu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it possesses the intrinsic identity of the ten physical sense spheres.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba yang /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba yang /
translated: The appearance of its intrinsic reality

original: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs 'dus pa 'gro ba'i las kyi go skabs la yang sgrib par mi gnas la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs 'dus pa 'gro ba'i las kyi go skabs la yang sgrib par mi gnas la /
translated: does not obstruct the opportunity for the activity of beings who are in a different place from it.

original: dang ba'i gzugs thams cad dang ; de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul yang ma yin /
analyzed: dang ba'i gzugs thams cad dang ; de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the object of all the forms of clear form and the consciousnesses that are based on it.

original: dmigs pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: It is not an objective support.

original: de'i phyir bstan du med la thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan du med la thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “not demonstrable” and “without obstruction.”

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis gnod par byar med pas /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis gnod par byar med pas /
translated: It cannot be harmed by contact with the hand or any other part of the body.

original: de'i phyir gyur pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gyur pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “unobstructed.”

original: dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin ni mthu dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin ni mthu dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The concentration of the actual basis is called “powerful concentration.”

original: gzugs de ni de'i dmigs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs de ni de'i dmigs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That form is its object, not others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na / sems thams cad kyis sprul pa sprul par mi nus kyi sems can gang mthu dang ldan pa des sprul par nus pa de bzhin du mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems mthu dang ldan pa de la bstan nas /🔽bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs de /
analyzed: dper na / sems thams cad kyis sprul pa sprul par mi nus kyi sems can gang mthu dang ldan pa des sprul par nus pa de bzhin du mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems mthu dang ldan pa de la bstan nas / bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs de /
translated: all minds cannot emanate emanations; only those sentient beings who have power can emanate emanations.🔽Similarly, that invisible and unimpeded form arises from the powerful mind of equipoise.

original: sprul pa lta bur 'byung zhing de nyid de'i dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bur 'byung zhing de nyid de'i dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: That is its object,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa mthu dang mi ldan pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa mthu dang mi ldan pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the powerless mind of nonequipoise.

original: chos bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gsum pa /
analyzed: chos bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gsum pa /
translated: The classification of objects that are visible and impeded should be understood in the reverse order of the five.

original: de la chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of dharmas with outflows is also established by five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gzhi dang bag la nyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa dang / mngon par skye bas so //
analyzed: gzhi dang bag la nyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa dang / mngon par skye bas so //
translated: The basis, latent tendency, concomitance, object, and manifestation.

original: chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gzhi gang zhe na /🔽dang ba'i gzugs dang de dang 'brel pa dang / ma 'brel ba'i phyi rol gyi gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can dang nyon @205b mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
analyzed: chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gzhi gang zhe na / dang ba'i gzugs dang de dang 'brel pa dang / ma 'brel ba'i phyi rol gyi gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can dang nyon @205b mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
translated: What is the basis of dharmas with outflows?

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: It is clear form, form connected to it, external form not connected to it, defiled and undefiled dharmas of mind and mental factors, and virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral dharmas of mind and mental factors.

original: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzhi de ni rnam pa bzhi po bag la nyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa dang mngon par skye ba dag gis ci rigs par zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzhi de ni rnam pa bzhi po bag la nyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa dang mngon par skye ba dag gis ci rigs par zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the basis that is accompanied by the contaminants is accompanied by the contaminants by way of the four modes: latent tendency, association, objective, and origination.

original: de la dang ba'i gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos ji skad bstan pa thams cad la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon yang dag par ma bcom pa dang / ma spangs pa gang yin pa de ni bag la nyal zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang ba'i gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos ji skad bstan pa thams cad la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon yang dag par ma bcom pa dang / ma spangs pa gang yin pa de ni bag la nyal zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The latent tendency is the non-eradication and non-abandonment of the seeds of the afflictions in all the forms of clear form and mind and mental factors as they have been explained.

original: gnas ngan len kyang de yin no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len kyang de yin no //
translated: It is also called negative reflex action.

original: de'i phyir ji skad du de ma lus par ma spangs pa'i bar du nges na de dag bag la nyal las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du de ma lus par ma spangs pa'i bar du nges na de dag bag la nyal las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as they are not completely abandoned, they are called accompanied by the contaminants by way of the latent tendency.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa las kyang zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa las kyang zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those defiled dharmas that are mind and mental activities are also called impure by association.

original: dngos po yod pa dang / mngon sum gyi spyod yul dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis byung ba gang yin pa de ni zag pa'i dmigs pa las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang / mngon sum gyi spyod yul dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis byung ba gang yin pa de ni zag pa'i dmigs pa las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is existent, the domain of direct perception, and arises by the power of the impure is called impure by the object of the impure.

original: de la da ltar gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la da ltar gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yin no //
translated: Among those, that which is present is existent. That which is past and future is nonexistent.

original: dang ba la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin la de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi spyod yul ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang ba la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin la de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi spyod yul ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is the domain of consciousness supported by clarity is the domain of direct perception. That which is other than that should be understood as not the domain of direct perception.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis byung ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis byung ba 'di lta ste /
translated: That which arises by the power of the impure is as follows.

original: nang gi skye mched kyi dbang gis phyi rol gyi skye mched dag 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang de'i dmigs pa kho na las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched kyi dbang gis phyi rol gyi skye mched dag 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang de'i dmigs pa kho na las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The external sense-spheres that arise through the power of the internal sense-spheres are also said to be associated with the outflows only in relation to the internal sense-spheres.🔽Thus, the past and future internal sense-spheres that are the object-field of the defilements are said to be associated with the outflows only in relation to the defilements that have them for their object-field.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs nas byung ba'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de ni med pa'i phyir dmigs la las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs nas byung ba'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de ni med pa'i phyir dmigs la las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: But the past and future internal sense-spheres that are not the object-field of the defilements are not associated with the outflows.

original: da ltar gyi dngos po yin yang mngon sum gyi spyod yul ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po yin yang mngon sum gyi spyod yul ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are things that exist in the present but are not the object-field of direct perception.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,🔽the subtle form, the defiled, wholesome, or non-defined thought and thought-concomitants,

original: dang ba'i gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa thams cad do /
analyzed: dang ba'i gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa thams cad do /
translated: and all unmanifested action.

original: @206a * // de dag kyang nyon mongs pa'i dmigs pa las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: @206a * // de dag kyang nyon mongs pa'i dmigs pa las zag pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: These are not said to be associated with the outflows in relation to the object-field of the defilements.

original: 'di ltar rang gis yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan mas de la nyon mongs pa 'byung ba de'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gis yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan mas de la nyon mongs pa 'byung ba de'i phyir te /
translated: Because the afflictions arise in it through the signs that it fully imagines.

original: chos de gsal bar de'i spyod yul du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos de gsal bar de'i spyod yul du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the object is clearly present to it as its domain.

original: de la mngon par skye pa las zag pa dang bcas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par skye pa las zag pa dang bcas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, that which is defiled by origination is as follows:

original: bag la nyal yang ma spangs shing /
analyzed: bag la nyal yang ma spangs shing /
translated: The latent afflictions have not been abandoned,

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas dang mthun pa'i yul yang snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas dang mthun pa'i yul yang snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: and objects that are the basis of the afflictions appear.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: When incorrect mental activity is present,

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des chos gang la la skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des chos gang la la skye ba'am /
translated: through that cause and that condition, whatever dharma arises,

original: skyes pa'am / skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni mngon par skye ba las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'am / skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni mngon par skye ba las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: or has arisen, or will arise, all of that should be known as defiled by origination.

original: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i nyon mongs pa dag las rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu'i phyi rol gyi dngos po gang dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang mngon par skye ba las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i nyon mongs pa dag las rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu'i phyi rol gyi dngos po gang dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang mngon par skye ba las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all those external things that are produced by the maturation of non-virtuous afflictions and by the power of maturation should be seen as being defiled by arising.

original: gzhan yang lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dag gis der nyid mtshams sbyor ba gang yin pa de yang nying mtshams sbyor zhing mngon par skye ba las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dag gis der nyid mtshams sbyor ba gang yin pa de yang nying mtshams sbyor zhing mngon par skye ba las zag pa dang bcas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is the linking of birth there by the neutral afflictions associated with form and the formless should be known as defiled by linking and arising.

original: de ltar na chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga po gzhi dang bag la nyal dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa dang skyes pa kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga po gzhi dang bag la nyal dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa dang skyes pa kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the classification of dharmas with outflows should be known as being established by just five aspects: basis, latent tendencies, concomitance, object, and arising.

original: de la chos zag pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos zag pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of uncontaminated dharmas is also established as just five types.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: Dharmas called uncontaminated exist because they are free from the entanglements.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi gnas dang dmigs pa'i gzugs dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi gnas dang dmigs pa'i gzugs dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The form that is the basis and focal object of all virtuous and neutral minds and mental factors and the virtuous and neutral minds and mental factors themselves.

original: bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: Dharmas called uncontaminated exist because they abandon latent states.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa @206b thams cad spangs pa'i dge ba gang yin pa dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lung du ma bstan pa de dag la la gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lung du ma bstan pa gang dag yin pa dang /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa @206b thams cad spangs pa'i dge ba gang yin pa dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lung du ma bstan pa de dag la la gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lung du ma bstan pa gang dag yin pa dang /
translated: Virtue is that which abandons all afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation, unobscured neutral states that are derivative form and mundane unobscured neutral states.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: They are virtuous mental and physical states.

original: gang dag 'gag pa'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag 'gag pa'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also uncontaminated phenomena that are called uncontaminated because they cease.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are🔽the nonarising of afflicted mental and physical states.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can de dag mi 'byung bas zag pa med pa yin pa dang / de dag mi 'byung bas rab tu phye ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can de dag mi 'byung bas zag pa med pa yin pa dang / de dag mi 'byung bas rab tu phye ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: They are uncontaminated because they do not arise and nirvana is classified as uncontaminated because it is distinguished by their nonarising.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang zag pa med pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang zag pa med pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Nirvana is also called uncontaminated.

original: gang dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i gnyen po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i gnyen po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also pure dharmas, which are called anāsrava, because they are the antidote to the abandonment of that which is to be abandoned by the path of vision and because they are liberated by their intrinsic nature.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: mthong ba'i lam thams cad do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thams cad do //
translated: They are all the path of vision.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i gnyen po dang / ngo bo nyid dang rgyud rnam par grol ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i gnyen po dang / ngo bo nyid dang rgyud rnam par grol ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also pure dharmas, which are called anāsrava, because they are the antidote to the abandonment of that which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation and because they are liberated by their intrinsic nature and by their continuum.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam ste /
translated: They are the supramundane path of cultivation and the path of no-more-learning.

original: chos zag pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga po de dag gis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos zag pa med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga po de dag gis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification of pure dharmas should be understood as being established by these five aspects.

original: de la chos nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag pa'ang rnam pa lngas blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag pa'ang rnam pa lngas blta bar bya ste /
translated: The classification of dharmas with defilements should also be understood as being established by five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gnas dang / gzhi dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / kun nas slong bas so //
analyzed: gnas dang / gzhi dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / kun nas slong bas so //
translated: The basis, the ground, the nature, the companion, and the instigation.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po ni chos nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po ni chos nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the five appropriated aggregates are called the basis of the dharmas with defilements.

original: de la ro myang ba la lhag par chags pa dang / ro myang ba la yongs su zhen pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ro myang ba la lhag par chags pa dang / ro myang ba la yongs su zhen pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the attachment to the enjoyment of the taste and the clinging to the enjoyment of the taste are called the ground of defilement.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Among them, impermanence, suffering, and the nature of change are called the nature of defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa de la mi shes shing rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i grogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de la mi shes shing rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i grogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the ignorance and delusion regarding that defilement are called its companion.

original: de la brten nas nag po'i phyogs rnam pa lnga 'byung ba ni de kun nas slong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas nag po'i phyogs rnam pa lnga 'byung ba ni de kun nas slong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, the arising of the five aspects of the dark side in dependence on that is called its instigation.

original: de la @207a * //
analyzed: de la @207a * //
translated: Among them,

original: 'dod pa dang lta ba la lhag par zhen pa las 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang lta ba la lhag par zhen pa las 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa'am /
translated: Quarrel, reproof, dispute, and contention arise from attachment to desire and views.

original: gzhan gang yang rung ba dag 'byung ba ni nag po'i phyogs dang po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ba dag 'byung ba ni nag po'i phyogs dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first dark side.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa gang yang rung bas mi 'dzim zhing de la shas cher gnas pa gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa gang yang rung bas mi 'dzim zhing de la shas cher gnas pa gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second dark side is the lack of faith and the predominance of the afflictions that are due to any of the afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dka' thub drag po pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dka' thub drag po pa rnams sam /
translated: the path of deception of those who are devoted to severe austerities,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze zas mi za ba dang / mer 'jug pa dang / g-yang sar mchod pa la sogs pa mos pa rnams kyi slu ba'i lam gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze zas mi za ba dang / mer 'jug pa dang / g-yang sar mchod pa la sogs pa mos pa rnams kyi slu ba'i lam gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs gsum pa yin no //
translated: or of those ascetics and brahmins who are devoted to fasting, to fire, to jumping into the water, to jumping from a cliff, and so on, is the third dark side.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The fourth dark side is the misdeeds of body, speech, and mind.

original: yang srid pa 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni nag po'i phyogs lnga pa yin no //
translated: The one who desires rebirth is the fifth one on the dark side.

original: de la dang pos ni khon dang bcas pa dang / nyes rtsom gyi sems kyis bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni khon dang bcas pa dang / nyes rtsom gyi sems kyis bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the first one should be regarded as not resting in comfort because of a mind that is full of resentment and is full of evil.

original: gnyis pas ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung bas bdag nyid bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung bas bdag nyid bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second one should be regarded as not resting in comfort because of the torment of the afflictions.

original: gsum pas ni don med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yongs su ngal ba khas blang pas bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pas ni don med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yongs su ngal ba khas blang pas bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third one should be regarded as not resting in comfort because of accepting useless suffering and fatigue.

original: bzhi pas ni ngan song gi 'gro bar skye bas bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni ngan song gi 'gro bar skye bas bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fourth one should be regarded as not resting in comfort because of being born in the lower realms.

original: lnga pas ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang mi 'bral bas bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o//
analyzed: lnga pas ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang mi 'bral bas bde ba la reg par mi gnas par blta bar bya'o//
translated: The fifth one should be regarded as not resting in comfort because of not being free from the suffering of birth, old age, death, and so on.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gnas su gyur pa de dag ni gzhi dang bcas pa dang / grogs dang bcas pa dang / kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa de dang ldan pas na chos nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gnas su gyur pa de dag ni gzhi dang bcas pa dang / grogs dang bcas pa dang / kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa de dang ldan pas na chos nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates that are the basis of the afflicted are called “afflicted phenomena” because they are associated with that affliction that has a basis, has a companion, and has a motivating force.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The classification of non-afflicted phenomena is also established by just the opposite of those five aspects.

original: de la nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni gnas yin te /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni gnas yin te /
translated: Among them, the five non-appropriative aggregates are the basis.

original: de la gzhi dang bcas pa dang / grogs dang bcas pa dang / kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa de mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de la gzhi dang bcas pa dang / grogs dang bcas pa dang / kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa de mi dmigs pas /
translated: Because the affliction that has a basis, has a companion, and has a motivating force is not observed in them,

original: de'i phyir @207b de dag ni chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir @207b de dag ni chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore they are called “non-afflicted phenomena.”

original: de la chos zang zing dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos zang zing dang bcas pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of the Dharma with material gifts is also established in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gnas dang gzhi la sogs pa rnam pa lngas te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas dang gzhi la sogs pa rnam pa lngas te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In five ways, such as basis and foundation, as before.

original: de la gnas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po nyid do //🔽gzhi ni de nyid la bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i gnas dang mthun pa ro myang ba'i gzhi'i chos yod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la gnas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po nyid do // gzhi ni de nyid la bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i gnas dang mthun pa ro myang ba'i gzhi'i chos yod pa rnams so //
translated: Here, the basis is the five appropriative aggregates.🔽The foundation is the existence of the Dharma that is the basis for the experience of pleasure and mental pleasure.

original: ngo bo nyid ni de la brten nas ro myang bas bsdus pa'i bde ba skye ba dang yid bde ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni de la brten nas ro myang bas bsdus pa'i bde ba skye ba dang yid bde ba skye ba'o //
translated: The essence is the arising of pleasure and mental pleasure that is included in the experience that is based on that.

original: grogs ni ro myang ba de la kun du 'dod chags shing lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: grogs ni ro myang ba de la kun du 'dod chags shing lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The companion is the desire and attachment to that experience.

original: kun nas slong ba ni nag po'i phyogs rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni nag po'i phyogs rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The instigation is the five aspects of the dark side,

original: snga ma kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: which should be understood just as before.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gnas su gyur pa de dag ni gzhi dang gnas pa nas kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i bar gyi zang zing de dang ldan pa'i phyir zang zing dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gnas su gyur pa de dag ni gzhi dang gnas pa nas kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i bar gyi zang zing de dang ldan pa'i phyir zang zing dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates that are the basis of the transformation are called “with-material-form” because they are associated with that material-form which is the basis, the support, up to the instigation.

original: chos zang zing med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos zang zing med pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the Dharma that is without-material-form is also established by just the opposite of those five aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa med pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The absence of afflictions should be applied as appropriate, as previously explained.

original: chos zhen pa la brten pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos zhen pa la brten pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The classification of the Dharma that is based on attachment is also to be seen as established by just five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gnas dang gzhi la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas dang gzhi la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The basis, the support, and so forth are the same as before.

original: de la gnas ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
analyzed: de la gnas ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
translated: Therein, the basis of the Dharma that is based on attachment is the five appropriative aggregates that are associated with desire.

original: gzhi ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnas dang mthun pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag go //
analyzed: gzhi ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnas dang mthun pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag go //
translated: The basis is the five sense objects, which are the basis for the desire realm's attachment.

original: zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen de dang dmigs pa de las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen de dang dmigs pa de las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: The nature of clinging is the desire realm's attachment that arises from those conditions and that focal object.

original: grogs ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i log par smon pa 'dod pa la kun du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: grogs ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i log par smon pa 'dod pa la kun du rtog pa ste /
translated: The companion is the false aspiration that is associated with improper mental attention, which is the imagination of desire.

original: de dang 'grogs na de kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'grogs na de kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is accompanied by that, it is called the imagination of desire.

original: kun nas slong ba ni nag po'i phyogs rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni nag po'i phyogs rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The motivation is the five aspects of the dark side,

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: as before.

original: 'dod chags pa dang ldan pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag ni gzhi dang bcas pa dang / grogs dang bcas pa dang / kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i zhen pa des yongs su zin pa'i phyir chos zhen pa la brten pa rnams zhes @208a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa dang ldan pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag ni gzhi dang bcas pa dang / grogs dang bcas pa dang / kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i zhen pa des yongs su zin pa'i phyir chos zhen pa la brten pa rnams zhes @208a * //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates that are associated with attachment are called “the phenomena that are based on clinging” because they are fully embraced by that clinging, which has a basis, a companion, and a motivation.
