original: bya'o ; / chos nges par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /🔽snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bya'o ; / chos nges par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The classification of those based on the Dharma of definite emergence is also established by just the opposite of those five aspects.

original: de la chos 'jig rten pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'jig rten pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of mundane dharmas is also established by just the opposite of those five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang ba'i gzugs dang / dang bas gzung ba'i gzugs thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lung du ma bstan pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang ba'i gzugs dang / dang bas gzung ba'i gzugs thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lung du ma bstan pa thams cad dang /
translated: Mundane pure form, all form apprehended by the pure, all afflicted mental and mental factors of the mundane, all neutral mental and mental factors of the mundane, and

original: 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba dang spang bar bya ba dang spangs pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul 'jig rten pa'i gzugs bstan du med la thogs pa med pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba dang spang bar bya ba dang spangs pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul 'jig rten pa'i gzugs bstan du med la thogs pa med pa thams cad do //
translated: all mundane meditative attainments that are the object of mundane concentration, and all mundane form that is not visible and is not without form.

original: chos 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of supramundane factors is also established by means of five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po rnams dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po rnams dang / 'du shes rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po rnams dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po rnams dang / 'du shes rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The counteractives of factors to be abandoned by the path of vision, the counteractives of factors to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and the liberation by the liberation of perception, namely:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spros pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa'i shes rab dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / de'i dmigs pa bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spros pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa'i shes rab dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / de'i dmigs pa bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs dang /
translated: The wisdom of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas that engages the mode of unelaborate reality, the mind and mental factors associated with that wisdom and the unapparent and unobstructing form that is the focal object of that wisdom.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Liberation through liberation from one part of the opposing factors is as follows.

original: slob pa rnams dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba 'di lta ste /🔽mi slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: slob pa rnams dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba 'di lta ste / mi slob pa rnams so //
translated: Liberation through liberation from all opposing factors is as follows.

original: de la 'jig rten pa de dag kyang 'jig rten rnam pa lnga las brtsams nas der gtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa de dag kyang 'jig rten rnam pa lnga las brtsams nas der gtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mundane is called mundane since it is based on the five mundane states.

original: 'jig rten rnam pa lnga ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / 'dod pa'i 'jig rten dang / gzugs kyi 'jig rten dang / gzugs med pa'i 'jig rten yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam pa lnga ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / 'dod pa'i 'jig rten dang / gzugs kyi 'jig rten dang / gzugs med pa'i 'jig rten yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The five kinds of world are the world of sentient beings, the world of the physical cosmos, the world of the desire realm, the world of the form realm, and the world of the formless realm.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag @208b ni 'jig rten rnam pa lnga po der ma gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag @208b ni 'jig rten rnam pa lnga po der ma gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those things that are supramundane are not included in these five kinds of world.

original: de la chos 'dus byas rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'dus byas rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of conditioned things is also established by means of five aspects.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' nas mi 'byung ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' rnam par zhi ba dang / dbus kyi mthar rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi rgyun dang / 'bras bu'i rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' nas mi 'byung ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' rnam par zhi ba dang / dbus kyi mthar rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi rgyun dang / 'bras bu'i rgyun gyis so //
translated: They are: not arising in the future, being pacified in the past, abiding in their own characteristics in the present, the continuity of causes and conditions, and the continuity of results.

original: chos 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of unconditioned things is also established by means of five aspects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho na gang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho na gang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the opposite of these five is the correct🔽method.🔽It is not the correct method to ask whether nirvana exists separately

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas 'gags pa las gud na yod dam zhes 'dri ba yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas 'gags pa las gud na yod dam zhes 'dri ba yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la /
translated: from the cessation of compounded phenomena.

original: lan 'debs pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin /
translated: It is not the correct method to answer this question.

original: sems pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is not the correct method to think about this.🔽It is not the correct method to ask whether nirvana exists separately,🔽whether it both exists and does not exist separately, or whether it neither

original: gud na med pa dang / gud na yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / gud na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes 'dri ba yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: gud na med pa dang / gud na yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / gud na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes 'dri ba yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la /
translated: exists nor does not exist separately.

original: lan 'debs pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin /
translated: It is not the correct method to answer this question.

original: sems pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is not the correct method to think about this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽Because cessation is merely the pacification of compounded phenomena,

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa ni 'dus byas rnam par zhi ba tsam dang / 'dus byas dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa ni 'dus byas rnam par zhi ba tsam dang / 'dus byas dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and it is distinguished by having characteristics that are different from those of compounded phenomena.

original: de la 'dus byas rnam par zhi ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ni gud na yod dam zhes 'dri ba'am /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas rnam par zhi ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ni gud na yod dam zhes 'dri ba'am /
translated: The question Is nirvana a thing that exists elsewhere?

original: lan 'debs pa'am /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa'am /
translated: is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a mere appeasement of the conditioned.

original: sems pa ni ma spros pa spros par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems pa ni ma spros pa spros par byas pa yin no //
translated: The question Is nirvana a thing that does not exist elsewhere?🔽is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that is not similar to the conditioned.🔽The question Is nirvana a thing that both exists and does not exist elsewhere?🔽is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that both exists and does not exist elsewhere.🔽The question Is nirvana a thing that neither exists nor does not exist elsewhere?

original: 'dus byas dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ni gud na med dam zhes 'dri ba dang / lan 'debs pa dang / sems pa yang ma spros pa kho na spros par byas pa yin no //🔽ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu gnyis po 'dus pa de gnyis kyis ni gud na yod pa dang gud na med pa yin nam zhes 'dri ba dang lan 'debs pa dang / sems pa nyid kyang mi rung ba //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ni gud na med dam zhes 'dri ba dang / lan 'debs pa dang / sems pa yang ma spros pa kho na spros par byas pa yin no // ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu gnyis po 'dus pa de gnyis kyis ni gud na yod pa dang gud na med pa yin nam zhes 'dri ba dang lan 'debs pa dang / sems pa nyid kyang mi rung ba //
translated: is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that neither exists nor does not exist elsewhere.🔽The question Is nirvana a thing that is neither of the two, that is, neither a thing that exists nor a thing that does not exist elsewhere?🔽is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that is neither of the two, that is, neither a thing that exists nor a thing that does not exist elsewhere.🔽The question Is nirvana a thing that is both of the two, that is, both a thing that exists and a thing that does not exist elsewhere?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yin no zhes gang 'di snyam du mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas 'gags pa las gud na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin no snyam du sems shing 'dri ba
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yin no zhes gang 'di snyam du mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas 'gags pa las gud na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin no snyam du sems shing 'dri ba
translated: is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that is both of the two, that is, both a thing that exists and a thing that does not exist elsewhere.🔽The question Is nirvana a thing that is neither of the two, that is, neither a thing that exists nor a thing that does not exist elsewhere?🔽is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that is neither of the two, that is, neither a thing that exists nor a thing that does not exist elsewhere.🔽The question Is nirvana a thing that is neither of the two, that is, neither a thing that exists nor a thing that does not exist elsewhere?🔽is asked or answered or thought in order to refute the notion that nirvana is a thing that is neither of the two, that is, neither a thing that exists nor a thing that does not exist elsewhere.

original: dang / lan 'debs pa @209a * //
analyzed: dang / lan 'debs pa @209a * //
translated: and the response,

original: dang ; sems pa de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: dang ; sems pa de yang mi rung ste /
translated: and the intention, are not appropriate,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du dkar po'i chos thams cad legs par rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du dkar po'i chos thams cad legs par rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all virtuous qualities are well begun for the sake of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba dang spros pa med pa dang / so so rang gi rig pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba dang spros pa med pa dang / so so rang gi rig pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Nirvana should be understood as peaceful, free from elaboration, and characterized by individual self-awareness.

original: de la dmigs pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of the phenomena that are its objects is also presented in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /🔽mi dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /
analyzed: dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod / mi dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /
translated: There are phenomena that are objects of virtuous mental activity.🔽There are phenomena that are objects of nonvirtuous mental activity.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /
translated: There are phenomena that are objects of indeterminate mental activity.

original: khams su gtogs pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /
analyzed: khams su gtogs pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod /
translated: There are phenomena that are objects of mental activity that belong to the realms.

original: rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also objects of meditation that are phenomena which are the focus of attention for those who are endowed with yoga.

original: de la dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: de la dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams yin no //
translated: The objects of meditation for virtuous attention are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena.

original: dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi dge ba yid la byed pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //🔽de la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du bstan pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni khams gsum pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi dge ba yid la byed pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // de la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du bstan pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni khams gsum pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: The objects of meditation for nonvirtuous attention and neutral attention should be understood in the same way as the objects of meditation for virtuous attention.🔽The objects of meditation for virtuous and afflicted attention associated with the desire realm are all phenomena of the three realms.🔽The objects of meditation for virtuous attention associated with the form realm are all phenomena that occur in the three realms.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa yang khams gsum na spyod pa'i chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa yang khams gsum na spyod pa'i chos thams cad yin no //
translated: The objects of meditation for virtuous attention associated with the formless realm are all phenomena that occur in the three realms.🔽The objects of meditation for virtuous attention associated with the uncontaminated are all phenomena.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo gzugs med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo gzugs med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
translated: The objects of meditation for the attention of ordinary beings who are outside this system are the four noble truths.

original: skyes pa rnams kyi gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi sa pa kho na'i chos rnams yin gyi sa 'og ma pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi sa pa kho na'i chos rnams yin gyi sa 'og ma pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: The object field of the wholesome thought of those who possess the formless realm is only the factors of its own stage, not of a lower stage.🔽The object field of the wholesome thought of those who possess the formless realm is all the factors of its own stage and of lower stages, namely:🔽the bodhisattvas who have not obtained mastery and who practice insight;🔽those who are endowed with the extensive differentiation of the vehicle of the disciples;

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang ma thob pa lhag mthong gis spyod pa gang dag yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa bye brag phyed pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa dang / slob pa gang dag yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma thams cad kyang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang ma thob pa lhag mthong gis spyod pa gang dag yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa bye brag phyed pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa dang / slob pa gang dag yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma thams cad kyang yin no //
translated: those who are in training;🔽and those who are perfected.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thob @209b pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzugs med pa rnams su mi skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thob @209b pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzugs med pa rnams su mi skye ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have obtained mastery are not reborn in the formless realm.

original: de dag gis de na sems can la phan gdags pa'i bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rgya chen po ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis de na sems can la phan gdags pa'i bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rgya chen po ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not see the vast benefit to sentient beings, the maturation of the qualities of the Buddha, and the maturation of sentient beings there.

original: de ltar na de dag ni khams su gtogs pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni khams su gtogs pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these are the phenomena that are the objects of mental attention included in the realms.

original: dmigs pa bsams pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa bsams pa las brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the consideration of the object,🔽it is said:

original: ming gis thams cad zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: ming gis thams cad zil gyis gnon //
translated: All is overcome by name.

original: ming las lhag pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: ming las lhag pa yod ma yin //
translated: There is nothing higher than name.

original: ming chos gcig gi dbang rjes su //
analyzed: ming chos gcig gi dbang rjes su //
translated: By the power of a single name,

original: thams cad 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
translated: all will certainly be brought to an end.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'i tshig de'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'i tshig de'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam par byang ba'i rgyu brtag pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid brtag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu brtags pas gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam par byang ba'i rgyu brtag pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid brtag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu brtags pas gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is said: In brief, the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena are taught by investigating the causes of purification, investigating their own characteristics, and investigating the causes of affliction.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med pa las ni ming gi phung po bzhi po dag yongs su shes pas rang gi yul gyi mtshan ma thams cad spangs pas zil gyis gnon la /
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med pa las ni ming gi phung po bzhi po dag yongs su shes pas rang gi yul gyi mtshan ma thams cad spangs pas zil gyis gnon la /
translated: With respect to that, by knowing the four name aggregates that are the selflessness of persons, one overcomes all the signs of one’s own objects and abandons them.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos la bdag med par yongs su shes pa las ni tha snyad las 'byung ba'i ming yongs su shes pas de'i rten gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos la bdag med par yongs su shes pa las ni tha snyad las 'byung ba'i ming yongs su shes pas de'i rten gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: By knowing the selflessness of phenomena that is the imaginary nature, one knows the names that arise from conventions and overcomes all the signs that are their supports.

original: gzugs can ma yi pa'i phung po bzhi po dag las logs shig na bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yi pa'i phung po bzhi po dag las logs shig na bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs la /
translated: The four name aggregates that are not form are not observed as things that have the characteristics of a self.

original: tha snyad las byung ba'i ming las logs shig na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tha snyad las byung ba'i ming las logs shig na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Apart from the name that arises from convention, the imagined reality, which is the characteristic of an entity, is also not perceived.

original: de gnyi ga yongs su ma shes na yul gyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kun tu slong ba dang / rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yongs su ma shes na yul gyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kun tu slong ba dang / rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If both of those are not understood, the signs of the object that give rise to all afflictions and that continue to arise will follow.

original: yul gyi mtshan ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the afflictions of the signs of the object arise due to the power of that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de las dgongs nas chos kyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa las ni bdag tu 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de las dgongs nas chos kyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa las ni bdag tu 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: The Bhagavān also had that in mind when he said, “From grasping at the reality of phenomena, grasping at a self arises.

original: de rtogs pas ni de yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pas ni de yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By realizing that, that will also be realized.

original: de rtogs na de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes @210a * //
analyzed: de rtogs na de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes @210a * //
translated: When that is realized, that will cease.”

original: gsungs so // rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gsungs so // rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The object of mental attention endowed with yoga is, in brief, of four kinds.

original: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: the universal object, the object for purifying behavior, the object for expertise, and the object for purifying mental afflictions.

original: dmigs pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni nyan thos kyi sar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni nyan thos kyi sar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The analysis of these objects is like the explanation in the Sravaka Levels.

original: de la nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / de bzhin nyid yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / de bzhin nyid yin par gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught that the object for purifying mental afflictions is the four noble truths and suchness.

original: de la sdug bsngal gsum zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gsum zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Among those, what is the suffering of the formative forces?

original: yang 'byung ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi lus de dang de dag la nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba dang mthun pa kun du 'gro ba'i gnas ngan len du gtogs pa gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi lus de dang de dag la nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba dang mthun pa kun du 'gro ba'i gnas ngan len du gtogs pa gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
translated: Again, the tendency to impurity is the tendency to impurity that is included in the possession of all the afflictions and all suffering that occurs in relation to this or that body generated by karma and the afflictions.

original: de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
translated: This is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: With reference to this suffering of the formative forces, the Lord has declared in the sutra: “In brief, the five perpetuating aggregates are suffering.”

original: de yang bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: This is because it is concomitant with all feelings, whether of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gnas ngan len de yang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni gsal ba dang mngon pa yin pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug
analyzed: gnas ngan len de yang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni gsal ba dang mngon pa yin pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug
translated: And since that negative tendency is clear and manifest in neutral feeling that is neither pain nor pleasure, therefore neutral feeling is suffering due to the suffering of contaminated formations.🔽🔽

original: bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that negative reflex is clear and manifest in the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant. Therefore, the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is said to be suffering by reason of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis rnam par dkrugs pa'i sems kyi gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal de ni yongs su bcad par sla ba ma yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis rnam par dkrugs pa'i sems kyi gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal de ni yongs su bcad par sla ba ma yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The suffering of the negative reflex of the mind that is disturbed by attachment to pleasure and by aversion to pain is not easily discerned.

original: dper na la la zhig gis 'bras yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa la /🔽bsil ba'i reg pa dang phrad pas ni bde ba'i 'du shes skyed par byed la /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig gis 'bras yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa la / bsil ba'i reg pa dang phrad pas ni bde ba'i 'du shes skyed par byed la /
translated: For example, when rice is heated,🔽one has the notion of pleasure when it comes in contact with a cool sensation,

original: 'gyur byed kyi reg pa dang phrad pas ni sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes skyed par @210b byed do ;
analyzed: 'gyur byed kyi reg pa dang phrad pas ni sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes skyed par @210b byed do ;
translated: and one has the notion of pain when it comes in contact with a burning sensation.

original: /'bras yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa de la reg pa de gnyi ga med na ni /
analyzed: /'bras yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa de la reg pa de gnyi ga med na ni /
translated: When both the heat and the contact with the rice are absent,

original: de'i tshe na 'bras de nyid kyi sdug bsngal tsam gsal ba dang mngon par 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang las kyis bskyed pa'i 'du byed gnas ngan len du gtogs pa gnas pa 'bras yongs su gdung ba'i gnas lta bu de la yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'bras de nyid kyi sdug bsngal tsam gsal ba dang mngon par 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang las kyis bskyed pa'i 'du byed gnas ngan len du gtogs pa gnas pa 'bras yongs su gdung ba'i gnas lta bu de la yang /
translated: at that time, the mere suffering of the rice itself becomes clear and manifest. In the same way, in the case of the formations produced by afflictions and karma, which are included in the process of negative tendencies,

original: reg pa bsil ba dang phrad pa'i gnas lta bur ni bde ba'i tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa bsil ba dang phrad pa'i gnas lta bur ni bde ba'i tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: the contact with the rice that is like a place of contact with cool touch should be seen as the feeling of pleasure.

original: 'gyur byed kyi reg pa dang phrad pa'i gnas lta bur ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur byed kyi reg pa dang phrad pa'i gnas lta bur ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The contact with the rice that is like a place of contact with changing touch should be seen as the feeling of pain.

original: reg pa de gnyis ka med par 'bras tsam gyi gnas lta bur ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa de gnyis ka med par 'bras tsam gyi gnas lta bur ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: When both of those contacts are absent, the rice that is like a place of mere rice should be seen as the feeling that is neither painful nor pleasant.

original: de la bde ba'i tshor ba la ni lhag par chags par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la ni 'dod chags bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i tshor ba la ni lhag par chags par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la ni 'dod chags bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one is attached to the feeling of pleasure, therefore, attachment is said to be a latent tendency.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni kun nas mnar sems su 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la ni khong khro ba bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni kun nas mnar sems su 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la ni khong khro ba bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one is hostile to the feeling of pain, therefore, hostility is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len du gtogs pa 'du byed gnas pa'i lus mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba dang /🔽bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log tu 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len du gtogs pa 'du byed gnas pa'i lus mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log tu 'gyur bas /
translated: Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.🔽Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni ma rig pa bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni ma rig pa bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one is confused about the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, therefore, ignorance is said to be a latent tendency.

original: de la bde ba'i tshor ba la lhag par chags pa'i byis pa ni gzhi des tshe 'di la lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad nas lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i tshor ba la lhag par chags pa'i byis pa ni gzhi des tshe 'di la lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad nas lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: When their bodies disintegrate, after death, they are born in the lower realms, the bad rebirths, the hells.

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pas phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pas phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed de /
translated: And through craving for rebirth, they create the suffering of birth in the next life and so on.

original: de ltar na de ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags kun du gnas pas phyi ma la 'gro ba lngar sdug bsngal skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags kun du gnas pas phyi ma la 'gro ba lngar sdug bsngal skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, through attachment to the feeling of pleasure, they create suffering in the five realms in the next life.🔽Those who have a hostile mind toward the feeling of pain are averse to it.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa ni mi 'dod pas reg pa nas des mya ngan byed sgyid lug par byed /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa ni mi 'dod pas reg pa nas des mya ngan byed sgyid lug par byed /
translated: From that, they become sad, discouraged,

original: smre sngags 'don par byed pa nas kun du rmongs pa'i @211a * //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don par byed pa nas kun du rmongs pa'i @211a * //
translated: and lament. From that, they become confused.

original: bar du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bar du 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the middle, it changes.

original: gzhi des nyes par spyod pa gsum char spyad nas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi des nyes par spyod pa gsum char spyad nas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: And on that basis, having engaged in all three kinds of misdeeds, one is reborn in the lower realms.

original: de ltar na de ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro ba kun du gnas pas tshe 'di pa dang / tshe phyi ma pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro ba kun du gnas pas tshe 'di pa dang / tshe phyi ma pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: Thus, because of the presence of aversion to painful feelings, one creates suffering in this life and in future lives.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la de ltar sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags kyis skyed pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro bas skyed pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis po yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir sems pa dang /🔽yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la de ltar sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags kyis skyed pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro bas skyed pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis po yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir sems pa dang /🔽yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: As for the feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful, the mind that is distorted in that way is engaged in and committed to the two kinds of suffering that are created by attachment to pleasant feelings and by aversion to painful feelings, because it does not relinquish them.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang po yod pa de dag gi rtsa ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang po yod pa de dag gi rtsa ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has declared that the many afflictions and secondary afflictions have as their root just these three:

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum kho na yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum kho na yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: greed, hatred, and delusion.🔽With just this in mind, the Lord has said:

original: de nyid las dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya /
analyzed: de nyid las dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya /
translated: “One should view pleasant feeling as suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni zug rdur blta bar bya /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni zug rdur blta bar bya /
translated: one should view painful feeling as a thorn,🔽and one should view neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos can du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos can du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: as subject to cessation.”

original: mi rtag par lta ba ni rim gyis phyin ci log thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag par lta ba ni rim gyis phyin ci log thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who views things as impermanent will gradually eliminate all false views.

original: de ni yang dag par sdug bsngal gyi bde na pa'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag par sdug bsngal gyi bde na pa'i dngos po yin te /
translated: This is the true nature of the suffering of the aggregates.

original: 'phags pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis de gzigs pa rnams ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po mchog tu rab tu zhi ba dag la yang dga' ba mi 'thob na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis de gzigs pa rnams ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po mchog tu rab tu zhi ba dag la yang dga' ba mi 'thob na /
translated: The noble ones who see this with their noble wisdom do not even delight in the supreme peace of the aggregates of the peak of existence.

original: shin tu dman pa dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: shin tu dman pa dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: How much less would they delight in the inferior?

original: yang 'byung pa ba'i las dang nyon mongs pas 'du byed de skyed par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang 'byung pa ba'i las dang nyon mongs pas 'du byed de skyed par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, those formations that are produced by the karma and afflictions of beings are indeed the truth of origination in terms of their characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde'i tshul gyis gtsor ni srid pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde'i tshul gyis gtsor ni srid pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: However, the Bhagavān primarily taught existence as the truth of origination in the sūtras.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len de spangs pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len de spangs pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the negative tendencies that are part of the afflictions is the truth of cessation from the perspective of nirvāṇa with remainder.

original: ma 'ongs pa rgyu yang dag par chad pa rnams kyi mi 'byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i sngon gyi rgyu dang ldan pa rnams kyi rang gi ngang gis @211b 'gag pa ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rgyu yang dag par chad pa rnams kyi mi 'byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i sngon gyi rgyu dang ldan pa rnams kyi rang gi ngang gis @211b 'gag pa ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
translated: The non-arising of those whose causes are completely severed in the future, and the natural cessation of those who have arisen in the present due to their previous causes, are the truth of cessation from the perspective of nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: don dam pa 'dzin par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i yan lag brgyad pa ni lam gyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa 'dzin par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i yan lag brgyad pa ni lam gyi bden pa yin no //
translated: The correct view that grasps the ultimate, and the eightfold noble path preceded by correct view, are the truth of the path.

original: bden pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa'i phyir mtshan nyid bsdus te rnam par gzhag pas rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bden pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa'i phyir mtshan nyid bsdus te rnam par gzhag pas rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: This presentation of the truths is presented by subsuming their characteristics for the purpose of fully understanding suffering, abandoning its origin, manifesting cessation, and cultivating the path.

original: rgya cher rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that the extensive presentation is immeasurable.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa rags pa la brten nas cha phra ba la gzud pa'i phyir dang por skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal nyid du brtags te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa rags pa la brten nas cha phra ba la gzud pa'i phyir dang por skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal nyid du brtags te /
translated: The truth of suffering is first investigated as suffering in terms of origination, etc. in order to lead those who are capable of being led by the gross to the subtle.

original: phyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag bstan to //
analyzed: phyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag bstan to //
translated: Later, the five appropriative aggregates are taught as the truth of suffering.

original: gnas pa sgrub pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gnas pa sgrub pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of the phenomena that are the basis of abiding is also established in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: kham gyi zas dang / reg pa'i zas dang / yid la sems pa'i zas dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas dang / srog gi dbang po ni lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang / reg pa'i zas dang / yid la sems pa'i zas dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas dang / srog gi dbang po ni lnga pa yin no //
translated: They are: the food of morsel, the food of contact, the food of mental volitions, the food of consciousness, and the life faculty as the fifth.

original: de la kham gyi zas ni rags pa yin pas 'dod pa'i khams ni 'gro ba lnga char na yod de /
analyzed: de la kham gyi zas ni rags pa yin pas 'dod pa'i khams ni 'gro ba lnga char na yod de /
translated: Among these, the food of morsel is gross, and therefore it exists in the desire realm in all five types of migration.

original: nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba de dag kha cig na yang yod la /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba de dag kha cig na yang yod la /
translated: It also exists in some of the occasional hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag na ni med do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag na ni med do //
translated: It does not exist in the great hells.

original: zas lhag ma rnams ni khams gsum char na yang dmigs so //
analyzed: zas lhag ma rnams ni khams gsum char na yang dmigs so //
translated: The remaining foods are found in all three realms.

original: srog gi dbang po ni 'du byed rnams la sems can du nye bar gdags pa mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos de dag ni sems can rnams kyi gnas pa bsgrub pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni 'du byed rnams la sems can du nye bar gdags pa mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos de dag ni sems can rnams kyi gnas pa bsgrub pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One has declared that the life faculty is the support of conditioned factors, designating them as sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu bdun gyis 'du byed rnams gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu bdun gyis 'du byed rnams gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: When conditioned factors are supported by seven causes,

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: re zhig dang po kho nar skye ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po kho nar skye ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: First, origination is the cause of the duration of conditioned factors,

original: 'di ltar 'du byed skyes na gnas kyi ma skyes na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed skyes na gnas kyi ma skyes na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because conditioned factors endure when they have originated, but not when they have not originated.

original: srog gi dbang po dang / zas kyang yin no //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang / zas kyang yin no //
translated: The life faculty and nutriment are also causes of duration.

original: sems la dbang ba rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul yang yin te /
analyzed: sems la dbang ba rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul yang yin te /
translated: The supernormal powers of those who have mastery over thought are also causes of duration,

original: 'di ltar de dag ni tshe'i 'du byed bsrings nas bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyu dang @212a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni tshe'i 'du byed bsrings nas bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas pa'i phyir ro // rgyu dang @212a * //
translated: because they can prolong the life formation and remain for an eon or more.

original: rkyen tshogs pa yang gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pa yang gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The collection of causes and conditions is also a cause of duration,🔽because conditioned factors endure as long as the collection of causes and conditions is not destroyed.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du rgyu dang / rkyen dang ma bral ba de srid du /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du rgyu dang / rkyen dang ma bral ba de srid du /
translated: As long as it is not separated from causes and conditions,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the stream of the abiding of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena is uninterrupted.

original: sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pa yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yid la byed pas bsgrubs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pa yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yid la byed pas bsgrubs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The projection of previous karma is the cause of the abiding of formations that are accomplished by the mental attentions of virtue, nonvirtue, and neutrality.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las kyis bskyed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las kyis bskyed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Thus, it is the cause of the abiding of external things that are generated by common and uncommon karma.

original: bar du gcod pa med pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa med pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu bdun pa yin te /
translated: The absence of obstruction is the seventh cause of the abiding of formations.

original: 'du byed gang skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa dang / skyes pa'i 'dra ba'i rgyun dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du byed gang skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa dang / skyes pa'i 'dra ba'i rgyun dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That which does not obstruct the arising of formations and is not a cause of destruction that is not compatible with the stream of the similar arising of formations is a cause of their abiding.

original: gzhan du ni 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Otherwise they would be destroyed.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams zas dag kho nas gnas pa yin par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams zas dag kho nas gnas pa yin par gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Bhagavān say that sentient beings abide due to food?

original: 'du byed rnams ni rgyu gzhan bdun po de dag gis gnas pa yang yin mod kyi /🔽'on kyang gnas pa'i rgyu mang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rgyu gzhan bdun po de dag gis gnas pa yang yin mod kyi / 'on kyang gnas pa'i rgyu mang po 'di lta ste /
translated: Though formations abide due to those seven other causes,🔽the four foods are the many causes of abiding because they cause formations to abide through many different doors.

original: zas bzhi po de dag ni sgo mang po sna tshogs pa dag gis 'du byed rnams gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang ; gzhan yang zas las gyur pa'i gnas pa 'di ni byis pa gzhon nu yan chad kyis kyang gzung sla ba dang /
analyzed: zas bzhi po de dag ni sgo mang po sna tshogs pa dag gis 'du byed rnams gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang ; gzhan yang zas las gyur pa'i gnas pa 'di ni byis pa gzhon nu yan chad kyis kyang gzung sla ba dang /
translated: Moreover, this abiding that is due to food is easy for even young children to understand,

original: 'jug sla ba dang / rtogs par sla ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jug sla ba dang / rtogs par sla ba yin gyi /
translated: easy to engage and easy to realize.

original: gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang zas rnams ni dbang po dang / 'byung ba chen po ma 'phel ba rnams 'phel bar byed pa dang / nad kyis thebs pa rnams kyang nad med par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang zas rnams ni dbang po dang / 'byung ba chen po ma 'phel ba rnams 'phel bar byed pa dang / nad kyis thebs pa rnams kyang nad med par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, food increases faculties and the primary elements that are not increased and it makes those who are sick well.🔽Other foods do not do that.

original: gzhan dag ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sems can tshe ring po dag kyang zas ma rnyed na dus ma yin par 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sems can tshe ring po dag kyang zas ma rnyed na dus ma yin par 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, long-lived sentient beings die untimely if they do not obtain food.

original: sems can thams cad zas kyis gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lam 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad zas kyis gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lam 'di ni /
translated: The path that states, “All sentient beings abide through food,”

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom pa la 'jug sla ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom pa la 'jug sla ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: is easy to enter in the meditation on the foundations of mindfulness and so on.

original: de lta bas na rgyu lnga po de dag gis na sems can rnams zas dag gis gnas pa kho na yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu lnga po de dag gis na sems can rnams zas dag gis gnas pa kho na yin par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said that sentient beings abide through food alone for five reasons.

original: ci'i phyir srog gi dbang po'i dbang @212b du mdzad nas sems can rnams 'du byed kyis gnas par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir srog gi dbang po'i dbang @212b du mdzad nas sems can rnams 'du byed kyis gnas par gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Buddha state that sentient beings abide due to the faculty of life force?🔽There is a place where food is never lacking and where food is not sought with great difficulty.

original: gnas gang na lan 'ga' yang zas ma tshang ba med pa dang / gang na zas tshegs chen pos yongs su btsal mi dgos pa de lta bu'i gnas kyang yod mod kyi gnas de na srog gi dbang po'i dbang kho nas gnas par 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: gnas gang na lan 'ga' yang zas ma tshang ba med pa dang / gang na zas tshegs chen pos yongs su btsal mi dgos pa de lta bu'i gnas kyang yod mod kyi gnas de na srog gi dbang po'i dbang kho nas gnas par 'gyur zhing ;
translated: In that place, sentient beings abide due to the faculty of life force alone.

original: gang dag gi tshe ji ltar 'phangs pa de dag dus de srid du gnas par 'gyur bas /🔽de'i phyir gnas de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: gang dag gi tshe ji ltar 'phangs pa de dag dus de srid du gnas par 'gyur bas / de'i phyir gnas de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Since they live for as long as their life force is projected to last,

original: srog gi dbang pos sems can rnams 'du byed kyis gnas par gsungs so //
analyzed: srog gi dbang pos sems can rnams 'du byed kyis gnas par gsungs so //
translated: the Buddha stated that sentient beings abide due to the faculty of life force.

original: de la kham gyi zas ni dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la kham gyi zas ni dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, it should be stated that material food is included in the sense bases of smell, taste, and tactility.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams legs par zhu bas ni 'phel bar byed la mi mthun par zhu bas ni 'grib par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams legs par zhu bas ni 'phel bar byed la mi mthun par zhu bas ni 'grib par byed kyi /
translated: Thus, smell, taste, and tactility increase when they are well digested and decrease when they are not well digested.

original: de dag las gzhan pa gzugs la sogs pa ni 'phel ba'i phyir yang mi 'jug la 'grib pa'i phyir yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa gzugs la sogs pa ni 'phel ba'i phyir yang mi 'jug la 'grib pa'i phyir yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: But form and so on do not increase or decrease when they are digested or not digested.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni kham gyi zas zhes mi bya'o //🔽de la kham za ba'i tshe na yid du 'ong bas za ba po'i dbang po rnams tshim par byed pa gang yin pa de ni kham gyi zas zhes brjod par mi bya mod kyi 'on kyang de ni reg pa'i zas yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni kham gyi zas zhes mi bya'o // de la kham za ba'i tshe na yid du 'ong bas za ba po'i dbang po rnams tshim par byed pa gang yin pa de ni kham gyi zas zhes brjod par mi bya mod kyi 'on kyang de ni reg pa'i zas yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not called “material food.”🔽When one eats material food, if it satisfies the faculties of the eater through its pleasantness, it is not called “material food,” but rather “food as contact.”

original: gal te de 'phrod pas bde ba dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba de 'ju na ni de zhu ba na kham gyi zas yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de 'phrod pas bde ba dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba de 'ju na ni de zhu ba na kham gyi zas yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If it is digested and brings about pleasure and growth, then it is called “material food.”

original: gal te zhu yang bde ba dang 'phel bar mi 'gyur na ni de zhur zin kyang kham gyi zas yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te zhu yang bde ba dang 'phel bar mi 'gyur na ni de zhur zin kyang kham gyi zas yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: If it does not bring about pleasure and increase, then even though it is digested, it should not be called oral food.

original: kham za ba'i tshe na yid du mi 'ong bas za ba po'i dbang po rnams tshim par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni zas 'ga' yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kham za ba'i tshe na yid du mi 'ong bas za ba po'i dbang po rnams tshim par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni zas 'ga' yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: When one eats food, if it does not bring about pleasure and satisfaction of the faculties because it is unpleasant, then it should not be called food at all.

original: gal te de nyid 'phrod pas zhu ba na bde ba dang 'phel bar 'gyur na ni de kham gyi zas yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de nyid 'phrod pas zhu ba na bde ba dang 'phel bar 'gyur na ni de kham gyi zas yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If it is digested and brings about pleasure and increase, then it should be called oral food.

original: gal te de zhu ba na bde ba dang 'phel bar mi 'gyur na ni de zhur zin kyang zas yin par brjod par mi bya'o //🔽kham gang yin pa de zas kyang yin la /
analyzed: gal te de zhu ba na bde ba dang 'phel bar mi 'gyur na ni de zhur zin kyang zas yin par brjod par mi bya'o // kham gang yin pa de zas kyang yin la /
translated: If it is digested and does not bring about pleasure and increase, then even though it is digested, it should not be called food.🔽Is everything that is oral food also food?

original: zas gang yin pa de yang kham yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zas gang yin pa de yang kham yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is everything that is food also oral food?

original: mu bzhir ci rigs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mu bzhir ci rigs par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The four possibilities are stated as appropriate.

original: de la kham yin la zas ma yin pa ni kham gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar mi 'gyur @213a * //
analyzed: de la kham yin la zas ma yin pa ni kham gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar mi 'gyur @213a * //
translated: Food that is not a morsel is that which does not increase the faculties and the great elements.

original: ba'o ; / zas yin la kham ma yin pa ni reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ba'o ; / zas yin la kham ma yin pa ni reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Food that is not a morsel is contact, intention, and consciousness that increase the faculties and the great elements.

original: zas kyang yin la kham kyang yin pa ni kham gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zas kyang yin la kham kyang yin pa ni kham gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Food that is a morsel and also food is that which increases the faculties and the great elements.

original: kham kyang ma yin la zas kyang ma yin pa ni reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kham kyang ma yin la zas kyang ma yin pa ni reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Food that is neither a morsel nor food is contact, intention, and consciousness that do not increase the faculties and the great elements.

original: reg ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang mu bzhi de bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: reg ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang mu bzhi de bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The remaining four alternatives should be stated in the same way with respect to contact, etc., as is appropriate.

original: de la rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyang rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the dharmas that have karmic maturation should be understood.

original: rnam par smin pa yang rig par bya /🔽rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i chos rnams kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang rig par bya / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i chos rnams kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: The ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.

original: de la rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni mdor bsdu na zag pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //🔽de dag kyang stobs dang ldan pa dang nyams pa dang ma spyad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni mdor bsdu na zag pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so // de dag kyang stobs dang ldan pa dang nyams pa dang ma spyad pa dag yin no //
translated: The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.

original: de la zag pa rnams las ni mi dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa rnams las ni mi dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mthu chung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mthu chung ba yin no //
translated: The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should be understood.🔽The factors arisen from the ripened effect should be understood.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams las kyang dge ba dang / mi dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni stobs dang ldan pa yin no //🔽de dag las gzhan pa ni mthu chung ba yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams las kyang dge ba dang / mi dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni stobs dang ldan pa yin no //🔽de dag las gzhan pa ni mthu chung ba yin no //
translated: The factors accompanied by the ripened effect should

original: zag pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa gang dag 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dag gis spangs pa de dag ni nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa gang dag 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dag gis spangs pa de dag ni nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are impure and associated with impurity, which are abandoned by the mundane and supramundane paths, are called “degenerated”.

original: de las bzlog pa dag ni ma nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dag ni ma nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are the opposite of that are called “non-degenerated”.

original: 'das pa'i dus la brten te rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni spyad zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la brten te rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni spyad zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those that have already ripened in the past are called “used up”,

original: 'di ltar de dag gi rnam par smin pa ni 'das zin pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi rnam par smin pa ni 'das zin pa'i phyir med do //
translated: because their ripening is already past and does not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su rnam par smin pa 'byin par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa dang / da ltar rnam par smin pa nye bar gnas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ma spyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su rnam par smin pa 'byin par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa dang / da ltar rnam par smin pa nye bar gnas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ma spyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that will ripen in the future and those that are ripening now are called “not used up”.

original: rnam grangs des na dge ba dang mi dge ba zag pa rnams dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ci rigs par zag pa dang @213b bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na dge ba dang mi dge ba zag pa rnams dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ci rigs par zag pa dang @213b bcas pa yin te /
translated: For this reason, all wholesome and unwholesome contaminated entities are contaminated, as appropriate.

original: de dag ni ma spangs pa dang / de dag ni rnam par smin pa sngon rnam par ma smin pa dang / de dag ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni ma spangs pa dang / de dag ni rnam par smin pa sngon rnam par ma smin pa dang / de dag ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
translated: They are not abandoned, their karmic maturation has not already matured, and they possess karmic maturation.

original: zag pa med pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa zag pa rnams dang bcas te spangs pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa zag pa rnams dang bcas te spangs pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Uncontaminated entities, indeterminate entities, and wholesome and unwholesome contaminated entities that are abandoned together with the contaminants, as well as those that have already matured, should be regarded as not possessing karmic maturation.

original: de la 'chi ka'i sems tha ma ni rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'chi ka'i sems tha ma ni rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: The final moment of mind at death possesses karmic maturation.

original: nying mtshams sbyar ma thag pa'i sems kyang rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyar ma thag pa'i sems kyang rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is just born also possesses karmic maturation.

original: de phan chad rang bzhin du gnas pa'i sems thams cad kyang rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad rang bzhin du gnas pa'i sems thams cad kyang rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: All naturally abiding minds are also karmic results.

original: de la dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the naturally abiding mind is the virtuous and non-afflicted mind, and the non-virtuous and obscured mind that is not accompanied by full awareness.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba las 'og ma pa'i dge ba'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa med pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba las 'og ma pa'i dge ba'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa med pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The virtuous mind of one who is free from attachment, and the non-obscured mind that is not accompanied by full awareness, that arise from that, should also be known as karmic results.

original: rnam par smin pa de ni thams cad du yang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa de ni thams cad du yang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that all karmic results are only unobscured and neutral.

original: rnam par smin pa sa bon thams cad pa de las spangs pa dang / ma thob pa ma gtogs pa dge ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa sa bon thams cad pa de las spangs pa dang / ma thob pa ma gtogs pa dge ba'am /
translated: From that karmic result that is the seed of everything, except for abandonment and non-acquisition, the virtuous,

original: mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am /
translated: non-virtuous,🔽and neutral minds arise.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang dag rang gi sa bon dang ldan par skye ba de dag thams cad ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang dag rang gi sa bon dang ldan par skye ba de dag thams cad ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: All neutral dharmas that arise with their own seeds should be said to be born from retribution.

original: khams gsum thams cad na yang 'chi ka'i sems tha ma dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang po'i 'og ma gnyis pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad na yang 'chi ka'i sems tha ma dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang po'i 'og ma gnyis pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: In all three realms, the last moment of mind at death and the first moment of mind at rebirth are both associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang po ma gtogs pa de dag ni thams cad du yang rnam par smin par bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang po ma gtogs pa de dag ni thams cad du yang rnam par smin par bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Except for the first moment of mind at rebirth, all of these are included in retribution.

original: de las gzhan pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Other than these, pleasant and unpleasant feelings should be known as born from retribution.

original: de'i sa bon rnam par smin pas bsdus pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra pa'i rgyu de dag dang / rkyen de dag la @214a * //
analyzed: de'i sa bon rnam par smin pas bsdus pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra pa'i rgyu de dag dang / rkyen de dag la @214a * //
translated: The cause is similar to the seed that is included in the class of karmic maturation.

original: brten nas rnam par smin pa de las skye'o //
analyzed: brten nas rnam par smin pa de las skye'o //
translated: The effect is born in dependence on that cause and those conditions.

original: de la sems can dmyal bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i mjug thogs su ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i mjug thogs su ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung ngo //
translated: In the hells, the effect of karmic maturation is immediately followed by the arising of a stream of suffering and mental dissatisfaction that is born of karma.

original: sems can dmyal bar skyes pa rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du yi dags de dag kha cig la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar skyes pa rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du yi dags de dag kha cig la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is similar to the way in which the effect of karmic maturation arises for those who are born in the hells.
