original: yi dags de dag kha cig dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / mi rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la la ni /
analyzed: yi dags de dag kha cig dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / mi rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la la ni /
translated: For some hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and gods of the desire realm,

original: rnam par smin pa'i mjug thogs su res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba 'byung /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i mjug thogs su res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba 'byung /
translated: the effect of karmic maturation is sometimes immediately followed by the arising of suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: res 'ga' ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba 'byung /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba 'byung /
translated: Sometimes it is immediately followed by the arising of pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Sometimes, neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling occurs.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung bas gcig tu ma nges so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung bas gcig tu ma nges so //
translated: Therefore, the feeling that is the result of action is not definite.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis par skyes pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i yid bde ba kho na rgyun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis par skyes pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i yid bde ba kho na rgyun du 'byung ngo //
translated: For those born in the first and second absorptions, only the pleasure of mental feeling that is the result of action occurs continuously, immediately after the result of action.

original: bsam gtan gsum par skyes pa rnams la ni sems las byung ba'i bde ba rgyun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum par skyes pa rnams la ni sems las byung ba'i bde ba rgyun du 'byung ngo //
translated: For those born in the third absorption, mental pleasure occurs continuously.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: The fourth absorption and above are the result of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: de nyid de na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That itself should be regarded as the result of action in those realms.

original: de la dge ba'i chos rnams ni bde ba dang yid bde ba rgya chen pos yongs su bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos rnams ni bde ba dang yid bde ba rgya chen pos yongs su bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because virtuous phenomena are completely included in the vast pleasure and mental pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa mngon du gyur kyang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa mngon du gyur kyang /
translated: even though neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling occurs,

original: rnam par smin pa 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “having a desirable karmic maturation. ”

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi 'dod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi 'dod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as having an undesirable karmic maturation.

original: de la las dkar ba rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la las dkar ba rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, the karmic maturation of a virtuous action is an unobscured neutral karmic maturation,

original: gcig tu 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i sa bon gyis yongs su zin pa yin pa'i phyir gcig tu 'dod pa dang / gcig tu yid du 'ong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i sa bon gyis yongs su zin pa yin pa'i phyir gcig tu 'dod pa dang / gcig tu yid du 'ong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: because it is completely taken up by the seed of a single desirable feeling. It should be understood as being completely desirable and completely agreeable.

original: las gnag pa rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i rnam par smin pa ni de las bzlog par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: las gnag pa rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i rnam par smin pa ni de las bzlog par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The karmic maturation of a nonvirtuous action is the opposite of that.

original: las dkar gnag rnam par smin pa dkar gnag can gyi rnam par smin pa ni sa bon rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa yin pas rnam par @214b smin pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba yang rnam pa gnyis kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: las dkar gnag rnam par smin pa dkar gnag can gyi rnam par smin pa ni sa bon rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa yin pas rnam par @214b smin pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba yang rnam pa gnyis kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The karmic maturation of an action that is both virtuous and nonvirtuous is seen to be the karmic maturation of an action that has two seeds. Therefore, the feeling that arises from that karmic maturation should be seen as having two aspects.

original: de la las dkar gnag ni rigs kyi dbye bas kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la las dkar gnag ni rigs kyi dbye bas kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In this regard, an action that is both virtuous and nonvirtuous is also established by way of its type.

original: gnas gang na dkar po dang / nag po gnyis ka srid pa'i gnas de pa'i las bsdus pa ni dkar gnag ces bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnas gang na dkar po dang / nag po gnyis ka srid pa'i gnas de pa'i las bsdus pa ni dkar gnag ces bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The action of those who are in a place where both good and bad are possible is called good and bad.

original: dngos po'i dbye bas kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i dbye bas kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is also established by the classification of things.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la las dngos po gang yang rung ba zhig la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la las dngos po gang yang rung ba zhig la /
translated: For example, in regard to a certain thing,🔽sometimes a helpful attitude is applied to it, and sometimes a harmful attitude is applied to it.

original: res 'ga' ni phan pa'i sems nyid nye bar bzhag la dngos po de nyid la res 'ga' ni gnod pa'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag pa lta bu dang / gzhan dag las phrogs te sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de lta bu'i dngos po'i dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni phan pa'i sems nyid nye bar bzhag la dngos po de nyid la res 'ga' ni gnod pa'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag pa lta bu dang / gzhan dag las phrogs te sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de lta bu'i dngos po'i dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And it is also established by the classification of things, such as giving gifts by stealing from others.

original: las dkar gnag ni ngo bo nyid las kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: las dkar gnag ni ngo bo nyid las kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Good and bad action is also established by its nature.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: la las gzhan gang yang rung ba zhig la shes bzhin du phan pa byas pas gzhan dag la gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba lta bu dang / 'di ltar 'di na la las skyes bu drag shul can sdig pa byed pa dag la sdig pa la dga' bar ma byed ces zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems skye na /
analyzed: la las gzhan gang yang rung ba zhig la shes bzhin du phan pa byas pas gzhan dag la gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba lta bu dang / 'di ltar 'di na la las skyes bu drag shul can sdig pa byed pa dag la sdig pa la dga' bar ma byed ces zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems skye na /
translated: Some, through the arising of a mind possessing anger, such as, “Do not delight in sin,” to those who commit sins and are violent,

original: sems de zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni nag po'i cha la brten pa yin la ;
analyzed: sems de zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni nag po'i cha la brten pa yin la ;
translated: because that mind is concomitant with anger, it is based on the black part.

original: sdig pa la mi dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni dkar po'i cha la brten pa yin pas de'i phyir las de dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni dkar gnag yin par brjod par bya'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa /
analyzed: sdig pa la mi dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni dkar po'i cha la brten pa yin pas de'i phyir las de dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni dkar gnag yin par brjod par bya'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa /
translated: Because it is concomitant with nondelight in sin, it is based on the white part. Therefore that action and others similar to it should be called white and black.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang dag gi sa bon yang dag par ma bcom pa de dag thams cad ni skyed par byed pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang dag gi sa bon yang dag par ma bcom pa de dag thams cad ni skyed par byed pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: All those wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate dharmas whose seeds have not been destroyed are called “dharmas with cause” because they are the cause for the establishment of the generation of the effect.

original: sngon byas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa khams gsum du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i rnam par smin pa de ni 'dren pa'i rgyur gyur pa las dang po nyon mongs pa de dag gi rgyu dang bcas pa zhes
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa khams gsum du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i rnam par smin pa de ni 'dren pa'i rgyur gyur pa las dang po nyon mongs pa de dag gi rgyu dang bcas pa zhes
translated: The maturation of the karma and afflictions that were previously performed, which will mature in the three realms, is called “having cause” because it is the cause for the leading of those afflictions and karma that were performed in the past.

original: bya'o // de bzhin du mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba gang yin pa de yang 'dren pa'i rgyu gnas gsum po mngon du @215a * //🔽gyur pa des rgyu dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de bzhin du mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba gang yin pa de yang 'dren pa'i rgyu gnas gsum po mngon du @215a * //🔽gyur pa des rgyu dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, birth in the womb should be seen as having cause because of the three present conditions that lead to it.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas su skye ba gang yin pa 'dren pa'i rgyu drod gsher nye bar gyur pas /🔽rgyu dang bcas pa dang / sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba gang yin pa 'dren pa'i rgyu sgo nga'i sbubs chags pas /
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas su skye ba gang yin pa 'dren pa'i rgyu drod gsher nye bar gyur pas / rgyu dang bcas pa dang / sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba gang yin pa 'dren pa'i rgyu sgo nga'i sbubs chags pas /
translated: The cause of birth in the birthplace of beings born from heat and moisture is the union of heat and moisture.🔽The cause of birth in the birthplace of beings born from eggs is the formation of the egg.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the cause of birth in the other two birthplaces.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag kyang /🔽bdag po'i rkyen dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag kyang / bdag po'i rkyen dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: In the same way, the six collections of consciousness

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa nas /
translated: are the dominant condition and the co-operating cause of name-and-form, etc.🔽up to the final stage of mind and mental objects.

original: yid dang chos rnams kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyis rgyu dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid dang chos rnams kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyis rgyu dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen as having a cause.

original: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang gcig la gcig lhan cig byed pa'i rgyus rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang gcig la gcig lhan cig byed pa'i rgyus rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the co-arising of mind and mental factors is the co-operating cause of each other.

original: de bzhin du mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'dren pa'i rgyur gyur pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang ; dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dag gis rgyu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'dren pa'i rgyur gyur pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang ; dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dag gis rgyu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, unwholesome dharmas are said to be accompanied by their causes through the three causes that lead to them: reliance on bad people, listening to bad teachings, and improper mental attention.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'dren pa'i rgyur gyur ba de las bzlog pa gsum po dag gis rgyu dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'dren pa'i rgyur gyur ba de las bzlog pa gsum po dag gis rgyu dang bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Wholesome dharmas are seen to be accompanied by their causes through the three causes that lead to them, which are the opposites of those.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa las byung ba dang / log par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba don med pa las byung ba sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde bar gnas pa yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa las byung ba dang / log par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba don med pa las byung ba sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde bar gnas pa yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the painful and unhappy states that arise from abiding in the afflicted mental states and from the useless fatigue of wrong effort are also accompanied by their causes through the causes that lead to them.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa las byung pa dang / yang dag par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa las byung ba bde ba dang yid bde ba dang gnas pa yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa las byung pa dang / yang dag par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa las byung ba bde ba dang yid bde ba dang gnas pa yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the pleasure, mental pleasure, and equanimity that arise from abiding in a non-afflicted state and from the fruitful exertion of complete acceptance are said to be accompanied by their cause, because they are the cause of attraction.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang ; bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa de yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang ; bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa de yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The detachment that arises through the mundane path and the actualization of the meditative absorptions and formless states are also accompanied by their cause, because they are the cause of attraction.

original: tshe 'di la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas /
translated: In this life, based on the meditative absorptions and formless states of composure,

original: gang du ci rigs par skye ba gang yin pa de yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang @215b bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du ci rigs par skye ba gang yin pa de yang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang @215b bcas pa yin no //
translated: whatever rebirth one takes on, in whatever way is appropriate, is also accompanied by its cause, because it is the cause of attraction.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis bsgrubs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis bsgrubs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Those supramundane dharmas that are accomplished by mundane dharmas are also endowed with a cause by that leading cause.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed par 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba de yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed par 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba de yang /
translated: That nirvana which is realized by those supramundane dharmas included in the noble path, by which nirvana is realized,

original: 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dren pa'i rgyu des rgyu dang bcas pa dag yin te /
translated: is also endowed with a cause by that leading cause.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these aspects as taught, the establishment of dharmas with a cause should be understood.

original: de la skyed par byed pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ji skad bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la skyed par byed pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ji skad bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Among them, that which was taught as the cause of manifestation, the productive cause, should be stated as endowed with that result of natural outflow.

original: yang 'byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The actions and defilements that are the cause of rebirth are said to be accompanied by their ripened effect.

original: gnas gsum mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa dang / drod gsher nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa dang / sgo nga'i sbubs chags pa gang yin pa dang / mig dang gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lhan cig skyes pa gang dag yin pa dang /
analyzed: gnas gsum mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa dang / drod gsher nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa dang / sgo nga'i sbubs chags pa gang yin pa dang / mig dang gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lhan cig skyes pa gang dag yin pa dang /
translated: The three states that manifest, the presence of heat and moisture, the formation of the egg-membrane, the eye and form, etc., the mind and mental factors that arise together,

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa la sogs pa chos gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni rang rang gi dbang gi 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa la sogs pa chos gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni rang rang gi dbang gi 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: the three factors of relying on a bad person, etc., and relying on a good person, etc., are all said to be accompanied by their dominant effect.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang / log par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba 'bras bu med pas tshe 'di la sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde bar gnas par byed pa gang yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang / log par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba 'bras bu med pas tshe 'di la sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde bar gnas par byed pa gang yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa dang /
translated: The result of the action of a person who is abiding in a defiled state, and who is exhausted by fruitless wrong effort, is that he abides in suffering and unhappiness in this life.

original: yang dag par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba 'bras bu dang bcas pas tshe 'di la bde ba dang yid bde bar gnas par byed pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu des 'bras bu bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol ba'i yongs su ngal ba 'bras bu dang bcas pas tshe 'di la bde ba dang yid bde bar gnas par byed pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu des 'bras bu bcas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The result of the action of a person who is abiding in an undefiled state, and who is exhausted by fruitful right effort, is that he abides in happiness and joy in this life.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni bral ba dang / dbang gi 'bras bu 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin @216a * //🔽par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni bral ba dang / dbang gi 'bras bu 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin @216a * //🔽par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The path that leads to rebirth in the world of desire free from passion is the result of both disconnection and mastery.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dren pa 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni bral ba'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dren pa 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni bral ba'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The supramundane path that leads to the transcendence of suffering and the noble supramundane path that actualizes nirvana are said to be endowed with the result of separation.

original: 'di ni gtan du thams cad dang bral ba'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan du thams cad dang bral ba'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: This is because they are endowed with the result of separation from all the defilements forever.

original: 'jig rten pa ni gtan du thams cad dang bral ba'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni gtan du thams cad dang bral ba'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The mundane path should be regarded as not being endowed with the result of separation from all the defilements forever.

original: 'dir de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: 'dir de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: This is the difference between these two.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa 'di lta ste ;
translated: Thus, the aspects of the path that have been presented are as follows.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang gi 'bras bu dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bral ba'i 'bras bu de dag gis ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /🔽de yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang gi 'bras bu dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bral ba'i 'bras bu de dag gis ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / de yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The classification of dharmas with results should be understood in terms of the following five types of results: the maturation result, the result of conscious effort, the result of separation, the result of human action, and the natural result.🔽These five types of results should be understood as they were explained previously.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Dharmas that are not causes and dharmas that are not results should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa dang byed pa po med pa zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa dang byed pa po med pa zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, the term “dependently arisen dharmas” means that they are devoid of a self and devoid of a creator.

original: yid kyis rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i skabs su gang dag sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyis rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i skabs su gang dag sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is the same as the explanation that was given above in the chapter on the expertise in dependent origination.

original: de la gang gis nang rnams zhes bya ba'i nang gi chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na rgyu lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la gang gis nang rnams zhes bya ba'i nang gi chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na rgyu lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of internal phenomena is also established by five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: nye bar 'dogs pa dang / mngon par zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa dang / mngon par zhe na /
translated: Designation, manifest craving,

original: pa dang / dbang dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dngos pos so //🔽de la re zhig gang la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pa dang / dbang dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dngos pos so // de la re zhig gang la 'di lta ste /
translated: dominance, holding seeds, and substance.🔽First, designation is the designation of a self, a sentient being,🔽a life-force, a nourisher, a person, a human being, a human,

original: bdag ce'am / sems can zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag ce'am / sems can zhe'am /
translated: an agent, or an experiencer.

original: 'di ltar de'i ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: Or, it is the designation of a name, a family,

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya / rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: a clan,🔽up to the designation of the limit of life-span,🔽saying “life-span is this much.”

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu thub ces bya ba'i bar du de ltar nye bar 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'dogs pa las nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu thub ces bya ba'i bar du de ltar nye bar 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'dogs pa las nang zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called internal from the perspective of designation.

original: gang la la 'di lta ste ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon par zhen pa de lta bu'i mngon par zhen pa @216b 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par zhen pa las nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la la 'di lta ste ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon par zhen pa de lta bu'i mngon par zhen pa @216b 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par zhen pa las nang zhes bya'o //
translated: That which arises as such an adherence, i.e., the adherence to the view of the transitory collection and the pride that thinks “I am,” is the inner from the point of view of adherence.

original: gang gi dbang gis gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams nye bar spyod pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbang las nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams nye bar spyod pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbang las nang zhes bya'o //
translated: That which arises in dependence on the faculties, i.e., the faculties of the eye, etc., in order to experience external sense-spheres such as visible form, etc., is the inner from the point of view of the faculties.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa las nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa las nang zhes bya'o //
translated: That which holds the seeds of all dharmas, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or undefined, is the inner from the point of view of holding the seeds.

original: dang ba'i gzugs rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa dang / sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po las nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang ba'i gzugs rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa dang / sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po las nang zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the five kinds of clear form and that which is mind, thought, and consciousness is the inner from the point of view of substance.

original: dmigs pa las nang yin par brdar btags pa'i rnam par bzhag pa gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: dmigs pa las nang yin par brdar btags pa'i rnam par bzhag pa gzhan yang yod de /
translated: There is another way of positing the internal that is established by convention.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched du gtogs pa yin yang nang na dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched du gtogs pa yin yang nang na dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Although it belongs to the external sense bases, that which is the object of the internal is called internal.

original: de la ming dang gzugs ni phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ming dang gzugs ni phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Name-and-form should be understood as being included in the five aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni yul de dang der skye ba dang / 'phel bar yang snang la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni yul de dang der skye ba dang / 'phel bar yang snang la /
translated: The form aggregate appears to be born in this or that place and to grow.

original: lag pa dang bong ba la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis gzugs su yang rung bas /
analyzed: lag pa dang bong ba la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis gzugs su yang rung bas /
translated: It is suitable as form because it is the object of contact that occurs through the coming together of the hand, a clod of earth, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called form.

original: phung po lhag ma bzhi po dag ni sna tshogs su 'dogs pa'i dbang dang / sna tshogs su 'dogs pa'i gnas kyis phal cher dmigs pa de dang de la 'jug cing gzhol bar byed pas /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma bzhi po dag ni sna tshogs su 'dogs pa'i dbang dang / sna tshogs su 'dogs pa'i gnas kyis phal cher dmigs pa de dang de la 'jug cing gzhol bar byed pas /
translated: The remaining four aggregates are mostly engaged in and directed toward this or that object by the power of various designations and as the basis for various designations.

original: de'i phyir phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag ni ming zhes bya'o //🔽de la zin pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag ni ming zhes bya'o // de la zin pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: Therefore, the four non-material aggregates are called name.

original: rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the appropriated should be understood in brief as fivefold:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: re zhig dang por gzugs 'ba' zhig zin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig dang por gzugs 'ba' zhig zin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: First, form alone is to be seen as appropriated.

original: de'i phyir de ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams zin pa ma yin par de dag bsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams zin pa ma yin par de dag bsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is excluded that mind and mental factors are not appropriated.

original: nang gi dbang po dang 'brel pa'i gzugs gang dag yin pa de zin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi dbang po dang 'brel pa'i gzugs gang dag yin pa de zin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: That form which is connected with the internal sense-spheres is to be seen as appropriated.

original: de'i phyir de ni dbang po dang ma 'brel pa phyir rol gyi gzugs zin pa ma yin par de bsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dbang po dang ma 'brel pa phyir rol gyi gzugs zin pa ma yin par de bsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is excluded that external form, which is not connected with the sense-spheres, is appropriated.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gnas su byas shing @217a * //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gnas su byas shing @217a * //
translated: Those dharmas which are mind and mental factors are to be seen as appropriated, because they are the basis of mind and mental factors.

original: ma spangs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni zin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni zin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Whatever form is not abandoned should be regarded as appropriated.

original: de'i phyir des ni dbang po dang ma 'brel pa nang gi skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so la sogs pa dang / shi ba'i ro dag zin pa ma yin par de bsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni dbang po dang ma 'brel pa nang gi skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so la sogs pa dang / shi ba'i ro dag zin pa ma yin par de bsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the internal hairs, body hair, nails, teeth, and so on, as well as the body of one who is dead, are not appropriated because they are not connected with the faculties.

original: zin pa'i gzugs de yang rgyu bzhis rnam par 'gyur bas de'i phyir zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zin pa'i gzugs de yang rgyu bzhis rnam par 'gyur bas de'i phyir zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That appropriated form is also called “appropriated” because it is transformed by four causes.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi reg pa dang phrad pa dang nang gi khams 'khrugs pa dang mnyam par gyur pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba dang ; dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi reg pa dang phrad pa dang nang gi khams 'khrugs pa dang mnyam par gyur pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba dang ; dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ste /
translated: Contact with external form, the disturbance or equilibrium of the internal elements, the arising of the afflictions such as desire and hatred, and the focusing of attention on an object.

original: 'di ltar zin pa'i gzugs la phyi rol gyi gzugs gnod par byed pas gnod par gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar zin pa'i gzugs la phyi rol gyi gzugs gnod par byed pas gnod par gyur pa na /
translated: Thus, when appropriated form is harmed by external forms that are harmful,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba dang / gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba dang / gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: it becomes painful, diseased, and injured.

original: phan 'dogs pas rig pa na bde ba dang / phan pa dang / mi gnod par 'gyur ba dang / khams 'khrugs pas sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod par 'gyur la snyoms pas phan par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas rig pa na bde ba dang / phan pa dang / mi gnod par 'gyur ba dang / khams 'khrugs pas sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod par 'gyur la snyoms pas phan par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: When one is aware of the benefit, one is happy, one is benefited, and one is not harmed.

original: nyes rtsom dang / yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa la log par nye bar gtod pa dag gis kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / nyes rtsom dang / yongs su gdung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyes rtsom dang / yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa la log par nye bar gtod pa dag gis kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / nyes rtsom dang / yongs su gdung bar 'gyur la /
translated: When one is not aware of the benefit, one is unhappy, one is harmed, and one is not benefited.🔽When one is aware of the benefit, one is happy, one is benefited, and one is not harmed.🔽When one is not aware of the benefit, one is unhappy, one is harmed, and one is not benefited.🔽When one is aware of the benefit, one is happy, one is benefited, and one is not harmed.🔽When one is not aware of the benefit, one is unhappy, one is harmed, and one is not benefited.

original: dmigs pa la shin tu sbyangs pas yang dag bar nye bar gtod pas ni bde ba dang phan par 'gyur ba'i phyir te gnod pa dang / phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar na nang gi yang yin la gzugs kyang yin zhing /
analyzed: dmigs pa la shin tu sbyangs pas yang dag bar nye bar gtod pas ni bde ba dang phan par 'gyur ba'i phyir te gnod pa dang / phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar na nang gi yang yin la gzugs kyang yin zhing /
translated: When one is aware of the benefit, one is happy, one is benefited, and one is not harmed.🔽When one is not aware of the benefit, one is unhappy, one is harmed, and one

original: sems dang sems las byung bas gnas su byas pa dang / de ltar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung bas gnas su byas pa dang / de ltar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors are the support, and that which is supported by them is called the appropriated.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma zin pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma zin pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: The opposite of that is the non-appropriated.

original: / de la 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / rgyur byas pa'i chos rnams ni chos gzugs can kho na yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de la 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / rgyur byas pa'i chos rnams ni chos gzugs can kho na yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Among those, the great elements and the derivative form should be said to be only the form element.

original: de la ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams rang gi sa bon las skyes pa de bzhin du rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang rang gi sa bon las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams rang gi sa bon las skyes pa de bzhin du rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang rang gi sa bon las skye ba yin na /
translated: Just as the great elements are produced from their own seeds, so too derivative form is produced from its own seeds.

original: ci'i phyir @217b rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir @217b rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is derivative form said to be derived from the great elements?

original: 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dbang po gzugs can dang / sems dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rgyur byas pa'i sa bon gzugs kyi sa bon dag dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dbang po gzugs can dang / sems dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rgyur byas pa'i sa bon gzugs kyi sa bon dag dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The great elements that are the seeds of the elements and possess physical sense faculties and mind possess the seeds of derivative form.

original: de dag gang gi tshe 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: de dag gang gi tshe 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When they produce their effects,

original: de dag dang ldan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sa bon dag kyang rang gi 'bras bu nges par mngon par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sa bon dag kyang rang gi 'bras bu nges par mngon par sgrub par byed de /
translated: the seeds of derivative form that are associated with them definitely produce their own effects.

original: de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de yang 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de yang 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, derivative form is said to be derived from the primary elements.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dbang po gzugs can dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dbang po gzugs can dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The seeds of the primary elements that are associated with physical sense faculties are said to have a location.

original: dbang po gzugs can ma yin pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs med pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can ma yin pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs med pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those that are associated with nonphysical sense faculties are said to be without a location.

original: 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The primary elements are also of two types:

original: khams tsam gyis bsdus pa dag dang / rang gi las byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: khams tsam gyis bsdus pa dag dang / rang gi las byed pa dag yin no //
translated: those that are included in the elements alone and those that perform their own function.

original: de la sa bon du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni khams tsam gyis bsdus pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la sa bon du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni khams tsam gyis bsdus pa dag yin no //
translated: The elements that are seeds are included in the mere elements.

original: rang gi sa bon de las grub pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rang gi las byed pa dag yin no //🔽de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang lhan cig gi dngos pos tha mi dad par 'jug pa dag yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon de las grub pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rang gi las byed pa dag yin no // de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang lhan cig gi dngos pos tha mi dad par 'jug pa dag yin te /
translated: Those that are established from their own seeds perform their own activity.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu las grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu las grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not differentiated from derivative form by way of their own nature, because they are established from a cause that is similar to them.

original: thams cad du yang thams cad 'dres shing ro gcig pa'i gong bu lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du yang thams cad 'dres shing ro gcig pa'i gong bu lta bu yin gyi /
translated: They are like a lump that is a mixture of everything and is of one taste.

original: phye dang 'bru dang / nor bu'i phung po lta bu ni ma yin no //🔽'dod pa'i khams na ni gzugs 'dus pa gcig tu sra ba gang yin pa de la sa'i khams dang / gzugs dang dri dang ro'i khams dag las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phye dang 'bru dang / nor bu'i phung po lta bu ni ma yin no // 'dod pa'i khams na ni gzugs 'dus pa gcig tu sra ba gang yin pa de la sa'i khams dang / gzugs dang dri dang ro'i khams dag las byed pa yin no //
translated: They are not like a heap of grains, jewels, and so on.🔽In the desire realm, the earth element performs its function in the single collection of form that is solidity.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni gzugs kyi khams kho na las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni gzugs kyi khams kho na las byed pa yin no //
translated: In the form realm, the form element performs its function in the single collection of form.

original: lhag ma chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sgra'i khams sa bon du gyur pa de dang 'brel pa dag ni rkyen dag la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sgra'i khams sa bon du gyur pa de dang 'brel pa dag ni rkyen dag la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The remaining elements of water, fire, wind, and sound, which are seeds, are related to conditions.

original: de ltar na chu dang / me dang / rlung gi ming can 'dus pa dag la go rims ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //🔽de la nang gi gzugs 'dus pa la ni skra dang / spu la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas /🔽sa la sogs pa'i khams thams cad las byed pa dang @218a * //
analyzed: de ltar na chu dang / me dang / rlung gi ming can 'dus pa dag la go rims ci rigs par blta bar bya'o // de la nang gi gzugs 'dus pa la ni skra dang / spu la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas / sa la sogs pa'i khams thams cad las byed pa dang @218a * //
translated: Thus, the collections of water, fire, and wind should be understood in the proper order.

original: bcas par snang ste /
analyzed: bcas par snang ste /
translated: In the collection of internal form, all the elements of earth, etc., appear with their functions, through the differentiation of hair, body hair, etc.

original: mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said in the sutra.

original: phyi rol la ni sa la sogs pa'i 'dus pa so sor ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol la ni sa la sogs pa'i 'dus pa so sor ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the external, the collections of earth, etc., should be understood individually as appropriate.

original: de dag kyang rkyen ji lta ji lta bu dag dang phrad pa'i 'bras bu de lta de lta bu'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rkyen ji lta ji lta bu dag dang phrad pa'i 'bras bu de lta de lta bu'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
translated: And those elements become the causes of whatever effects they encounter, in whatever way they encounter conditions.

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: For example,

original: dper na shing skam po legs par gtsubs pa las me 'byung ba dang / tshon mo steng dang / ro nye dang / lcags dang dngul la sogs pa zhu bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing skam po legs par gtsubs pa las me 'byung ba dang / tshon mo steng dang / ro nye dang / lcags dang dngul la sogs pa zhu bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire arises from rubbing two sticks together, and from the melting of red hot iron, copper, silver, and gold.

original: rig bya'i skye mched du gtogs pa 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa gang dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sar lngar ji skad bstan pa de dag thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig bya'i skye mched du gtogs pa 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa gang dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sar lngar ji skad bstan pa de dag thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Smoothness, roughness, etc., which are included in the sense-field of objects of cognition, and which are mentioned in the five sense-consciousnesses, are all to be known as particularities of the great elements.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de dang 'dra ba de'i gnas skabs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de dang 'dra ba de'i gnas skabs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The four great elements which are of the same kind as that, which are similar to that, which are in the same condition as that, are appropriate.

original: de dag la 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gang dag nye bar gdags shing gdags par byed pa de dag ni btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gang dag nye bar gdags shing gdags par byed pa de dag ni btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those smoothness, etc., which are imputed and designated upon them, are to be known as imputedly existent.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi rig pa'i skye mched ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur ba byas pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bstan du med la thogs pa med pa zhes gang gzugs de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi rig pa'i skye mched ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur ba byas pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bstan du med la thogs pa med pa zhes gang gzugs de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the form that is undemonstrable and unimpeded?”

original: 'di la 'byung ba chen po rnams ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnam pa gnyis skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la 'byung ba chen po rnams ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnam pa gnyis skyed par byed de /
translated: The four great elements generate two types of derived form:

original: rang gi rigs kyis khyad par can dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyis khyad par can no ;
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyis khyad par can dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyis khyad par can no ;
translated: that distinguished by its own type and that distinguished by another type.

original: / de la rang gi rigs kyis khyad par can gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / de la rang gi rigs kyis khyad par can gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: Derived form distinguished by its own type is the smoothness, roughness, and so on of the four great elements.

original: 'di ltar gang dag la 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid ces rgya cher 'byung ba nye bar gdags pa'i 'byung ba chen po phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa de dag ni rgyu de dang rkyen des grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag la 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid ces rgya cher 'byung ba nye bar gdags pa'i 'byung ba chen po phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa de dag ni rgyu de dang rkyen des grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, smoothness, roughness, etc., are established by the specific mutual combination of the great elements that are the designative bases of those terms.

original: gzhan gyi rigs kyis khyad par can gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa nang gi skya mched lnga dang / rig bya'i skye mched ma gtogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched bzhi dang / chos kyi @218b skye mched kyi phyogs kyi gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs kyis khyad par can gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa nang gi skya mched lnga dang / rig bya'i skye mched ma gtogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched bzhi dang / chos kyi @218b skye mched kyi phyogs kyi gzugs rnams so //
translated: Form that is derived from other types of elements is the five internal sense bases of eye, ear, etc., the four external sense bases except the sense base of factors, and the form that is part of the sense base of factors.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gi rigs kyis khyad par can gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs las dgongs nas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gi rigs kyis khyad par can gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs las dgongs nas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: With regard to that, the Blessed One declared that form derived from the great elements that are of the same type as itself is derived from the four great elements.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes gang gsungs pa de 'byung ba chen po gang dag la brten pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes gang gsungs pa de 'byung ba chen po gang dag la brten pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the form that is not visible but has resistance?

original: gal te mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos gzugs can yid la byed pa la gzugs brnyan skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos gzugs can yid la byed pa la gzugs brnyan skye bar gyur na /
translated: If a form that is an object of mind occurs in the mental continuum of one who is concentrated on a visible form of the desire realm,

original: de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag la brten pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag la brten pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: it is said to be based on the great elements of the desire realm.

original: gal te gzugs na spyod pa'i chos gzugs can yid la byed pa la gzugs brnyan skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs na spyod pa'i chos gzugs can yid la byed pa la gzugs brnyan skye bar gyur na /
translated: If a form that is an object of mind occurs in the mental continuum of one who is concentrated on a visible form of the form realm,

original: de ni gzugs na spyod pa kho na'i 'byung ba chen po dag la brten pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs na spyod pa kho na'i 'byung ba chen po dag la brten pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: it is said to be based on the great elements of the form realm.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
translated: The remaining topics of the treatise on the ascertainment of phenomena that are derivative form are not evident.

original: // / srid pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad la bya ste /
analyzed: // / srid pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad la bya ste /
translated: Existents are all mundane phenomena.

original: gal te dgra bcom pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag 'jig rten pa yin pa'i phyir srid par gtogs pa yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag 'jig rten pa yin pa'i phyir srid par gtogs pa yin par gyur na /
translated: If the mundane virtues of an arhat were existents, they would be mundane and thus would be included in existence.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called uncontaminated?

original: de dag ni srid pa gsum du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir srid par gtogs pa zhes bya bar zad kyi de dag ni zag pa'i bag la nyal las rnam par grol ba kho na'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni srid pa gsum du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir srid par gtogs pa zhes bya bar zad kyi de dag ni zag pa'i bag la nyal las rnam par grol ba kho na'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called existents because they are included in the three existences, but they are called uncontaminated because they are completely liberated from the latent states of the contaminants.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: In this regard, the Bhagavān said, “What are contaminated phenomena?🔽They are the mundane mind, mental factors, and mental consciousness.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i yid gang yin pa dang / chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yid gang yin pa dang / chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of this statement?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i yid dang / chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa gang yin pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i yid dang / chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa gang yin pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One taught with the intention of not abandoning the mundane mind, phenomena, and mental consciousness that are to be abandoned.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa mang po 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes gang gsungs pa de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽thos pa las byung ba'i sar sangs rgyas @219a * //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa mang po 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes gang gsungs pa de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste / thos pa las byung ba'i sar sangs rgyas @219a * //
translated: Regarding that, the Blessed One taught the establishment of those called the many existences, the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of the formless realm, as follows:

original: kyi bka' shes bya'i gnas su bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kyi bka' shes bya'i gnas su bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: On the stage arisen from hearing, the Buddha's words are like the teachings on the bases of knowledge.

original: de la bla na yod pa'i chos rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bla na yod pa'i chos rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, the teachings with remainder should be seen as all teachings except for nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rgyu lngas bla na med pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rgyu lngas bla na med pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Nirvana should be known as unsurpassed for five reasons.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: kun du 'byung ba'i bden pa nye bar zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nye bar zhi ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / yams kyi nad med pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / 'go ba'i nad med pas bde ba dang /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba'i bden pa nye bar zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nye bar zhi ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / yams kyi nad med pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / 'go ba'i nad med pas bde ba dang /
translated: It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bla na med pa la dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bla na med pa la dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang / bde ba'i don dang / skyid pa'i don la rtag par gtan du mi slu ba nyid kyi phyir te /🔽rgyu lnga po 'dus pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang / bde ba'i don dang / skyid pa'i don la rtag par gtan du mi slu ba nyid kyi phyir te / rgyu lnga po 'dus pa de dag yin no //
translated: It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.

original: de dag gang la yod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //🔽bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams ni 'dus byas kyi dge ba thams cad yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gang la yod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o // bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams ni 'dus byas kyi dge ba thams cad yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.🔽It is the highest, unsurpassed happiness in this life.

original: de la bsgom pa ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: It is the highest,

original: rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as fourfold:

original: thob pa bsgom pa dang / bsten pa bsgom pa dang / spang pa bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa bsgom pa dang / bsten pa bsgom pa dang / spang pa bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: cultivation of attainment, cultivation of reliance, cultivation of abandonment, and cultivation of the antidote.

original: de la dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the cultivation of attention for the sake of generating wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen is called the cultivation of attainment.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgya cher 'byung ba ni bsten pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgya cher 'byung ba ni bsten pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of attention for the sake of maintaining and not forgetting wholesome dharmas that have already arisen is called the cultivation of reliance.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams pa spang pa'i phyir yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni spang pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams pa spang pa'i phyir yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni spang pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of attention for the sake of abandoning arisen unwholesome dharmas is called the cultivation of abandonment.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin pa la sogs pa gnyen po yid la bya ba goms par byed pa gang yin pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin pa la sogs pa gnyen po yid la bya ba goms par byed pa gang yin pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa zhes bya'o // de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The cultivation of the antidote is the repeated practice of the mental attention of the antidote, such as the disgust for the non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, in order to prevent their arising.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa'i bar ni rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽rab tu dben pa yid la byed pa nas gzung ste /🔽sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pa'i bar ni spong ba gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa'i bar ni rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o // rab tu dben pa yid la byed pa nas gzung ste / sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pa'i bar ni spong ba gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mental attention of the knowledge of the characteristics, up to the mental attention of conviction, should be known as the cultivation of the antidote of disgust.🔽The mental attention of isolation, up to the mental attention of the culmination of practice, should be known as the cultivation of the antidote of abandonment.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i @219b 'bras bu yid la byed pa ni kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i @219b 'bras bu yid la byed pa ni kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mental attention of the fruit of the culmination of practice should be known as the cultivation of the antidote of retention.

original: de'i gong du yid la byed pa bdun po khyad par can du gtogs pa gong ma'i sa pa de dag thams cad ni thag bsring ba gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gong du yid la byed pa bdun po khyad par can du gtogs pa gong ma'i sa pa de dag thams cad ni thag bsring ba gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all the other superior states of attention, which are on the higher stages, are the cultivation of the remote antidote.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag thams cad bsdus nas bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag thams cad bsdus nas bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: All these four kinds of cultivation should be understood as being included in two kinds of cultivation.

original: sdom pa yang dag par blang ba bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par blang ba bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the vow and the cultivation of attention.

original: de la lus bsgom pa ni sdom pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus bsgom pa ni sdom pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the body is the cultivation of the vow.

original: tshul khrims bsgom pa ni yang dag par blang ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgom pa ni yang dag par blang ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of morality is the cultivation of the vow.

original: bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang / bden pa shes pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni yid la byed pa bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang / bden pa shes pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni yid la byed pa bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of the stage of concentration and the cultivation of the stage of knowledge of the truths should be understood as the cultivation of attention.

original: de la yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang po ni sems bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang po ni sems bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first cultivation of attention is called the cultivation of mind.

original: gnyis pa ni shes rab bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni shes rab bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The second is called the cultivation of wisdom.

original: de la dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma ma gtogs pa 'das pa'i chos rgyu spyad zin pa ngo bo nyid zhig pa de las gzhan pa dag skyed pa'i mjug thogs kyi rkyen du gyur pa /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma ma gtogs pa 'das pa'i chos rgyu spyad zin pa ngo bo nyid zhig pa de las gzhan pa dag skyed pa'i mjug thogs kyi rkyen du gyur pa /
translated: Except for the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, past phenomena that have already produced their result and whose nature has disintegrated are the condition of subsequent arising for other phenomena.

original: sems kyi rgyud la yongs su bsgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'gags nas bskal pa brgya stong lon du zin kyang /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la yongs su bsgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'gags nas bskal pa brgya stong lon du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they have ceased and a hundred thousand eons have passed,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par byed do /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par byed do /
translated: they generate the ripening of desirable and undesirable results.

original: 'das pa kha cig ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba dran pa kho na tsam yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa kha cig ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba dran pa kho na tsam yin la /
translated: Some past phenomena are merely remembered as they were experienced.

original: kha cig ni mi dran la 'gags pas rab tu phyir ba kho na tsam yin pas byed pa med pa yin par rig par bya ste /🔽de ltar na de ni 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi dran la 'gags pas rab tu phyir ba kho na tsam yin pas byed pa med pa yin par rig par bya ste / de ltar na de ni 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Some are merely ceased and exhausted by cessation and should be understood to be inactive.🔽This is the classification of past phenomena.

original: 'das pa'i chos de dag gi dngos po rab tu dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos de dag gi dngos po rab tu dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: The classification of the entities of those past phenomena is as follows.

original: rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the past is established in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: skad cig 'das pa'i chos can dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: skad cig 'das pa'i chos can dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are things that are past in the sense of having passed away in the moment.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'du byed skad cig pa thams cad kyi nang na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'du byed skad cig pa thams cad kyi nang na /
translated: For example,

original: skad cig las 'das pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //
analyzed: skad cig las 'das pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //
translated: all conditioned things that have passed beyond the present moment.

original: shi 'phos pas 'das pa'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: shi 'phos pas 'das pa'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are things that are past in the sense of having passed away through death.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽sems can de dang de dag sems can gyi rigs de dang de dag nas shi 'phos zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sems can de dang de dag sems can gyi rigs de dang de dag nas shi 'phos zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For example,🔽when a sentient being has died and passed away from a certain class of sentient beings, up to

original: shi zhing dus byed ces rgya cher 'byung ba'i @220a * //🔽bar dag go //
analyzed: shi zhing dus byed ces rgya cher 'byung ba'i @220a * // bar dag go //
translated: when a sentient being has died and passed away from a certain class of sentient beings.

original: 'jig pas 'das pa'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig pas 'das pa'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are things that are past in the sense of having passed away through destruction.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: snod kyi 'jig rten du gtogs pa dag mes 'jig pa la sogs pas zhig pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten du gtogs pa dag mes 'jig pa la sogs pas zhig pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: the destruction of the world of the physical cosmos by fire and so on.

original: chos gang dag yongs su nyams pa'i 'das bas 'das pa dag kyang yod de ;
analyzed: chos gang dag yongs su nyams pa'i 'das bas 'das pa dag kyang yod de ;
translated: There are things that are past in the sense of having passed away through degeneration.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: la la dge ba'i chos dang / yon tan dang / bde bar gnas pa thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: la la dge ba'i chos dang / yon tan dang / bde bar gnas pa thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: Some have fallen away from the attainment of virtuous qualities and a happy state.

original: 'gags pa'i 'das pas 'das pa'i chos dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'gags pa'i 'das pas 'das pa'i chos dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also past phenomena that have ceased.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'gags pa'o //
translated: Those that have ceased in the realm of nirvana that is, the nirvana in which the remnants of the aggregates still remain and those that have ceased in the realm of nirvana that is, the nirvana in which the remnants of the aggregates do not remain.🔽There are also future phenomena that have not yet arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rgyu ma spyad pa /🔽ngo bo nyid ma spyad pa /🔽skye ba'i rkyen la ltos pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rgyu ma spyad pa / ngo bo nyid ma spyad pa / skye ba'i rkyen la ltos pa /
translated: They are as follows:🔽Those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a condition,

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa /
translated: those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a nature,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, a nature, and a condition,

original: skye ba dang thag nye ba'am /
analyzed: skye ba dang thag nye ba'am /
translated: those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a condition,

original: skye ba dang thag ring ba yang rung ste /🔽de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang thag ring ba yang rung ste /🔽de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, a nature, and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, a nature, and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, a nature, and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, a nature, and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a nature and a condition,🔽those that have not yet arisen due to the absence of a cause, a nature, and a condition,

original: skad cig ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / skye ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / 'chags pa ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / kun du spyod pa ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / 'thob pa ma 'ongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: skad cig ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / skye ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / 'chags pa ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / kun du spyod pa ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / 'thob pa ma 'ongs pa rnams so //
translated: future moments, future births, future creations, future conduct, and future attainments.

original: da ltar byung ba'i chos rgyu spyad zin pa ngo bo nyid ma spyad pa /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos rgyu spyad zin pa ngo bo nyid ma spyad pa /
translated: Present phenomena are those whose causes have already been used up, whose natures have not yet been used up,

original: skad cig gi 'og tu 'jig par nges pa /
analyzed: skad cig gi 'og tu 'jig par nges pa /
translated: and which are certain to disintegrate in the next moment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis rab tu phye ba dang / de dag las kha cig rnam par byang bas rab tu phye ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis rab tu phye ba dang / de dag las kha cig rnam par byang bas rab tu phye ba yang rung ste /
translated: They are distinguished by all the afflictions and some of them are distinguished by purification.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Their classification should be understood in terms of five aspects:

original: skad cig da ltar byung ba rnams dang / skye ba da ltar 'byung ba rnams dang / 'chags pa da ltar 'byung ba rnams dang / kun du spyod pa da ltar 'byung ba rnams dang / tha ma da ltar 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: skad cig da ltar byung ba rnams dang / skye ba da ltar 'byung ba rnams dang / 'chags pa da ltar 'byung ba rnams dang / kun du spyod pa da ltar 'byung ba rnams dang / tha ma da ltar 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: present moments, present births, present creations, present conduct, and present final moments.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos tha ma dag lta bu'o //
