analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos tha ma dag lta bu'o //
translated: it is like the final thoughts and mental factors of an arhat.

original: de la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena associated with the desire realm?

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba /
translated: Those that are born and occur in the desire realm, who are not free from desire for the desire realm,

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa de'i gnas skabs kyi chos skyes nas thob pa las sam /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa de'i gnas skabs kyi chos skyes nas thob pa las sam /
translated: who are not in a state of equipoise, and whose phenomena that are obtained from birth,

original: yid la byed pa las spyad @220b pa dang ; kun du spyod pa dang / kun du spyod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa las spyad @220b pa dang ; kun du spyod pa dang / kun du spyod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: or that arise from mental activity, or that are practiced, or that are being practiced, or that will be practiced, are called the phenomena associated with the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena associated with the form realm?

original: 'dod pa'i khams nyid du skyes shing 'byung ba bsam gtan gang yang rung ba snyoms par zhugs pa 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nyid du skyes shing 'byung ba bsam gtan gang yang rung ba snyoms par zhugs pa 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: Those that are born and occur in the desire realm, who enter into any of the meditative states, who are free from desire for the desire realm,

original: gzugs rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: gzugs rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba /
translated: but who are not free from desire for the form realm,

original: de'i gong du sbyor ba ma brtsams pa /🔽ting nge 'dzin de las ma langs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yid kyi sa pa'i chos yid la byed pa las kun du dpyad pa dang / kun du spyod pa dang / kun du spyod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //🔽gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa de las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gong du sbyor ba ma brtsams pa'i skye gnas thob pa las sam /
analyzed: de'i gong du sbyor ba ma brtsams pa / ting nge 'dzin de las ma langs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yid kyi sa pa'i chos yid la byed pa las kun du dpyad pa dang / kun du spyod pa dang / kun du spyod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o // gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa de las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gong du sbyor ba ma brtsams pa'i skye gnas thob pa las sam /
translated: prior to the beginning of the preparatory action,🔽or after the arising from that concentration, the mental factors of the mundane mental consciousness that are investigated, practiced, and will be practiced are called “dharmas associated with form.”

original: yid la byed pa las 'jig rten pa'i chos kun du spyad pa dang ; kun du spyod pa dang / kun du spyod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa las 'jig rten pa'i chos kun du spyad pa dang ; kun du spyod pa dang / kun du spyod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are born in the form realm and are not free from attachment to it, who have not begun the preparatory action for the higher realms, and who practice, are practicing, and will practice mundane dharmas through obtaining rebirth or through mental attention are also called “dharmas associated with form.”

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the formless realm.

original: de la chos dge ba rnams gang zhe na /🔽chos dge ba rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la chos dge ba rnams gang zhe na / chos dge ba rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: What are wholesome phenomena?

original: rgyu gnyis kyis dge ba rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis dge ba rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, wholesome phenomena are so called for two reasons.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: They are not by nature perverse,

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i chos rnams kyi gnyen po dang bde bas te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i chos rnams kyi gnyen po dang bde bas te /
translated: and they are the antidote to perverse phenomena and are happiness.

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis phyin ci ma log par dmigs pa la 'jug pa yin zhing /🔽gang dag phyin ci log tu gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis phyin ci ma log par dmigs pa la 'jug pa yin zhing / gang dag phyin ci log tu gyur la /
translated: Thus, wholesome phenomena are wholesome because they engage with their object without perversion by nature.🔽They are wholesome because they are the antidote to those phenomena that are perverse and engage with their object with affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa can du dmigs pa la 'jug pa de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bde 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba dang mthun pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du dmigs pa la 'jug pa de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bde 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba dang mthun pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin no //
translated: They are wholesome because they are conducive to good rebirth and to nirvāṇa.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni de las bzlog pa'i rgyu gnyis kho nas blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni de las bzlog pa'i rgyu gnyis kho nas blta bar bya ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous actions should be viewed as having just two causes, the opposite of the above.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi phyin ci log tu gyur ba dang mi bde bas so //🔽lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni phyin ci log tu gyu pa yang ma yin /🔽phyin ci log gi gnyen po yang ma yin pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin mi bde ba yang ma yin @221a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi phyin ci log tu gyur ba dang mi bde bas so // lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni phyin ci log tu gyu pa yang ma yin / phyin ci log gi gnyen po yang ma yin pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin mi bde ba yang ma yin @221a * //
translated: They are the opposite of the nature of virtue and they are not happiness.

original: par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Undefiled actions should be viewed as neither the opposite of error nor the antidote to error, and as neither happiness nor unhappiness.

original: dge ba de'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /🔽phyi ma la 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba de'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification of virtue should be understood as fivefold:🔽1) the desire for future results,🔽2) the antidote to the afflictions, such as the meditation on foulness as an antidote to desire,

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa nas /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa nas /
translated: 3) the antidote to the secondary afflictions, such as the signless as an antidote to distraction,🔽4) the antidote to the obscurations, such as the applications of mindfulness as an antidote to the afflictions,🔽5) the antidote to the obscurations to absorption, such as the eight liberations as an antidote to the obscurations of absorption.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i bar dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bas rab tu phye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i bar dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bas rab tu phye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The stations of totality are distinguished as the bases of totality.🔽The immeasurables are distinguished as the bases of the beneficial.🔽The formless attainments are distinguished as the bases of the formless.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The liberations are distinguished as the bases of the transcendence of form.🔽The eight spheres of mastery are distinguished as the bases of the mastery over form.🔽The eight spheres of predominance are distinguished as the bases of the predominance of the mind.🔽The ten totalities are distinguished as the bases of the totalities.🔽The bases of success are distinguished as the bases of success.

original: rnam par dag pa'i gnas pas rab tu phye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gnas pas rab tu phye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The superknowledges are distinguished as the bases of the superknowledges.🔽The powers are distinguished as the bases of the powers.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: The fearlessnesses are distinguished as the bases of fearlessness.🔽The exclusive qualities of the Buddha are distinguished as the bases of the exclusive qualities of the Buddha.

original: che 'di la bde bar gnas pa dge ba 'phags pa la sogs pas gnas pa rnams kyi'o //🔽sems can la phan 'dogs pas rab tu phye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: che 'di la bde bar gnas pa dge ba 'phags pa la sogs pas gnas pa rnams kyi'o // sems can la phan 'dogs pas rab tu phye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The great compassion is distinguished as the base of great compassion.🔽The unentangled qualities are distinguished as the bases of the unentangled qualities.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kho na'i ste gzhan la snying brtse ba can gyi nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi don spyod pa'i dge ba sna tshogs gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kho na'i ste gzhan la snying brtse ba can gyi nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi don spyod pa'i dge ba sna tshogs gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: The unshared qualities of the Buddha are distinguished as the bases of the unshared qualities of the Buddha.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is distinguished as the base of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par bzhag par rig par bya ste /🔽phyi ma la 'bras bu mi 'dod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar ma zhi bas rab tu phye ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pas rab tu phye ba dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga kho nas rnam par bzhag par rig par bya ste / phyi ma la 'bras bu mi 'dod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar ma zhi bas rab tu phye ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pas rab tu phye ba dang /
translated: The classification of nonvirtuous dharmas should be understood in the opposite way, in five ways.

original: gzhan la gnod pas rab tu dbye bas so //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pas rab tu dbye bas so //
translated: They are not desired as results in the future, they are the adverse side of the antidote to defilement, they are classified as the non-pacification of defilement, they are classified as defiled abiding, and they are classified as harm to others.

original: dge ba'i rgyu lngas stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu lngas stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Virtuous dharmas are powerful due to five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sbyor ba dang / sngon goms pa dang ; yon tan khyad par can yongs su 'dzin pa dang / zhing dang / dngos po dang / gnas dang / ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / sngon goms pa dang ; yon tan khyad par can yongs su 'dzin pa dang / zhing dang / dngos po dang / gnas dang / ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: They are: application, prior habituation, grasping of special qualities, field, thing, basis, and nature.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba dang / gus par sbyor bas byas pa dang / rnam pa du mas byas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba dang / gus par sbyor bas byas pa dang / rnam pa du mas byas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: They are done through constant application and respectful application, and through many aspects.

original: bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan dag de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa rnam grangs du mar brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa mthong na yid rab tu dga' ba skyed pa gang yin pa'i dge ba de ni sbyor bas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de la sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu dge ba kun du bstan bsgoms lan mang @221b du byas pa'i rgyu dang rkyen des /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan dag de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa rnam grangs du mar brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa mthong na yid rab tu dga' ba skyed pa gang yin pa'i dge ba de ni sbyor bas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu dge ba kun du bstan bsgoms lan mang @221b du byas pa'i rgyu dang rkyen des /
translated: The virtue that is powerful through application is to be understood as the virtue that one has done oneself, that one has caused others to take up correctly, that one has praised in many ways, and that one has rejoiced in seeing those who are in accord with it.🔽The virtue that is powerful through previous habituation is to be understood as the virtue that, due to the causes and conditions of having cultivated and repeatedly practiced virtue in other previous lives,

original: da ltar rang bzhin gyis dge ba'i chos rnams la sems 'jug pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi mthun pa nyid du kun du gnas pa gang yin pa'i dge ba de ni sngon goms pas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar rang bzhin gyis dge ba'i chos rnams la sems 'jug pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi mthun pa nyid du kun du gnas pa gang yin pa'i dge ba de ni sngon goms pas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: one’s mind now naturally engages in virtuous qualities and does not engage in nonvirtuous qualities, and that one naturally abides in opposition to nonvirtuous qualities.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'phags pa gzhi mthong ba rnams kyis dge ba sa 'og ma pa dang / thar pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'phags pa gzhi mthong ba rnams kyis dge ba sa 'og ma pa dang / thar pa'am /
translated: The wholesome which is dedicated to liberation or

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa /
translated: unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by those who are free from worldly attachment and by the noble ones who have seen the truth,

original: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni yon tan khyad par can yongs su 'dzin pas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni yon tan khyad par can yongs su 'dzin pas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and which is free from all views, should be known as powerful because it possesses special qualities.

original: de la sbyin gnas chen po'i zhing la dngos po gya nom pa /
analyzed: de la sbyin gnas chen po'i zhing la dngos po gya nom pa /
translated: The wholesome which is given to a great field of giving, with a superior thing,

original: bla ma'i gnas kyis phul ba gang yin pa'i dge ba de ni zhing dang / dngos po dang / gnas kyis stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i gnas kyis phul ba gang yin pa'i dge ba de ni zhing dang / dngos po dang / gnas kyis stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and with a superior attitude, should be known as powerful because of the field, the thing, and the attitude.

original: de las sbyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba bas ches stobs chung ba yin no //🔽tshul khrims las byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis sbyin pa las byung ba bas ches stobs dang ldan pa yin la bsgoms pa las byung ba bas ni ches stobs chung ba yin no //
analyzed: de las sbyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba bas ches stobs chung ba yin no // tshul khrims las byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis sbyin pa las byung ba bas ches stobs dang ldan pa yin la bsgoms pa las byung ba bas ni ches stobs chung ba yin no //
translated: The virtue that arises from giving is weaker than the virtue that arises from morality and meditation, because it is by nature weaker than the virtue that arises from morality and meditation.🔽The virtue that arises from morality is stronger than the virtue that arises from giving, because it is by nature stronger than the virtue that arises from giving, but it is weaker than the virtue that arises from meditation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba bas shin tu stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba bas shin tu stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The virtue that arises from meditation is stronger than the virtue that arises from giving and morality, because it is by nature stronger than the virtue that arises from giving and morality.

original: de ltar na dge ba ngo bo nyid kyis stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba ngo bo nyid kyis stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, virtue is to be known as strong by nature.

original: mi dge ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga po kho nas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang de las bzlog pa rnam pa lnga po kho nas stobs dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Nonvirtue is to be known as strong by the very same five modes, but in the opposite way.

original: chos lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of neutral dharmas is also established in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang ; spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa las byung ba dang / ngo bo nyid las byung bas so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang ; spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa las byung ba dang / ngo bo nyid las byung bas so //
translated: They are: (1) those arisen from the ripening cause, (2) those arisen from the cause of deportment, (3) those arisen from the cause of craftsmanship, (4) those arisen from the cause of supernormal transformation, and (5) those arisen from the essential cause.

original: de la ngo bo nyid las byung ba'i lung du ma bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid las byung ba'i lung du ma bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Among these, the neutral dharmas arisen from the essential cause are as follows:

original: rgyas pas byung ba'i dngos po gzugs can lnga po gang dag yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi @222a * //🔽skye mched gzugs can rnam par smin par ma bsdus pa dag las /
analyzed: rgyas pas byung ba'i dngos po gzugs can lnga po gang dag yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi @222a * // skye mched gzugs can rnam par smin par ma bsdus pa dag las /
translated: The five material entities arisen from the cause of development, and🔽among the external material sense bases, those that are not included in the sense base of auditory consciousness,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can ma gtogs pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can ma gtogs pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: except for the sense bases of visual form and sound that are wholesome or afflicted.

original: de la slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas of training?

original: gang zag slob pa rgyun du zhugs pa dang ; lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dus byas dang / 'jig rten pa'i dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni slob pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag slob pa rgyun du zhugs pa dang ; lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dus byas dang / 'jig rten pa'i dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni slob pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmas of the learners, i.e., the stream-enterers, the once-returners, and the non-returners, are supramundane and conditioned, and also mundane and wholesome.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni chos de dag la brten nas dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni chos de dag la brten nas dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed /
translated: Because, in regard to these dharmas, the learners train from time to time in the higher morality,

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la yang slob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la yang slob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the higher thought, and in the higher wisdom.

original: mi slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas of the adepts?

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dus byas dang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dus byas dang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmas of the perfected beings, i.e., the dharmas of the perfected beings whose impurities are destroyed, are supramundane and conditioned, and also mundane and wholesome.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas of neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dgra bcom pa'i mthar thug pa rnams kyi slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos ji skad bstan pa de dag ma gtogs pa gang dag de las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo'i rgyud du gtogs pa dang / de'i dbang gis byung ba'i chos thams cad ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dgra bcom pa'i mthar thug pa rnams kyi slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos ji skad bstan pa de dag ma gtogs pa gang dag de las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo'i rgyud du gtogs pa dang / de'i dbang gis byung ba'i chos thams cad ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phenomena of ordinary people, which are other than those, and the phenomena that arise from their power, are the phenomena of those neither in training nor beyond training.

original: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga dang / lta ba de dag la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal gang dag yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang / bden pa rnams la ma rig pa ma 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga dang / lta ba de dag la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal gang dag yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang / bden pa rnams la ma rig pa ma 'dres pa dang /
translated: They are the five views, such as the view of the transitory collection, and the attachment, hostility, and pride that are related to those views, and the factors associated with them, and the unmixed ignorance with regard to the truths.

original: bden pa rnams la yid gnyis dang / ngan song du 'gro ba dang / mthun pa'i las mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la yid gnyis dang / ngan song du 'gro ba dang / mthun pa'i las mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The factors to be abandoned by the path of vision are the factors that are abandoned by the path of vision, such as the afflicted views and doubt concerning the four noble truths, the actions that lead to unfortunate planes of existence, and the actions that are similar to these.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the factors to be abandoned by the spiritual path?

original: dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa @222b can gyi chos ji skad bstan pa rnams ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can thams cad ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa @222b can gyi chos ji skad bstan pa rnams ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can thams cad ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The factors to be abandoned by the spiritual path are all the wholesome and unwholesome impure factors, all the non-defined factors that are not capable of being the object of the path, and all the defiled factors that are not included in the factors to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the factors that are not to be abandoned?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa thams cad dang / mi slob pa'i rgyud du gtogs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa thams cad dang / mi slob pa'i rgyud du gtogs pa thams cad de /
translated: The factors that are not to be abandoned are all the supramundane factors of those in training, and all the factors of those beyond training.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dus rtag pa kho nar ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dus rtag pa kho nar ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Those that are supramundane are not to be abandoned, because they are always pure by nature.

original: de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa rnams ni spangs zin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa rnams ni spangs zin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Those that are mundane are not to be abandoned, because they have already been abandoned.

original: de la chos zab mo mthong bar dka' ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos zab mo mthong bar dka' ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the profound dharmas that are difficult to see?

original: chos thams cad zab mo mthong bar dka' ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad zab mo mthong bar dka' ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: All dharmas should be seen as profound and difficult to see.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di ni mchog tu zab pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di ni mchog tu zab pa yin te /
translated: The inexpressible nature and the essence that transcends the domain of words are the most profound.

original: chos thams cad kyang brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: All dharmas also have an inexpressible nature and an essence that transcends the domain of words.

original: de dag ni brjod pa la brten pas gzung bar bya ba dang / blta bar bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni brjod pa la brten pas gzung bar bya ba dang / blta bar bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are to be apprehended, seen, and realized because they are based on expression.

original: de lta bas na zab mo mthong bar dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o //🔽chos gzugs can rnams dang / gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / bstan du yod pa rnams dang / bstan du med pa rnams dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / thogs pa med pa rnams dang / bstan du med la thogs pa med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na zab mo mthong bar dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o // chos gzugs can rnams dang / gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / bstan du yod pa rnams dang / bstan du med pa rnams dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / thogs pa med pa rnams dang / bstan du med la thogs pa med pa rnams dang /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the profound is difficult to see.🔽The form and formless, the visible and invisible, the resistant and nonresistant, the invisible and nonresistant,

original: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / zang zing dang bcas pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / zang zing dang bcas pa rnams dang /
translated: the visible and resistant, the contaminated and uncontaminated, the afflicted and unafflicted, the substantial and insubstantial, the mundane and supramundane, the conditioned and unconditioned,

original: zang zing med pa rnams dang / zhen pa la brten pa rnams dang / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / gtogs pa rnams dang / ma gtogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: zang zing med pa rnams dang / zhen pa la brten pa rnams dang / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / gtogs pa rnams dang / ma gtogs pa rnams dang /
translated: those that are not material, those that are based on attachment, those that are based on renunciation, those that are mundane, those that are supramundane, those that are included, those that are not included,

original: 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma yas rnams dang / shes par bya ba rnams dang / rnam par shes par bya ba rnams dang / @223a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma yas rnams dang / shes par bya ba rnams dang / rnam par shes par bya ba rnams dang / @223a * //
translated: those that are conditioned, those that are unconditioned, those that are to be known, those that are to be cognized,

original: dmigs pa dang / gnas pa 'dren pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa med pa rnams dang / rgyu dang bcas pa rnams dang / rgyu med pa rnams dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / gnas pa 'dren pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa med pa rnams dang / rgyu dang bcas pa rnams dang / rgyu med pa rnams dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams dang /
translated: those that are objects, those that are phenomena that lead to abiding, those that have karmic ripening, those that do not have karmic ripening, those that have causes, those that are causeless, those that have results,

original: 'bras bu med pa rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / nang gi rnams dang / phyi rol gyi rnams dang / ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa rnams dang / zin pa rnams dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa dang /🔽'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ma yin pa dang / srid pa rnams dang / srid pa ma yin pa rnams dang / bla na yod pa rnams dang / bla na med pa rnams dang / bsgom par bya ba rnams dang / 'das pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / nang gi rnams dang / phyi rol gyi rnams dang / ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa rnams dang / zin pa rnams dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ma yin pa dang / srid pa rnams dang / srid pa ma yin pa rnams dang / bla na yod pa rnams dang / bla na med pa rnams dang / bsgom par bya ba rnams dang / 'das pa rnams dang /
translated: those without results, those that are dependently originated, those that are internal, those that are external, those that are included in name and form, those that are appropriated, those that are not appropriated, those that are derived from the great elements, those that are not derived from the great elements, those that are in the realm of existence, those that are not in the realm of existence, those that are surpassable, those that are unsurpassable, those that are to be cultivated, those that are past,

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzugs dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzugs dang ldan pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang /
translated: those that are future, those that are present, those that are associated with the desire realm, those that are associated with the form realm, those that are associated with the formless realm, those that are virtuous, those that are non-virtuous, those that are neutral,

original: slob pa rnams dang / mi slob pa rnams dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: slob pa rnams dang / mi slob pa rnams dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams dang /
translated: those in training, those beyond training, those neither in training nor beyond training, those to be abandoned by the path of seeing, those to be abandoned by the path of meditation, those not to be abandoned,

original: zab mo mthong bar dka' ba'i chos rnams kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin te /
analyzed: zab mo mthong bar dka' ba'i chos rnams kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin te /
translated: and the classification of profound phenomena that are difficult to see.

original: legs par bsams pa sems pas tshul bzhin la rab tu brtson pas ni de ltar chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba la rnal 'byor du bya'o //
analyzed: legs par bsams pa sems pas tshul bzhin la rab tu brtson pas ni de ltar chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba la rnal 'byor du bya'o //
translated: Those who are diligent in proper investigation through reflection on what is well-reflected upon should practice in this way, distinguishing phenomena.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ste /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ste /
translated: This is the ascertainment of the stage arisen from reflection.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: The remaining texts on ascertainment are not visible.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni mdor bsdu na bsgom pa rnam pa bcu drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni mdor bsdu na bsgom pa rnam pa bcu drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The ascertainment of the stages that arise from meditation should be understood in brief as sixteen kinds of meditation.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang / theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang / gzugs brnyan bsgom pa dang / dngos po'i mtha' bsgom pa dang / dgos pa @223b yongs su grub pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang / theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa dang / gzugs brnyan bsgom pa dang / dngos po'i mtha' bsgom pa dang / dgos pa @223b yongs su grub pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: They are as follows:🔽meditation on the mental attentions associated with the Disciples' Vehicle, meditation on the mental attentions associated with the Great Vehicle, meditation on the reflected image, meditation on the culmination of the thing, meditation on the accomplishment of the purpose,

original: 'thob pa bsgom pa dang / bsten pa bsgom pa dang / spang ba bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / nyi tshe bsgom pa dang / kun du 'gro ba bsgom pa dang / g-yo ba yod pa'i bsgom pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: 'thob pa bsgom pa dang / bsten pa bsgom pa dang / spang ba bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / nyi tshe bsgom pa dang / kun du 'gro ba bsgom pa dang / g-yo ba yod pa'i bsgom pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: meditation on attainment, meditation on reliance, meditation on elimination, meditation on the antidote, meditation on the limited, meditation on the universal, meditation on the presence of movement, meditation on the presence of strong formative influence,

original: grub pa bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i chos bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i chos bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos bsgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the Dharma that is not born of meditation, and the cultivation of the Dharma that is born of meditation.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the mental attentions associated with the vehicle of the Listeners?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na nyan thos /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na nyan thos /
translated: It is a case where a Listener,

original: nyan thos kyi chos nyid la gnas pa /🔽yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos nyid la gnas pa / yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa'am /
translated: dwelling in the Dharma of the Listeners,

original: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa /
translated: has entered into or has not entered into the faultless state of reality,

original: sems can gyi don la mi lta ba /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la mi lta ba /
translated: has no regard for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: bdag gi don la lta ba la la rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: bdag gi don la lta ba la la rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas /
translated: and has regard for his or her own welfare.

original: de bzhin nyid la rjes su zhugs nas so so rang gi chos kyi dmigs pa dpag tu yod cing yongs su chad pa skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i rnam pa yid la byed pa sred pa zad par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la rjes su zhugs nas so so rang gi chos kyi dmigs pa dpag tu yod cing yongs su chad pa skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i rnam pa yid la byed pa sred pa zad par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed pa de ni /
translated: Having entered into suchness, he cultivates the mental attentions that are the aspects of disenchantment, detachment, and liberation with regard to the infinite and limited objective supports of his own Dharma, in order to bring about the cessation of craving.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the cultivation of the mental attentions associated with the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the mental attentions associated with the Great Vehicle?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa /🔽yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa / yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa'am /
translated: It is as follows: Here a bodhisattva, abiding in the bodhisattva’s morality,🔽has not yet entered into the faultless state of reality,

original: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa /
translated: or has entered into the faultless state of reality,

original: bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don la lta ba la la rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas /🔽de bzhin nyid la rjes su zhugs nas /
analyzed: bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don la lta ba la la rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas / de bzhin nyid la rjes su zhugs nas /
translated: The attention of bodhisattvas is directed to suchness in two ways: as a matter of course, and with a specific focus.

original: so so rang gi chos kyi dmigs pa dpag tu med cing yongs su ma chad pa /
analyzed: so so rang gi chos kyi dmigs pa dpag tu med cing yongs su ma chad pa /
translated: The attention of bodhisattvas is directed to the infinite and unlimited objects of their own Dharma in two ways: as a matter of course, and with a specific focus.🔽The attention of bodhisattvas is directed to the means of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings in two ways: as a matter of course, and with a specific focus.

original: snying rje'i dbang du byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i rnam pa bla na med pa'i go 'phang gnon pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yid la byed pa /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang du byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i rnam pa bla na med pa'i go 'phang gnon pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yid la byed pa /
translated: The attention of bodhisattvas is directed to the cause of attaining the unsurpassed state in two ways: as a matter of course, and with a specific focus.🔽The attention of bodhisattvas is directed to the meditation that brings about the exhaustion of craving in oneself and others in two ways: as a matter of course, and with a specific focus.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sred pa zad par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed pa de ni theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sred pa zad par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed pa de ni theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas' meditation on the attention associated with the Great Vehicle.

original: gzugs brnyan bsgom pa gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan shes bya'i dngos @224a * //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan bsgom pa gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan shes bya'i dngos @224a * //
translated: What is meditation on images?

original: po dang cha mthun pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: po dang cha mthun pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It is the knowledge of the images that are the domain of concentration, which are similar to the entities that are objects of knowledge, and which are associated with conceptual thought.

original: lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa yid la byed pa'am /
translated: It is attention that is conducive to insight.🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa rnam par mi rtog pa zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs brnyan bsgom pa zhes bya'o //🔽dngos po'i mtha' bsgom pa gang zhe na /🔽nang dang phyi rol gyi chos 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi rags pa dang / cha phra ba nyid dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / rgyang ring ba dang / thag nye ba nyid dam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa rnam par mi rtog pa zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs brnyan bsgom pa zhes bya'o // dngos po'i mtha' bsgom pa gang zhe na / nang dang phyi rol gyi chos 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi rags pa dang / cha phra ba nyid dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / rgyang ring ba dang / thag nye ba nyid dam /
translated: The cultivation of the image is the cultivation of the image of the object of concentration, which is similar to the object of knowledge, and which is either favorable to insight or favorable to serenity.🔽The cultivation of the limit of existence is the cultivation of the mind which takes as its object the grossness and peacefulness of internal and external phenomena, past, future, and present, the bad and the good, the distant and the near,

original: de bzhin nyid la ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyis yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i mtha' bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyis yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i mtha' bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or the existence of reality just as it is and in its full extent.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /🔽'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan nam ;
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa bsgom pa gang zhe na / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan nam ;
translated: What is meditation on the accomplishment of the aim?🔽It is the meditation on the fundamental absorptions of the worldly and transcendental meditations.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa yongs su grub pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa yongs su grub pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called meditation on the accomplishment of the aim.

original: 'thob pa  ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'thob pa  ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditation on acquisition?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la bsam gtan dang po la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la bsam gtan dang po la brten nas /
translated: Here a person, on the basis of the first absorption,

original: gal to ma rtag pa'i 'du shes sgom par byed dam /
analyzed: gal to ma rtag pa'i 'du shes sgom par byed dam /
translated: either cultivates the perception of impermanence,

original: gal te 'chi ba'i 'du shes kyi bar du sgom par byed pa de /🔽de las gzhan pa rang gi sa pa'am /
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i 'du shes kyi bar du sgom par byed pa de / de las gzhan pa rang gi sa pa'am /
translated: or he cultivates the perception of death up to

original: sa 'og ma pa'i 'du shes mngon du ma gyur pa dag gam /🔽rjes drangs pa 'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i 'du shes mngon du ma gyur pa dag gam / rjes drangs pa 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: the perception of the knowledge of destruction of the cankers.🔽He cultivates the perception of the higher sphere,🔽or the perception of the lower sphere,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan de las gzhan pa dag gsal ba dang / ches 'od gsal bar bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan de las gzhan pa dag gsal ba dang / ches 'od gsal bar bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed cing /
translated: or the worldly or transcendental qualities other than those, in order to make them manifest and very clear.

original: de dag la yang dbang dang ldan pa 'thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang dbang dang ldan pa 'thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of attainment is the attainment of mastery over those.

original: bstan pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is cultivation of teaching?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rtag pa la sogs pa dge ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽dge ba'i chos gang dang gang yid la byed pa de'i de bsten pa'i bsgom pas sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bsten pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rtag pa la sogs pa dge ba'i 'du shes sam / dge ba'i chos gang dang gang yid la byed pa de'i de bsten pa'i bsgom pas sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bsten pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of whatever wholesome things one has undertaken, such as the perception of impermanence, etc.

original: spang ba bsgom pa gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas /
analyzed: spang ba bsgom pa gang zhe na / smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas /
translated: What is cultivation of abandonment?🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.

original: rang bzhin gyi @224b mtshan ma khyi'us khyi'u dbyung ba'i tshul gyis mngon par 'byin par byed /🔽mngon par sel bar byed /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi @224b mtshan ma khyi'us khyi'u dbyung ba'i tshul gyis mngon par 'byin par byed / mngon par sel bar byed /
translated: It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.

original: mngon par spong bar byed de /
analyzed: mngon par spong bar byed de /
translated: It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.🔽It is the cultivation of the cultivation of the practice of the sign of the object of concentration by means of mental attention.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the cultivation of

original: dper na la la zhig gi khyi'u ches phra bas khyi'u ches sbom pa 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig gi khyi'u ches phra bas khyi'u ches sbom pa 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a very small child produces a very large child.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i tshogs kyis gnas ngan len gyi tshogs mngon par 'byin par byed /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i tshogs kyis gnas ngan len gyi tshogs mngon par 'byin par byed /
translated: In the same way, a collection of great pliancy produces a collection of bad states.

original: mngon par sel bar byed /
analyzed: mngon par sel bar byed /
translated: It eliminates them,

original: mngon par spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni spong ba bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni spong ba bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it abandons them. This is called the cultivation of abandonment.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the counteragent?

original: smras pa / rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po'am spong ba gnyen po'am kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po'am /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po'am spong ba gnyen po'am kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po'am /
translated: It is the cultivation of the counteragent of rejection, the counteragent of separation, the counteragent of support,

original: thag bsring ba gnyen po yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni de gnyen po bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thag bsring ba gnyen po yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni de gnyen po bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the cultivation of the counteragent of distance. This is called the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni tshad med pa dag ma gtogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i lam thams cad dang / rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa gzhan gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni tshad med pa dag ma gtogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i lam thams cad dang / rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa gzhan gang yin pa'o //
translated: The antidote of thorough disjunction is all mundane virtuous paths except for the immeasurables and any other attention that possesses the emanation of yogis.🔽

original: de la spong ba gnyen po ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yid la byed pa'o //🔽de la kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po ni /
analyzed: de la spong ba gnyen po ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yid la byed pa'o // de la kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po ni /
translated: The counteragent of thorough abandonment is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of nonarising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.

original: de la thag bsring ba gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i de'i gnyen po'i lam lan mang du byed pa dang / sa gong ma pa'i lam lan mang du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la thag bsring ba gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i de'i gnyen po'i lam lan mang du byed pa dang / sa gong ma pa'i lam lan mang du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i lan ni sun 'byin pa gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i lan ni sun 'byin pa gnyen po yin no //
translated: The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path of meditative development.🔽The counteragent of non-loss is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-arising is the path of no more learning.🔽The counteragent of non-error is the path of vision.🔽The counteragent of non-deficiency is the path

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni spong ba gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni spong ba gnyen po yin no //
translated: The supramundane path is the counteragent of abandonment.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu gnas gyur pa ni kun du 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu gnas gyur pa ni kun du 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Its result is the transformation of the basis, which is the counteragent of possession.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni thag bsring ba gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni thag bsring ba gnyen po yin no //
translated: The mundane path of cultivation is the counteragent of distancing.

original: nyi tshe bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi tshe bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is limited cultivation?

original: smras pa / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni nyi tshe bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni nyi tshe bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of any wholesome factor, such as the perception of impermanence, etc.

original: kun du 'gro ba bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is universal cultivation?

original: smras pa / chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid ro gcig par yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni kun du 'gro ba bsgom pa zhes bya'o //🔽g-yo ba yod pa'i @225a * //
analyzed: smras pa / chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid ro gcig par yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni kun du 'gro ba bsgom pa zhes bya'o // g-yo ba yod pa'i @225a * //
translated: It is the cultivation of the perception of the single taste of suchness in all factors of existence.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the absence of distraction?🔽It is the cultivation of the perception of the absence of distraction in regard to the object of meditation.🔽What is the cultivation of the absence of error?

original: mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan mas skabs skabs su rgyun chad pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba yod pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan mas skabs skabs su rgyun chad pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba yod pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meditation that is interrupted from time to time by the signs of one who has entered into the meditation on signlessness is called “meditation with wavering.”

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditation with effort?

original: smras pa ; de nyid la zhugs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las mtshan mas rgyun chad pa med par bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; de nyid la zhugs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las mtshan mas rgyun chad pa med par bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the meditation that is uninterrupted by the signs of one who has entered into the meditation on signlessness through effort. This is called “meditation with effort.”

original: grub pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditation with attainment?

original: smras pa / nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: It is the meditation of the disciples,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the meditation of the solitary sages,

original: theg pa chen pos thams cad kyi thams cad du gnas gyur pa chos thams cad la dbang thob pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos thams cad kyi thams cad du gnas gyur pa chos thams cad la dbang thob pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the meditation of the bodhisattvas. The meditation of the bodhisattvas is the meditation of the great beings.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i chos bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i chos bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of a factor that is not derived from cultivation?

original: smras pa / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: smras pa / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is the cultivation of generosity, morality, etc., which are wholesome factors on the stage that is not concentrated.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i chos bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i chos bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the cultivation of a factor that is not derived from cultivation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of a factor that is derived from cultivation?🔽It is the cultivation of generosity, morality, etc., which are wholesome factors on the stage that is concentrated.

original: smras pa / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bsgom pa pa gang yin pa de ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bsgom pa pa gang yin pa de ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the cultivation of a factor that is derived from cultivation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ste /
translated: This is the section on the stage that is derived from cultivation in the detailed explanation of the treatise.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
translated: The remainder of the treatise is not extant.

original: // / nyan thos kyi sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni sa'i dngos gzhir gang zag rigs med pa la gnas pa gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes gang bshad pa de la gal te la la ji ltar gtan yongs su mya ngan
analyzed: // / nyan thos kyi sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni sa'i dngos gzhir gang zag rigs med pa la gnas pa gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes gang bshad pa de la gal te la la ji ltar gtan yongs su mya ngan
translated: The śrāvaka-bhūmi-vyavasthāna explains that the person who is situated in the lineage of no-lineage is one who is absolutely not destined for nirvāṇa.

original: las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin snyam du yid gnyis dang / the tshom skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin snyam du yid gnyis dang / the tshom skye bar gyur na /
translated: If someone were to doubt or be uncertain about how he is absolutely not destined for nirvāṇa,

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be said to him:

original: ci sems can khams sna tshogs pa dang / khams dpag tu med pa dang / khams dman pa pa dang / khams gya nom pa ba dag yod par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ci sems can khams sna tshogs pa dang / khams dpag tu med pa dang / khams dman pa pa dang / khams gya nom pa ba dag yod par 'dod dam /
translated: “Do you assert that there are various constituents, immeasurable constituents, inferior constituents, and excellent constituents of sentient beings?

original: 'on te mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dod /
translated: Or do you not assert them?

original: gal te yod na ni des na gang zag gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can med ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni des na gang zag gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can med ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If you assert them, then it is not tenable to say that the person who is absolutely not destined for nirvāṇa does not exist.

original: gal te med @225b na ni des na sems can khams sna tshogs pa nas khams gya nom pa pa'i bar dag yod ces byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te med @225b na ni des na sems can khams sna tshogs pa nas khams gya nom pa pa'i bar dag yod ces byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If not, then it is not possible to say that there are sentient beings with various elements, up to and including those with excellent elements.

original: de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
analyzed: de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
translated: Even though he has been answered in this way, he still asks further,

original: ji ltar sems can rnams la khams sna tshogs pa nyid nas /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams la khams sna tshogs pa nyid nas /
translated: “How is it that sentient beings have various elements, up to and including excellent elements,

original: khams gya nom pa pa nyid kyi bar dag yod kyang dbang po med pa'i sems can med de yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: khams gya nom pa pa nyid kyi bar dag yod kyang dbang po med pa'i sems can med de yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang de bzhin no //
translated: but there are no sentient beings without faculties, and those who are not destined for complete nirvana are also like that?”

original: yang na dbang po med pa yang sems can du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang na dbang po med pa yang sems can du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or else, why wouldn’t those without faculties also be sentient beings?

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this, he should be told the following:

original: ci dbang po med pa gang yin pa de ni sems can yin nam /
analyzed: ci dbang po med pa gang yin pa de ni sems can yin nam /
translated: “Is that which is without faculties a sentient being,

original: 'on te sems can ma yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te sems can ma yin par 'dod /
translated: or is it not considered a sentient being?”

original: gal te sems can yin na ni des na phyi rol gyi dngos po dbang po med pa rnams kyang sems can yin par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can yin na ni des na phyi rol gyi dngos po dbang po med pa rnams kyang sems can yin par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is a sentient being, then it is not possible that external things without faculties are sentient beings.

original: gal te sems can ma yin na ni des na dbang po med pa yang sems can du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ngo //🔽de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
analyzed: gal te sems can ma yin na ni des na dbang po med pa yang sems can du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ngo // de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
translated: If it is not a sentient being, then why is it not suitable to say that a non-sentient being is a sentient being?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Even though he was answered in this way, he still asked further:

original: dper na rgyal rigs su gyur pa las res 'ga' bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs su 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du dmangs rigs su gyur pa las res 'ga' rgyal rigs kyi bar du 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba par gyur pa las res 'ga' lha'i bar du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dper na rgyal rigs su gyur pa las res 'ga' bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs su 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du dmangs rigs su gyur pa las res 'ga' rgyal rigs kyi bar du 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba par gyur pa las res 'ga' lha'i bar du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: “For example, one who is a member of the ruling class sometimes becomes a member of the priestly class, the merchant class, or the laborer class, and likewise, one who is a member of the laborer class sometimes becomes a member of the ruling class.

original: lhar gyur pa las res 'ga' sems can dmyal ba pa'i bar du 'gyur bde bzhin du /
analyzed: lhar gyur pa las res 'ga' sems can dmyal ba pa'i bar du 'gyur bde bzhin du /
translated: One who is a hell-being sometimes becomes a god, and one who is a god sometimes becomes a hell-being.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur pa las kyang res 'ga' yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur pa las kyang res 'ga' yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, why does one who is destined not to attain nirvana sometimes become one who is destined to attain nirvana?

original: de'i phyir gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no one who is absolutely not destined to attain nirvana.

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this, the following reply should be made:

original: ci rgyal rigs nas dmangs rigs kyi bar dang / sems can dmyal ba pa nas lha'i bar gang yin pa de khams thams cad pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rgyal rigs nas dmangs rigs kyi bar dang / sems can dmyal ba pa nas lha'i bar gang yin pa de khams thams cad pa yin nam /
translated: Is it the case that the person who is a member of the kṣatriya class and so on up to the śūdra class, and who is a hell being and so on up to a god, is a member of all the realms,

original: 'on te khams re re pa yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te khams re re pa yin par 'dod /
translated: or is it that he is a member of a single realm?

original: gal te khams thams cad pa yin na ni nges na de dpe mi mthun pas mi rung ngo //🔽gal te khams re re ba yin na ni des na rgyal rigs su gyur nas res 'ga' dmangs rigs kyi bar du 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba par gyur nas /🔽res 'ga' @226a * //
analyzed: gal te khams thams cad pa yin na ni nges na de dpe mi mthun pas mi rung ngo // gal te khams re re ba yin na ni des na rgyal rigs su gyur nas res 'ga' dmangs rigs kyi bar du 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba par gyur nas / res 'ga' @226a * //
translated: If he is a member of all the realms, then the example is not appropriate, since it is not definite.

original: lha'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lha'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If he is a member of a single realm, then it is not possible to say that he is a member of the kṣatriya class and so on up to the śūdra class, and that he is a hell being and so on up to a god.

original: de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
analyzed: de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
translated: Even if he is questioned in this way, he will still ask further:

original: ji ltar rgyal rigs la sogs pa khams thams cad pa de kho na yin pa de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal rigs la sogs pa khams thams cad pa de kho na yin pa de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Just as the kṣatriya and so on are of the nature of all the elements, why does one who is not by nature destined to nirvana not attain nirvana?

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this it should be said:

original: ci yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi khams gang yin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can gyi sems can gang yin pa'i khams de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi khams gang yin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can gyi sems can gang yin pa'i khams de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa yin nam /
translated: Are the two elements—that which is not by nature destined to nirvana and that which is by nature destined to nirvana—mutually incompatible?

original: 'on te mi mthun pa med par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mi mthun pa med par 'dod /
translated: Or are they not considered to be mutually incompatible?

original: gal te mi mthun na ni des na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi khams ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can gyi khams su mi 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi mthun na ni des na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi khams ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can gyi khams su mi 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If they are incompatible, then it is not tenable to ask, “Why does the element that is not by nature destined to nirvana not become the element that is by nature destined to nirvana?”

original: gal te mi mthun pa med na ni gang zag de nyid yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa med na ni gang zag de nyid yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang yin la /
translated: If there were no disagreement, then that person would be one who does not attain nirvana and also one who attains nirvana.

original: de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yang yin par 'gyur te mi rung ngo //🔽de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
analyzed: de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yang yin par 'gyur te mi rung ngo // de skad lan btab kyang yang yongs su 'dri ste /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Even though he has been answered in this way, he still asks,🔽“For example, in some places on earth, sometimes there is no gold, sometimes there is gold;

original: dper na sa'i phyogs la la ni res 'ga' gser gyi rigs med pa las res 'ga' gser gyi rigs yod pa dang / res 'ga' nor bu dang ; mu tig dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i rigs med pa las res 'ga' de dag gi rigs yod pa dang /
analyzed: dper na sa'i phyogs la la ni res 'ga' gser gyi rigs med pa las res 'ga' gser gyi rigs yod pa dang / res 'ga' nor bu dang ; mu tig dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i rigs med pa las res 'ga' de dag gi rigs yod pa dang /
translated: sometimes there is no family of jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, and so on, sometimes there is.

original: res 'ga' lan tshva'i rigs med pa las res 'ga' de'i rigs yod pa dang / res 'ga' 'byung khungs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rigs med pa las res 'ga' de dag gi rigs yod pa de bzhin du ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur pa las res 'ga' yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can
analyzed: res 'ga' lan tshva'i rigs med pa las res 'ga' de'i rigs yod pa dang / res 'ga' 'byung khungs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rigs med pa las res 'ga' de dag gi rigs yod pa de bzhin du ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur pa las res 'ga' yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can
translated: Sometimes the type of salt that does not exist there exists, and sometimes the type of various sources that does not exist there exists.🔽In the same way, why does one who is not a dharma

original: du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: of complete nirvana sometimes become a dharma of complete nirvana?

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /🔽ci dper na sa'i phyogs de na de dag gi regs med par gyur pa las de dag gi rigs yod par gyur pa'am /
