analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / ci dper na sa'i phyogs de na de dag gi regs med par gyur pa las de dag gi rigs yod par gyur pa'am /
translated: This is said:🔽Is it like, for example, the type of those that does not exist in that place becoming the type of those that exists there,

original: de dag gi rigs yod par gyur pa las de dag gi rigs med par gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag gi rigs yod par gyur pa las de dag gi rigs med par gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: or the type of those that exists there becoming the type of those that does not exist there?

original: nyan thos kyi rigs su nges par gyur pa las de'i rigs med par gyur pa nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs su nges par gyur pa las de'i rigs med par gyur pa nas /
translated: In the same way, one who is ascertained as the type of śrāvaka becomes the type of those who does not exist there,🔽and so on.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs su nges par gyur pa las de'i rigs med par gyur pa dang / ma nges pa'i @226b rigs su gyur pa las nges pa'i rigs kyi bar du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs su nges par gyur pa las de'i rigs med par gyur pa dang / ma nges pa'i @226b rigs su gyur pa las nges pa'i rigs kyi bar du gyur pa'am /
translated: It is not tenable that the root of virtue conducive to liberation would be severed, because it is impossible that one who is definitely of the Mahayana lineage would become one who is not of that lineage, or that one who is of an indefinite lineage would become one who is of a definite lineage.

original: 'on te de lta ma yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin par 'dod /
translated: Or is it not asserted in this way?

original: gal te yin na ni des na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni des na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is, then the root of virtue conducive to liberation would be fruitless.

original: de ltar na rigs rnam par gzhag pa nges pa med par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs rnam par gzhag pa nges pa med par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: In that case, it would be untenable to posit the lineage as definite.

original: gal te ma yin na ni des na 'di lta ste /🔽dper na sa'i phyogs bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rigs med pa la gnas par gyur nas /🔽rigs la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ni des na 'di lta ste / dper na sa'i phyogs bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rigs med pa la gnas par gyur nas / rigs la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: If it is not, then it would be like the following analogy.🔽One who is not of the lineage that attains nirvana, like a part of the earth, would come to abide in the lineage.

original: dper na sa'i phyogs bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yang rigs la gnas par gyur nas /
analyzed: dper na sa'i phyogs bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yang rigs la gnas par gyur nas /
translated: And one who is of the lineage that attains nirvana, like a part of the earth, would come to abide in the lineage.

original: rigs med pa la gnas par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rigs med pa la gnas par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that those who are not of ārya lineage would abide in the lineage of āryas.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the following should be said:

original: ci yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can khams dman pa kho na la gnas pa tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can khams dman pa kho na la gnas pa tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur ram /
translated: Do those who possess the attribute of not attaining nirvana abide in the inferior realm and then become those who possess the attribute of attaining nirvana in this life?

original: 'on te de'i 'og tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'dod /🔽gal te tshe 'di nyid la yin na ni des na ci des sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la brten nas /
analyzed: 'on te de'i 'og tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'dod / gal te tshe 'di nyid la yin na ni des na ci des sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la brten nas /
translated: Or do they attain nirvana after that?

original: tshe de nyid la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal ba yang yod pa'am /
analyzed: tshe de nyid la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal ba yang yod pa'am /
translated: If they do so in this life, then do they have the fortune to generate roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation in dependence on the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha?

original: 'on te med par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te med par 'dod /
translated: Or do they not?

original: gal te skal pa yod na ni des na sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun la brten te tshe 'di la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal ba yod pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes byar mi rung ngo //🔽gal te skal ba med na ni des na sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la brten te /
analyzed: gal te skal pa yod na ni des na sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun la brten te tshe 'di la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal ba yod pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes byar mi rung ngo // gal te skal ba med na ni des na sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la brten te /
translated: If they have the good fortune, then they have the good fortune to generate the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation in this life, in dependence on the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha. Therefore, it is not suitable to say that they are “those who will not pass into parinirvāṇa.”

original: tshe 'di la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa'i skal ba med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshe 'di la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa'i skal ba med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If they do not have the good fortune, then they do not have the good fortune to generate the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation in this life, in dependence on the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha. Therefore, it is not suitable to say that they are “those who will pass into parinirvāṇa.”

original: gal te phyi ma'i tshe rabs la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur na ni des na ci sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags nas /
analyzed: gal te phyi ma'i tshe rabs la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur na ni des na ci sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags nas /
translated: If they will become those who pass into parinirvāṇa in a later life, then did they previously accumulate roots of virtue,

original: de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten te /
analyzed: de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten te /
translated: and in a later life, in dependence on the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha,

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa'i skal ba yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa'i skal ba yod pa yin nam /
translated: Do they have the fortune to generate the root of merit that is conducive to liberation?

original: 'on te sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bstsags par de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la /🔽sangs rgyas dang / chos dang @227a * //
analyzed: 'on te sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bstsags par de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang @227a * //
translated: Or do they have the fortune to generate the root of merit that is conducive to liberation in their next life,🔽in dependence on the Buddha,

original: dge 'dun la brten te /
analyzed: dge 'dun la brten te /
translated: the Dharma and the Saṅgha,

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa'i skal ba yod par 'dod /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa'i skal ba yod par 'dod /
translated: without having previously accumulated the roots of virtue?

original: gal te sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags na ni des na tshe 'di nyid la sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten te /
analyzed: gal te sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags na ni des na tshe 'di nyid la sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten te /
translated: If they have previously accumulated the roots of virtue, then it is not possible to say that in this very life, in dependence on the Buddha, the Dharma and the Saṅgha,

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed nas de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed nas de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: they generate the root of merit that is conducive to liberation and in their next life they will possess the quality of attaining complete nirvana.

original: 'di ltar rgyu mtshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu mtshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is illogical.

original: gal te sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bstsags na ni des na sngon dang phyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bstsags par 'dra bas /
analyzed: gal te sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bstsags na ni des na sngon dang phyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bstsags par 'dra bas /
translated: If one has not previously accumulated the roots of virtue, then one will not accumulate the roots of virtue in the future, because the present is similar to the past.

original: de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyi ma'i tshe rabs la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur la /
translated: One will be one who will attain nirvana in a future life.

original: de nyid la mi 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid la mi 'gyur zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to say that one will attain nirvana in this life.

original: nyan thos rnams ni mdor bsdu na bcu po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni mdor bsdu na bcu po 'di dag yin te /
translated: In brief, there are ten types of disciples:

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: dag pa'i khams can dang / rkyen rnyed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi khams su skyes pa dang / dag pa'i khams su skyes pa dang / dus kyi mthar skyes pa dang / dus bzang por skyes pa dang / mig ma thob pa dang /
analyzed: dag pa'i khams can dang / rkyen rnyed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi khams su skyes pa dang / dag pa'i khams su skyes pa dang / dus kyi mthar skyes pa dang / dus bzang por skyes pa dang / mig ma thob pa dang /
translated: Those who have a pure realm, those who obtain the conditions, those who are born in a defiled realm, those who are born in a pure realm, those who are born at the end of an eon, those who are born at a good time, those who have not obtained the eye,

original: mig thob pa dang / mig rnam par dag pa dang / mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: mig thob pa dang / mig rnam par dag pa dang / mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: those who have obtained the eye, those whose eye is pure, and those whose eye is very pure.

original: de la dang po ni rigs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni rigs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The first is one who abides in the lineage.

original: gnyis pa ni zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni zhugs pa'o //
translated: The second is one who has entered the stages.

original: nyan thos gang 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sdug bsngal mang ba sna tshogs dmigs pa der skyes shing /🔽der yang tshe'i snyigs ma nas /
analyzed: nyan thos gang 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sdug bsngal mang ba sna tshogs dmigs pa der skyes shing / der yang tshe'i snyigs ma nas /
translated: The listeners who are born in a world system where various kinds of suffering are perceived and where the five degenerations

original: sems can gyi snyigs ma'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi snyigs ma lnga 'byung ba'i go skabs yod pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi khams su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi snyigs ma'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi snyigs ma lnga 'byung ba'i go skabs yod pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi khams su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: exist, from the degeneration of life to the degeneration of sentient beings, are said to be born in a defiled realm.

original: dag pa'i khams su skyes pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i khams su skyes pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who are born in a pure realm should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: nyan thos dus kyi mthar skyes pa ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos dus kyi mthar skyes pa ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one regard the listeners who are born at the end of an eon?

original: nyan thos dus kyi mthar skyes pa rnams ni phal cher rnyed pa dang bkur sti la 'du ba /
analyzed: nyan thos dus kyi mthar skyes pa rnams ni phal cher rnyed pa dang bkur sti la 'du ba /
translated: The listeners who are born at the end of an eon are mostly attached to gain and honor,

original: yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la mi phyogs pa /
analyzed: yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la mi phyogs pa /
translated: they are not inclined toward the teachings that truly delight the mind,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mang ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mang ba /
translated: and they are full of attachment, hostility, and benighted ignorance and of non-Dharma.

original: phrag dog dang / ser sna'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas sems yongs su gtugs pa gnas la ser sna byed pa /
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser sna'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas sems yongs su gtugs pa gnas la ser sna byed pa /
translated: They are those who are completely overwhelmed by the secondary defilements of jealousy and avarice, those who are stingy with regard to abodes,

original: khyim la ser sna byed pa /
analyzed: khyim la ser sna byed pa /
translated: those who are stingy with regard to houses,

original: rnyed pa la ser sna byed pa /
analyzed: rnyed pa la ser sna byed pa /
translated: those who are stingy with regard to wealth,

original: bsngags pa la ser sna byed pa /
analyzed: bsngags pa la ser sna byed pa /
translated: those who are stingy with regard to praise,

original: chos la ser sna byed pa /
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed pa /
translated: those who are stingy with regard to the Dharma,🔽those who are deceitful and fraudulent,

original: g-yo dang sgyu dang ldan pa /🔽dkyor @227b 'byin pa /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu dang ldan pa / dkyor @227b 'byin pa /
translated: those who are hypocritical,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,

original: dor byed pa nas /
analyzed: dor byed pa nas /
translated: those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,

original: rgyas par 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung gi / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa'i bar dang / rgod pa /🔽khengs pa / mi brtan pa /
analyzed: rgyas par 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung gi / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa'i bar dang / rgod pa / khengs pa / mi brtan pa /
translated: those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,

original: mu cor smra ba /🔽spyi rtol che ba /
analyzed: mu cor smra ba / spyi rtol che ba /
translated: those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,

original: ngan g-yo dang ldan pa /🔽brjed ngas pa /
analyzed: ngan g-yo dang ldan pa / brjed ngas pa /
translated: those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa /🔽sems rnam par 'khrul ba /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa / sems rnam par 'khrul ba /
translated: those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,🔽those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are deceitful,

original: dbang po yal bar bor ba /🔽nyon mongs pa mang yang nyon mongs pa kun nas 'byung ba yongs su gcod par mi byed pa /
analyzed: dbang po yal bar bor ba /🔽nyon mongs pa mang yang nyon mongs pa kun nas 'byung ba yongs su gcod par mi byed pa /
translated: those who are fraudulent,🔽those who are

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang yang skyo ba mi skyed pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang yang skyo ba mi skyed pa /
translated: They are not discouraged by much suffering and unhappiness.

original: tshogs 'du ba mang ba /
analyzed: tshogs 'du ba mang ba /
translated: They have many gatherings.

original: bas mtha'i gnas mal dgon pa dag spangs pa /
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas mal dgon pa dag spangs pa /
translated: They avoid solitary places in the wilderness.

original: tshogs kyi nang du 'ong ba /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang du 'ong ba /
translated: They come to gatherings.

original: grong dang nye ba'i mal cha dang / stan dag la brten cing de la kun du dga' ba /
analyzed: grong dang nye ba'i mal cha dang / stan dag la brten cing de la kun du dga' ba /
translated: They rely on and enjoy beds and seats in towns and nearby.

original: de bzhin du smra ba la kun du dga' ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra ba la kun du dga' ba /
translated: They enjoy talking like that.

original: 'du 'dzi'i gtam la kun du dga' ba /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i gtam la kun du dga' ba /
translated: They enjoy talk about crowds.

original: 'du 'dzi la kun du dga' ba bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la kun du dga' ba bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa /
translated: They enjoy crowds and take pleasure in themselves.

original: bag med pa /
analyzed: bag med pa /
translated: They are careless.

original: lus ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: lus ma bsgoms pa /
translated: They do not cultivate the body.

original: sems dang ; tshul khrims dang / shes rab ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: sems dang ; tshul khrims dang / shes rab ma bsgoms pa /
translated: They do not cultivate the mind, moral discipline, or wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde chos zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde chos zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
translated: They reject the sutras taught by the Tathagata that are profound dharmas endowed with emptiness,

original: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mthun pa gang dag yin pa de dag spangs nas /
analyzed: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mthun pa gang dag yin pa de dag spangs nas /
translated: and that accord with the reality of conditions and dependent origination.

original: snyan dngags mkhan gyis byas pa snyan dngags kyi yul yi ge sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: snyan dngags mkhan gyis byas pa snyan dngags kyi yul yi ge sna tshogs pa /
translated: The poets who compose poetry, which is an object of poetry, with various letters,

original: tshig dang yig 'bru sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: tshig dang yig 'bru sna tshogs pa /
translated: various words and syllables,

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag gus par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag gus par bya ste /
translated: endowed with the secret words of the Lokāyata, should be respected.

original: len cing de la mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa'i chos dag la chos su 'du shes shing ;
analyzed: len cing de la mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa'i chos dag la chos su 'du shes shing ;
translated: They take up those false dharmas that are like the true Dharma, perceiving them as the Dharma,

original: de dag la dga' ba dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston par byed pa /
analyzed: de dag la dga' ba dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston par byed pa /
translated: and they delight in them, teach them, and expound them.

original: chos dang 'dul ba la skur ba 'debs pa /
analyzed: chos dang 'dul ba la skur ba 'debs pa /
translated: They slander the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: chos dang 'dul smra ba'i gang zag rnams la dgrar 'du shes pa /
analyzed: chos dang 'dul smra ba'i gang zag rnams la dgrar 'du shes pa /
translated: They perceive those who speak the Dharma and Vinaya as enemies.

original: phal cher tshul khrims 'chal pa /
analyzed: phal cher tshul khrims 'chal pa /
translated: They are mostly immoral.

original: sdig pa'i chos can nang rul pa /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos can nang rul pa /
translated: They have sinful qualities, are rotten within,

original: nyes 'jag tu gyur pa ;
analyzed: nyes 'jag tu gyur pa ;
translated: and have become corrupt.

original: lung bong ltar kun du spyod pa /
analyzed: lung bong ltar kun du spyod pa /
translated: They behave like donkeys.

original: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
translated: They are not ascetics but claim to be ascetics.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par kha sa 'che ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par kha sa 'che ba /
translated: They are not celibate, but claim to be.

original: bsams bzhin du ltung ba lci ba dag ma lus par 'byin pa /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du ltung ba lci ba dag ma lus par 'byin pa /
translated: They intentionally commit all the heavy downfalls without exception.

original: lci ba dag kyang lhag ma ma lus par 'byin /
analyzed: lci ba dag kyang lhag ma ma lus par 'byin /
translated: They commit the heavy downfalls without exception.

original: 'bring dang yang @228a * //
analyzed: 'bring dang yang @228a * //
translated: They commit the medium and🔽light downfalls without exception.

original: bdag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa /
analyzed: bdag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa /
translated: What need is there to mention me?

original: ltung ba byung na yang phal cher chos bzhin du phyir gso bar mi byed pa /
analyzed: ltung ba byung na yang phal cher chos bzhin du phyir gso bar mi byed pa /
translated: Even when they have a downfall, they usually do not properly restore it.

original: gzhan go bar bya ba'i phyir 'chags kyi /
analyzed: gzhan go bar bya ba'i phyir 'chags kyi /
translated: They confess it to others in order to be understood,

original: bsam pa thag pa nas mi byed pa /
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas mi byed pa /
translated: but they do not do so with a sincere attitude.

original: mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim dag nan gyis yongs su 'dzin par byed pa /
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim dag nan gyis yongs su 'dzin par byed pa /
translated: They insist on keeping close the families of their friends and the families who give them alms.

original: khyim na gnas pa'i bya ba dang / khyim na gnas pa'i byed pa don med pa dang ldan pa dag la rtsol ba mang du byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i bya ba dang / khyim na gnas pa'i byed pa don med pa dang ldan pa dag la rtsol ba mang du byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They exert themselves in the meaningless activities and actions of householders.

original: de dag ni khyim pa gos dkar po can rnams la ches shas cher byams pa dang / mdza' ba dang / gus pa dang ; snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni khyim pa gos dkar po can rnams la ches shas cher byams pa dang / mdza' ba dang / gus pa dang ; snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed kyi /
translated: They are very loving, affectionate, respectful, and kind to the householders who wear white clothes,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la ni de ltar mi byed do //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la ni de ltar mi byed do //
translated: but not to those who practice pure conduct.

original: tshul 'chos pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos rnams kyi shas cher gnas so //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos rnams kyi shas cher gnas so //
translated: They are mostly engaged in the practices of hypocrisy and wrong livelihood.

original: gcig la gcig 'khu ba'i sems nye bar 'jog cing 'thab krol byed pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed par byed do //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'khu ba'i sems nye bar 'jog cing 'thab krol byed pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed par byed do //
translated: They harbor thoughts of mutual betrayal, quarreling, fault-finding, disputes, and contention.

original: snod spyad dang / yo byad mang ba dang / spyod tshul tsam lhur len par byed do //
analyzed: snod spyad dang / yo byad mang ba dang / spyod tshul tsam lhur len par byed do //
translated: They are preoccupied with a lot of dishes and utensils, and with mere etiquette.

original: de dag gis gang dag rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: de dag gis gang dag rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: All those who have gone forth and been ordained by them

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis bsnyen bkur dang yongs su spyod pa'i phyir byed la /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis bsnyen bkur dang yongs su spyod pa'i phyir byed la /
translated: do so for the sake of service and enjoyment, with a mind attached to material things.

original: tshig tu ni snying brtse ba'i phyir khyed rab tu dbyung ngo //
analyzed: tshig tu ni snying brtse ba'i phyir khyed rab tu dbyung ngo //
translated: But in his heart he thought, I will ordain him out of compassion.🔽🔽

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhes sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhes sgrogs par byed do //
translated: But in words he says, “I will give you the going forth, I will give you ordination.”🔽He makes them live together with those who are not monks, and he makes them serve and attend upon them.

original: de dag dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / slob ma gang dag yin pa de yang rtag par rgyun du bsnyen bkur dang ; yongs su spyad pas de dag gi sems srung du 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / slob ma gang dag yin pa de yang rtag par rgyun du bsnyen bkur dang ; yongs su spyad pas de dag gi sems srung du 'jug go //
translated: He makes them guard the minds of those who are his companions and disciples.

original: de dag de g-yel na dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: de dag de g-yel na dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed la /
translated: He is pleased with those who are negligent, and he is pleased with those who are helpful and agreeable.

original: mi g-yel ba gzhan dag la ni de lta mi byed do //🔽de dag dge slong gang rmad grags che ba chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa dang ldan pa de la bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: mi g-yel ba gzhan dag la ni de lta mi byed do // de dag dge slong gang rmad grags che ba chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa dang ldan pa de la bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: But he is not pleased with those who are not negligent.🔽He serves and honors those monks who are famous and who have acquired robes and so on.

original: bla mar byed /🔽rim gro byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed / rim gro byed /
translated: He respects them.🔽He reveres them.

original: mchod par byed kyi /
analyzed: mchod par byed kyi /
translated: He makes offerings to them.

original: de dag dge slong gang rmad grags mi che ba 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de la ni brnyas par byed /
analyzed: de dag dge slong gang rmad grags mi che ba 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de la ni brnyas par byed /
translated: But he despises those monks who are not famous, who have few desires, and so on.

original: khyad du gsod par byed gnod par byed do //
analyzed: khyad du gsod par byed gnod par byed do //
translated: They are contemptuous and harmful.

original: dge 'dun gyi'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi'am /
translated: They use the property of the Saṅgha🔽and the property of individuals.

original: gang zag gi @228b longs spyod la longs spyod pas 'gyod pa chung ba dang / gang zag tshul khrims 'chal pa dag yongs su sdud pa dang / phyogs la 'chags par byed do //
analyzed: gang zag gi @228b longs spyod la longs spyod pas 'gyod pa chung ba dang / gang zag tshul khrims 'chal pa dag yongs su sdud pa dang / phyogs la 'chags par byed do //
translated: They have little regret, they associate with people who have faulty morality, and they confess their sins to the directions.

original: kha cig ni 'gyod pa chung ba dang / 'gyod pa ha cang che bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'gyod pa chung ba dang / 'gyod pa ha cang che bar byed do //
translated: Some have little regret, and some have excessive regret.

original: phal cher grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang ; rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i don du thos pa 'dzin par byed kyi /
analyzed: phal cher grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang ; rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i don du thos pa 'dzin par byed kyi /
translated: They study in order to gain fame, reputation, praise, gain, and honor,

original: bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i don du ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i don du ma yin te /
translated: not in order to tame themselves.

original: dus kyi mtha'i nyan thos rnams ni de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha'i nyan thos rnams ni de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The listeners at the end of the eon will be endowed with these and other similar kinds of defiled qualities.

original: ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bstan pa nub tu nye ba'i dus kyi tshe na ni phal cher lus zhigs te shi ba'i 'og tu yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba /
analyzed: ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bstan pa nub tu nye ba'i dus kyi tshe na ni phal cher lus zhigs te shi ba'i 'og tu yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba /
translated: When the Teacher has passed into Nirvana and the Doctrine is about to disappear, most people will be in a state of physical decay and will fall into the lower realms after death.

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the Teacher has entered into complete nirvāṇa and the teaching is in decline, they are mostly born in the lower realms, in the hells, after the dissolution of their bodies at death.

original: nyan thos dus bzang por skyes pa ni de las bzlog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos rnams dang ldan par rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: nyan thos dus bzang por skyes pa ni de las bzlog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos rnams dang ldan par rig par bya ste ;
translated: The disciples who are born at a good time are endowed with the qualities of non-affliction.

original: ston pa mngon su gyur cing bstan pa la chu bur ma byung la /
analyzed: ston pa mngon su gyur cing bstan pa la chu bur ma byung la /
translated: When the Teacher is present and the teaching is not in decline,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gsar du byung ba'i dus kyi tshe na ni phal cher lus zhigs te shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gsar du byung ba'i dus kyi tshe na ni phal cher lus zhigs te shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they are mostly born in the higher realms, in the celestial and human worlds, after the dissolution of their bodies at death.

original: kha cig ni yongs su mya ngan las kyang 'da'o ;
analyzed: kha cig ni yongs su mya ngan las kyang 'da'o ;
translated: Some of them even attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: / so so'i skye bo'i nyan thos ni mig ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / so so'i skye bo'i nyan thos ni mig ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The disciples who are ordinary beings are called “those with eyes not yet opened.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba ni mig thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba ni mig thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stream-enterer, the once-returner, and the non-returner are said to have obtained the eye.

original: dgra bcom pa shes rab rnam par grol ba rnams ni mig rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa shes rab rnam par grol ba rnams ni mig rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arhat who is liberated through wisdom is said to have purified the eye.

original: rig pa gsum dang ldan pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba de dag ni mig shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum dang ldan pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba de dag ni mig shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who possess the three knowledges and are liberated through both parts are said to have the extremely pure eye.

original: nyan thos gang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsal kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos gang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsal kyang /
translated: There are also śrāvakas who, even though they have been instructed in the correct way,

original: tshe 'di la mi'i chos las bla ma mi 'thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mi'i chos las bla ma mi 'thob pa yang yod do //
translated: do not attain a higher state than a human one in this life.

original: nyan thos gang tshe 'di la mi'i chos las bla ma dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par nus shing mthu yod kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos gang tshe 'di la mi'i chos las bla ma dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par nus shing mthu yod kyang /
translated: There are also śrāvakas who, even though they are able and have the power to attain a higher state than a human one in this life, the fruit of a spiritual practitioner,

original: bag med pa'i rgyus mi 'thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: bag med pa'i rgyus mi 'thob pa yang yod do //
translated: do not attain it due to heedlessness.

original: zla ba lta bu'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ni nyan thos rnams la dad par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: zla ba lta bu'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ni nyan thos rnams la dad par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: The four in the Moon-like Sutra are the teachings that cause śrāvakas to have faith.

original: de dag skye bo'i tshogs kyis mthong ngam thos na /🔽lus dang / ngag dang / yid rnams kyis @229a * //
analyzed: de dag skye bo'i tshogs kyis mthong ngam thos na / lus dang / ngag dang / yid rnams kyis @229a * //
translated: When people see or hear them,

original: bsod nams mang du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams mang du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will generate much merit with their body, speech, and mind.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: They are: to abide in morality, to be restrained by the vows of individual liberation, to have perfect ritual actions, to have perfect spheres of activity, to regard even the slightest misdeed as a matter of fear,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te /
translated: to take up the bases of training,🔽and to train in them.

original: slob pa zhes mdo las ji skad gsungs pa de ni chos dang po yin no //🔽gzhan yang 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: slob pa zhes mdo las ji skad gsungs pa de ni chos dang po yin no // gzhan yang 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: As it says in the sutra, “The first is to take up the training.”🔽Moreover, the second is to praise the qualities of fewness of wishes and contentment,

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bsngags pa rjod par byed ces gsungs pa'i bar de ni chos gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bsngags pa rjod par byed ces gsungs pa'i bar de ni chos gnyis pa yin no //
translated: up to the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: gzhan yang nges pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la mi 'tshe ba'i rang bzhin can dang / dge slong rnams kyang de dang lhan cig gnas par dga' ba dang / shes nas dad pa bzhi dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa de ni chos gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang nges pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la mi 'tshe ba'i rang bzhin can dang / dge slong rnams kyang de dang lhan cig gnas par dga' ba dang / shes nas dad pa bzhi dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa de ni chos gsum pa yin no //
translated: And he has the four kinds of confidence born of knowledge. This is the third quality.

original: gzhan yang rnyed pa la chags pa med pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa med pa dang / gzhan la snying brtse ba dang / dge ba mi spyoms pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan yod pa de dag gis de gzhan dag gis bdag la 'di ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa yin no zhes shes par gyur na ci ma rung snyam du gzhan las shes kyi khe yongs su mi tshol ba zhes gsungs pa
analyzed: gzhan yang rnyed pa la chags pa med pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa med pa dang / gzhan la snying brtse ba dang / dge ba mi spyoms pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan yod pa de dag gis de gzhan dag gis bdag la 'di ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa yin no zhes shes par gyur na ci ma rung snyam du gzhan las shes kyi khe yongs su mi tshol ba zhes gsungs pa
translated: Moreover, he is not attached to gain, he is not attached to honors, he has compassion for others, he does not boast of his virtues, he confesses his sins, and he thinks, “Wouldn’t it be good if others would know that I have such and such virtues!” He does not seek profit from others.

original: ni / chos bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ni / chos bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth quality.

original: nyan thos khyim rnams su 'gro bar 'dod pas ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum spangs pa khyim rnams su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos khyim rnams su 'gro bar 'dod pas ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum spangs pa khyim rnams su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The disciple who wishes to go to the homes of the faithful should go to their homes, having abandoned three secondary defilements:

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: mdza' pa shes kyi khyim yongs su 'dzin pa dang / khyim la ser sna byed pa dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' pa shes kyi khyim yongs su 'dzin pa dang / khyim la ser sna byed pa dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: 1. the secondary defilement of being attached to the homes of friends, 2. the secondary defilement of being miserly with the homes, and 3. the secondary defilement of giving the Dharma with a mind attached to material things.

original: de la nyan thos ni rnam pa drug gis mdza' bshes kyi khyim yongs su 'dzin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khyim du 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: de la nyan thos ni rnam pa drug gis mdza' bshes kyi khyim yongs su 'dzin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khyim du 'gro bar byed de /
translated: The disciple goes to the homes of the faithful, having abandoned the secondary defilements in six ways:🔽1. He goes sometimes, not too often. 2. He is not attached to the things he sees there, and is ashamed if attachment arises. 3. He is not greedy, not starting to beg for robes, etc. in the wrong way.

original: res 'ga' 'gro zhing yang dang yang du ma yin pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la tshul bzhin ma yin pas mtshan mar gzung ba las 'dor chags skyes pas ngo tsha ba dang / log pas chos gos la sogs pa @229b slong zhing yongs su tshol ba las brtsams nas spyi rtol med pa dang /
analyzed: res 'ga' 'gro zhing yang dang yang du ma yin pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la tshul bzhin ma yin pas mtshan mar gzung ba las 'dor chags skyes pas ngo tsha ba dang / log pas chos gos la sogs pa @229b slong zhing yongs su tshol ba las brtsams nas spyi rtol med pa dang /
translated: 4. He is not a braggart, not praising himself and disparaging others.

original: mu cor mi smra ba dang / thug thub mi byed pa dang / legs par bsdams pa dang / lus legs par sbas pa dang / lus kyi reg par bya ba ma yin pa la mi reg pa dang / 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa dang /🔽bza' bar bya ba ma yin par mi bza' ba dang / btung bar bya ba ma yin par mi 'thung ba dang / blang bar bya ba ma yin par mi len pa dang / dben ba la gzhol ba dang / dben pa la 'bab pa dang /
analyzed: mu cor mi smra ba dang / thug thub mi byed pa dang / legs par bsdams pa dang / lus legs par sbas pa dang / lus kyi reg par bya ba ma yin pa la mi reg pa dang / 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa dang / bza' bar bya ba ma yin par mi bza' ba dang / btung bar bya ba ma yin par mi 'thung ba dang / blang bar bya ba ma yin par mi len pa dang / dben ba la gzhol ba dang / dben pa la 'bab pa dang /
