original: rnam pa drug kho nas khyim la ser sna byed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khyim du 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa drug kho nas khyim la ser sna byed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khyim du 'gro bar byed de /
translated: He goes to the home having abandoned the six types of miserliness that are secondary defilements.

original: khyim du son pa na sems can gyi dngos po la chags pa med cing lhag par chags pa med pa dang / sems can gyi dngos po la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: khyim du son pa na sems can gyi dngos po la chags pa med cing lhag par chags pa med pa dang / sems can gyi dngos po la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: When he arrives at the home, he is not attached to the things of sentient beings, nor is he attached to the things of the house.🔽Just as he is with the things of sentient beings, so too he is with the things of gain and the things of honor.🔽He is not pained by not getting things, nor is he displeased.

original: rnyed pa'i dngos po dang / bkur sti'i dngos po la yang de bzhin pa dang / ma rnyed pas sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i dngos po dang / bkur sti'i dngos po la yang de bzhin pa dang / ma rnyed pas sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as he is with not getting things, so too he is with not getting honor.

original: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma rnyed pa la ji lta ba bzhin du bkur sti med pa la yang de bzhin pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rnyed pa la sems snyoms pas /
analyzed: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma rnyed pa la ji lta ba bzhin du bkur sti med pa la yang de bzhin pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rnyed pa la sems snyoms pas /
translated: He is impartial in his mind with regard to the gain of self and others.

original: bdag gi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir bdag gi bsngags pa mi brjod pa dang / gzhan dag gi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i bar chad bya ba'i phyir bsngags pa ma yin pa mi brjod par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir bdag gi bsngags pa mi brjod pa dang / gzhan dag gi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i bar chad bya ba'i phyir bsngags pa ma yin pa mi brjod par 'gro ba'o //
translated: He goes to the house without praising himself for the sake of gain and honor, and without disparaging others for the sake of gain and honor.🔽He goes to the house with a mind free from the six kinds of impurity, and with a mind free from the six kinds of craving.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.

original: rnam pa drug kho nas zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khyim du 'gro ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug kho nas zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khyim du 'gro ste /
translated: He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.

original: dad par gyur nas lhag par byed par re ba med cing /
analyzed: dad par gyur nas lhag par byed par re ba med cing /
translated: He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.

original: nges par 'byung ba nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas 'gro ba dang / gzhan dag la rnam pa gsum gyis dge ba'i chos bsam pa nye bar bzhag nas 'gro bar byed de /🔽gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas 'gro ba dang / gzhan dag la rnam pa gsum gyis dge ba'i chos bsam pa nye bar bzhag nas 'gro bar byed de / gsum gang zhe na /
translated: He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.🔽He goes to the house without craving for gain and honor, and without craving for friends.🔽He goes to the house without craving for life, and without craving for the Dharma.
He goes to the house without craving for gain

original: ba nye bar bsgrub pa dang / sdug bsngal bstsal ba dang / gus par byas te nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par 'dod pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par bya ba dang /🔽grol ba'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyi chos nyid bzang po kho na la brten nas mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mor gtogs pa brdar btags pa'i chos 'dzin par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: ba nye bar bsgrub pa dang / sdug bsngal bstsal ba dang / gus par byas te nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par 'dod pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par bya ba dang / grol ba'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyi chos nyid bzang po kho na la brten nas mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mor gtogs pa brdar btags pa'i chos 'dzin par 'dod pa'am /
translated: 1) to make them practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, 2) to liberate those who are suffering from the suffering of birth, etc.,

original: klog par 'dod pa rnams la dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: klog par 'dod pa rnams la dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: 3) to hold the Dharma that is included in the Sutras, Vinaya and Abhidharma, which is the good reality of the Dharma that is the nature of liberation, for those who wish to hold or read it, in order to make the holy Dharma last a long time.

original: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po spangs pas ni ma 'dres par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po spangs pas ni ma 'dres par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among these, by abandoning the first secondary defilement, one abides without mixing.

original: gnyis pa spangs pas ni zang zing gi longs spyod legs par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa spangs pas ni zang zing gi longs spyod legs par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning the second, one obtains the enjoyment of material things well.

original: gsum pa spangs pas ni chos kyi longs spyod legs par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa spangs pas ni chos kyi longs spyod legs par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and by the third, one obtains the enjoyment of the Dharma.🔽The explanation of the Kṣudraka Collection Sutra:

original: btsa tsha ka'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa ni nyan thos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la brtson pas ni mdor bsdu na gnas gsum yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: btsa tsha ka'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa ni nyan thos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la brtson pas ni mdor bsdu na gnas gsum yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: The sravaka who strives for affliction and purification should understand in brief three topics:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas las yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa las yongs su shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas las yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa las yongs su shes par bya ba dang /
translated: the basis of affliction and purification, what is to be understood from the basis of affliction and purification, and what is to be understood from affliction and affliction.

original: rnam par byang ba rnam par byang ba las yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnam par byang ba las yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: and what is to be understood from purification and purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of affliction and purification?

original: lus 'di ni gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes rgyas par mdo las gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes rgyas par mdo las gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: This body is a gross material form, derived from the primary elements, as is said in detail in the sutra.

original: de ni byis pa mi mkhas pa ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ni byis pa mi mkhas pa ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: It is the basis of defilement for the ignorant, the unwise, those who are not learned, those who are not in possession of the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: mdzangs pa mkhas pa rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni rnam par byang ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: mdzangs pa mkhas pa rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni rnam par byang ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: It is the basis of purification for the wise, the learned, those who are in possession of the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is defilement?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byis pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba bya ba'i phyir sngar rjes su brtags shing bsams nas /
analyzed: byis pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba bya ba'i phyir sngar rjes su brtags shing bsams nas /
translated: The ignorant, the unwise, those who are not learned, those who are not in possession of the knowledge of the noble ones, having previously examined and reflected upon the body,

original: phyis lus dang / ngag dang sems kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pas /
analyzed: phyis lus dang / ngag dang sems kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pas /
translated: subsequently commit wholesome and unwholesome actions by means of the body, speech and mind.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar lus 'dod pa dang / mi @230b 'dod po gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa mod pa mngon par 'gyur par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar lus 'dod pa dang / mi @230b 'dod po gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa mod pa mngon par 'gyur par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, they create the body, which is the basis of the five destinies, of both the desirable and undesirable, of both the agreeable and disagreeable.

original: rnam par byang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is purification?

original: bslab pa gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la gtso bo yin pa rig pa bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la gtso bo yin pa rig pa bya ste /
translated: The two trainings should be understood as the most important factors in the side of purification.

original: 'di ltar bslab pa gcig ni de bzhin nyid kyi shes pa'i rten gyi bya byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bslab pa gcig ni de bzhin nyid kyi shes pa'i rten gyi bya byed la /
translated: Thus, one training is the basis for the knowledge of reality,

original: cig shos ni nyon mongs pa dang 'dral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni nyon mongs pa dang 'dral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the other is for the elimination of the afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba de yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba de yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: That purification, in brief,

original: rgya las rab tu dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: rgya las rab tu dbye ba yin te /
translated: is distinguished by five causes.

original: rgyu lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five causes?

original: ston pa dang / sgrub pa po dang / sgrub pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bas so //
analyzed: ston pa dang / sgrub pa po dang / sgrub pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bas so //
translated: The teacher, the practitioner, the practice, the elimination of the secondary afflictions that are adverse to the higher mind, and the elimination of the secondary afflictions that are adverse to the higher wisdom.

original: de la ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the Tathagata.

original: sgrub pa po ni nyan thos dbang po yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni nyan thos dbang po yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: The practitioner is the sravaka whose faculties are mature.

original: de ni shin tu yid gzhungs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni shin tu yid gzhungs pa yang yin no //
translated: He is also of very sharp faculties.

original: sgrub pa ni bden pa zhes pas bsdus pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni bden pa zhes pas bsdus pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Cultivation is the wisdom included in the passage the truth of the path,

original: de ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the unsurpassed antidote for abandoning the defilements.

original: chos bzhin ni lhag pa'i sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhin ni lhag pa'i sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The dharmas are the secondary defilements that are adverse to the higher wisdom.

original: rab tu dben pa gnas pa'i sgrib pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mi bzod pa'i khro ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pa'i phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sngon spyad de myong ba'i yul rnams rjes su dran pa'i kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags bslab pa gtong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa gnas pa'i sgrib pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mi bzod pa'i khro ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pa'i phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sngon spyad de myong ba'i yul rnams rjes su dran pa'i kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags bslab pa gtong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: They are: (1) the obscuration to solitude, (2) the anger that does not tolerate instruction and counsel, (3) the envy and avarice that are attached to gain and honor, and (4) the desire that is in conformity with the abandonment of the training and is the discursive thought that recollects the objects of former enjoyments.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: The dharmas that are secondary defilements adverse to the higher wisdom are three in number.

original: dang po kho nar brda'i tshul gyis chos kyi don ma rtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang / chos kyi don rtogs kyang so so'i skye bor gyur pas bden pa rnams la som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom ma spangs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: dang po kho nar brda'i tshul gyis chos kyi don ma rtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang / chos kyi don rtogs kyang so so'i skye bor gyur pas bden pa rnams la som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom ma spangs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: First, there is the ignorance of not understanding the meaning of the Dharma through the method of symbols, and second, there is the ignorance of not abandoning doubt, uncertainty, and hesitation with regard to the truths, even though one understands the meaning of the Dharma, because one is an ordinary person.

original: slob pa bzhi mthong ba'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: slob pa bzhi mthong ba'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: And third, there is the pride of thinking “I am” which is the counteragent to the wisdom included in the path of cultivation of the four who see the truths.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pas /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pas /
translated: By abandoning these secondary mental afflictions,

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'thob par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'thob par rig par bya ste /
translated: one should know that one attains the fruit of arhatship through the purity of superior mind and superior wisdom.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid de @231a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid de @231a * //
translated: That arhatship

original: ni rnam par byang ba'i mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ni rnam par byang ba'i mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: should be seen as the supreme purity.

original: nyan thos kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas de yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas de yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: And that basis of the afflictions and purity of the śrāvakas, in brief,

original: rgyu gsum gyis yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood through three causes:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / nyes dmigs kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / nyes dmigs kyis so //
translated: through its nature, through its cause, and through its faults.

original: mi'i lus 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: mi'i lus 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: This human body is distinguished by two characteristics:

original: gzugs can gyis ni de las gzhan pa'i lus thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can gyis ni de las gzhan pa'i lus thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: through its grossness, it is distinguished by its general characteristic, since all other bodies are included in it.

original: rags pas ni so so rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: rags pas ni so so rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Through its coarseness, it is distinguished by its individual characteristic,

original: mi gsal ba nyid kyis lha'i lus dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mi gsal ba nyid kyis lha'i lus dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: since it is not like the divine body, because it is not clear.

original: / de'i rgyu yang rnam pa gsum ste /🔽lus kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / de'i rgyu yang rnam pa gsum ste / lus kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Its cause is threefold:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag go //
translated: The cause of the general characteristic of the body is the four great elements.

original: mi'i lus de'i so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽ma skyes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi'i lus de'i so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te / ma skyes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of the individual characteristic of the human body is twofold:

original: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba mer mer po'o //
analyzed: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba mer mer po'o //
translated: The cause of the production of what has not yet occurred is the impure ovum and sperm of the parents.

original: skyes pa gnas pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyes pa gnas pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of the continuation of birth is as follows:

original: 'bras chan dang / zan dron la sogs pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras chan dang / zan dron la sogs pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: it is nourished by rice, barley, etc.

original: de'i nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Its disadvantage is twofold:

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: it is suffering and it is impermanent.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba nyid grang ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba nyid grang ba'i tshe na /
translated: As for its suffering, when it is cold,

original: grang ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po gos kyi gnyen po dang bcas pa dang ; tsha ba'i tshe na tsha ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po khrus kyi gnyen po dang bcas pa dang / lam dang las kyi mtha' yongs su ngal ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: grang ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po gos kyi gnyen po dang bcas pa dang ; tsha ba'i tshe na tsha ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po khrus kyi gnyen po dang bcas pa dang / lam dang las kyi mtha' yongs su ngal ba'i tshe na /
translated: it is suffering because it is the antidote to the suffering of cold, along with the antidote of clothing; when it is hot, it is suffering because it is the antidote to the suffering of heat, along with the antidote of bathing; when one is exhausted from traveling and work,

original: yongs su ngal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po mnye ba'i gnyen po dang bcas pas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po mnye ba'i gnyen po dang bcas pas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it is suffering because it is the antidote to the suffering of exhaustion, along with the antidote of massage.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni lag pa dang / bong pa dang / dbyug pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / mtshon cha'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis mchod pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / 'chi ba'i dus byas pa ni dong du gzhug pa'am /🔽mer bsregs pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni lag pa dang / bong pa dang / dbyug pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / mtshon cha'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis mchod pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / 'chi ba'i dus byas pa ni dong du gzhug pa'am / mer bsregs pa'am /
translated: Impermanence is the object of the hand, the clod and the stick, because it is the object of destruction, because it is the object of worship by the contact of weapons, and because it is the object of being placed in a pit or burned in a fire or cremated by those who have died.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis kun du bza' ba'i phyir dang / de nyid ni nyi ma dang / rlung gis yongs su skam par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin par rig @231b par bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis kun du bza' ba'i phyir dang / de nyid ni nyi ma dang / rlung gis yongs su skam par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin par rig @231b par bya'o //
translated: Impermanence is known as the quality of being destroyed by the contact of the hand, the clod, and the stick; the quality of being worshipped by the contact of the weapon; the quality of being buried in a pit or burned by fire or devoured by various animals born in the animal realm; the quality of being dried up by the sun and the wind; and the quality of being scattered and destroyed.

original: de la 'dus pa rnam par 'bral pa ni rnam par 'thor ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dus pa rnam par 'bral pa ni rnam par 'thor ba yin no //
translated: The separation of the assembled factors is the scattering.

original: rnam par 'thor ba nyid gyur nas /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba nyid gyur nas /
translated: Having been scattered,

original: mthar thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par bral ba ni rnam par 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par bral ba ni rnam par 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The final and complete separation from all of them is their destruction.

original: dmigs pa'i sems las brtsams nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sems las brtsams nas /
translated: With regard to the mind that has an object,🔽it is said:

original: ming gis thams cad zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: ming gis thams cad zil gyis gnon //
translated: Namely, all are overcome by name;

original: ming las lhag pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: ming las lhag pa yod ma yin //
translated: there is nothing higher than name.

original: ming chos gcig gi dbang rjes su //
analyzed: ming chos gcig gi dbang rjes su //
translated: Name is the one dharma that follows

original: thams cad 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
translated: the power of all.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam par byang ba'i rgyu brtag pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid brtag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu brtags pas gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam par byang ba'i rgyu brtag pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid brtag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu brtags pas gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena are taught by investigating the causes of purification, investigating their characteristics, and investigating the causes of affliction.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med pa las ni ming gi phung po bzhi po dag yongs su shes pas /
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med pa las ni ming gi phung po bzhi po dag yongs su shes pas /
translated: With regard to the selflessness of persons, by understanding the four aggregates of name,

original: rang gi yul gyi mtshan ma thams cad spangs pas zil gyis gnon la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos la bdag med par yongs su shes pa las ni tha snyad las byung ba'i ming yongs su shes pas /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi mtshan ma thams cad spangs pas zil gyis gnon la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos la bdag med par yongs su shes pa las ni tha snyad las byung ba'i ming yongs su shes pas /
translated: One overcomes all objective signs by abandoning all one’s objects. And from the complete knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena, which is the imagined reality, one completely knows the name that arises from social convention.

original: de la rten gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de la rten gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: One overcomes all signs of the basis.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi po dag las logs shig na bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi po dag las logs shig na bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs la /
translated: One does not apprehend any entity that has the characteristics of a self apart from the four formless aggregates.

original: tha snyad las byung ba'i ming las logs shig na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tha snyad las byung ba'i ming las logs shig na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs so //
translated: And one does not apprehend any entity that has the characteristics of the imagined reality apart from the name that arises from social convention.

original: de gnyis ka yongs su ma shes na yul gyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kun nas ldang ba dang / rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yongs su ma shes na yul gyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kun nas ldang ba dang / rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not completely know those two, then all the signs of objects will arise and continue to arise in all the afflictions.

original: yul gyi mtshan ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the defilements of the signs of the object arise through the power of that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de las dgongs nas /
translated: The Lord, intending this, said:

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa las ni bdag tu 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa las ni bdag tu 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: “From the apprehension of the reality of dharmas arises the apprehension of self.

original: de rtogs pas ni de yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pas ni de yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By understanding that, that is understood.

original: de rtogs na de yang ldog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: de rtogs na de yang ldog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa drug pa /
translated: When that is understood, that ceases.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni bden pa bzhi po 'di dag yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni bden pa bzhi po 'di dag yin par gsungs te /
translated: The Lord said that the four noble truths are the object of observation for purifying the afflictions of the śrāvakas.

original: @232a * // sdug bsngal la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: @232a * // sdug bsngal la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are the four truths of suffering and so on, as before.

original: gal te bden pa yang dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te bden pa yang dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If the truths are not mistaken because they are reality,

original: de ltar na phyi rol pa rnams kyi lta ba'i rnam pa log par mos pa gang dag yin pa dang / log par smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na ma yin pa dang / log pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol pa rnams kyi lta ba'i rnam pa log par mos pa gang dag yin pa dang / log par smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na ma yin pa dang / log pa dang /
translated: They are not real, not the way things are, mistaken, and

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin pas /
translated: erroneous.

original: de dag ji ltar na bden pas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya /🔽gal te ma bsdus na ni des na de dag tu phyi ma la yang 'byung ba mngon par 'grub par byed pa /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar na bden pas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya / gal te ma bsdus na ni des na de dag tu phyi ma la yang 'byung ba mngon par 'grub par byed pa /
translated: How can they be included in the truth?

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are not included, then they would not be causes of suffering that lead to future rebirth.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na ma yin pa dang / log pa dang / phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang de dag ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na ma yin pa dang / log pa dang / phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang de dag ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Although they are not real, not the way things are, mistaken, and erroneous, they should be said to be included in the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de dag ni log pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni log pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although they are included in error,

original: 'on kyang log pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de kho nas de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas yang dag pa dang / de kho na dang ma log pa dang / phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa yin no //🔽mi rtag pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang log pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de kho nas de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas yang dag pa dang / de kho na dang ma log pa dang / phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa yin no // mi rtag pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: nevertheless, because of the very characteristic of error, they are real and suchness, and are not unreal or inverted, since they are the nature of suffering and the cause of suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of impermanence should be understood in two ways:

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul las brtsams nas med pa'i don dang / mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul las brtsams nas med pa'i don dang / mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pa'i don gyis so //
translated: from the point of view of the Mahayana and from the point of view of the Sravakayana, it means nonexistence and the destruction of signs.

original: sdug bsngal gyi don yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of suffering should be understood in two ways:

original: med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi gnas ngan len gyi don dang / tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi gnas ngan len gyi don dang / tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of the term “unreality” is twofold: the meaning of the term “unreality” is the negative reflex of the instinct for the imagined reality of the non-existent, and the meaning of the term “unreality” is the appearance of the signs of birth, etc.,

original: stong pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the term “void” is also twofold:

original: gang zag gi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i mtshan ma'i don dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i mtshan ma'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gang zag gi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i mtshan ma'i don dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i mtshan ma'i don gyis so //
translated: the meaning of the term “void” is the sign of the individual selflessness, and the meaning of the term “void” is the sign of the objective selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /🔽theg pa chen po'i tshul dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste / theg pa chen po'i tshul dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul las brtsams nas /
translated: The meaning of the term “selflessness” is also twofold:

original: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'i don dang / gang zag gi ngo bo nyid la @232b bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'i don gyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'i don dang / gang zag gi ngo bo nyid la @232b bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'i don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of the term “selflessness” is the sign of the selflessness of the person, and the meaning of the term “selflessness” is the sign of the selflessness of the dharmas.

original: bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The teaching is twofold:

original: mi rtag par bstan pa dang / thog ma med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag par bstan pa dang / thog ma med par bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of impermanence, and the teaching of beginninglessness.

original: rtogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The realization is also twofold:

original: 'dus byas kyi khams rtogs pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams rtogs pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams rtogs pa'o //
translated: the realization of the compounded element and the realization of the uncompounded element.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is impermanent is suffering.

original: rgyu lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood through five causes:

original: yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang yin te /
translated: through possession,

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams kyi gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams kyi gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the possession of the negative reflex action of impermanent compounded things.

original: chos nyid las kyang yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid las kyang yin te /
translated: Through reality,

original: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the reality of the suffering of birth, etc.

original: rjes su 'brel pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa las kyang yin te /
translated: Through connection,

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the connection with the three kinds of suffering.

original: rgyu las kyang yin te /
analyzed: rgyu las kyang yin te /
translated: Through cause,

original: rmongs pa'i spyod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i spyod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of being the cause of the conduct of the ignorant.

original: mngon par zhen pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las kyang yin te /
translated: Through adherence,🔽because of the adherence to the self and what belongs to the self.

original: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the inverted perception.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba yang rgyu lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba yang rgyu lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The statement, “That which is suffering is selfless” should be understood through five reasons:

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba dag las de don gzhan du gyur par mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de dag gi rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / zad pa dang skye ba'i rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba dag las de don gzhan du gyur par mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de dag gi rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / zad pa dang skye ba'i rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: because it is not perceived as a separate object from the suffering of the formative forces, because it is dependent on other conditions, because it is devoid of movement, because it is subject to the continuity of destruction and origination,

original: phan tshun gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is mutually dependent.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de thams cad mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod pa dang mi mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de thams cad mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod pa dang mi mthun pa yin la /
translated: That which is suffering is not desired, is not attractive, is suffering, is a misfortune, and is not agreeable.

original: mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod pa dang / mi mthun pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod pa dang / mi mthun pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all that is not desired, not beautiful, suffering, harmful, and disagreeable the truth of suffering?

original: re zhig mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod pa dang / mi mthun pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnod pa dang / mi mthun pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever is not desired, not beautiful, suffering, harmful, and disagreeable is to be regarded as the truth of suffering.
